title: Customer Service Representative for E-Commerce Account
description:
Grow Your Career with RingCould



RingCould is looking for driven individuals to join our Customer Service team. Learn new skills, collaborate with a supportive team, and build a career you can be proud of.



If you’re organized, quick to learn, eager to grow, and excel in a fast-paced setting, there’s a place for you on our team.



Key Responsibilities:

• Provide customer support via phone, chat, and

• Assist customers with orders, questions, and product issues

• Transform customer concerns into meaningful solutions

• Stay up to date on products, resources, and team guidelines



What We Are Looking For

• 1+ year of customer service experience

• Strong English communication (neutral or US accent preferred)

• Familiarity with eCommerce platforms like Amazon or Shopify

• Experience with tools like Zendesk, Zoho, or RingCentral a plus

• Reliable internet and quiet home workspace

• Backup device and power source



What We Offer

• Earn PHP 18,000 to 25,000 per month

• Permanent work from home setup

• Work with well-known brands like Amazon, Walmart, Euhomy, and more

• Supportive team culture that encourages growth and collaboration

• Training, mentorship, and clear opportunities to level up your career



Ready to join our team? Apply now by filling out the form here:

title: Social Media Manager + Digital Designer + Content Creator + Paid Ads Specialist (Meta + TikTok | Luxury Brand)
description:
Contractor Retainer | Weekly Pay | Long-Term Commitment REQUIRED



McGee Entertainment is a premium live entertainment company delivering luxury weddings and events across Australia — and we’re expanding into new markets.



We’re looking for a true all-rounder (“unicorn”) who can own social media management, digital design, content creation, short-form video editing, asset creation, blog publishing, and paid ads management across Meta + TikTok.



You’re equal parts creative and performance-minded: your work looks premium and drives enquiries.







**Contractor Retainer + Pay (Weekly)**



Hours: approx. 10 hours per week (40 hours per month retainer)

Rate: $9 USD/hour

Monthly retainer: $360 USD (40 
 paid weekly via EasyPay ($83/week)

Timesheets: Clockify (time tracking + reporting)

Payment method: EasyPay (OnlineJobs.ph)

Overtime: paid at $9/hr for approved additional hours

Hours are flexible/asynchronous, as long as deadlines and priorities are met

Long-term commitment is a MUST (please only apply if you want to stay long-term)







**What You’ll Own (Ongoing Support)**



1) Social Media Management

Help manage our channels (primarily Instagram + TikTok; others as required)

Maintain a consistent posting rhythm and brand voice

Turn raw footage and updates into polished, ready-to-post content

Keep content organised and easy for our team to review/approve



2) Digital Design + Asset Creation (Luxury Aesthetic)

Create premium assets as needed: posts, carousels, stories, promos, testimonials, package spotlights

Maintain a modern luxury look (clean layouts, strong typography, tasteful design)

Work from brand references and keep everything visually cohesive



3) Short-Form Video Editing (Reels + TikTok)

Edit vertical video content from real performance footage (music/events)

Strong hooks, pacing, captions, and clean modern cuts

Bonus if you can edit to music/performance 
nts (timing matters)



4) Paid Ads Management (Meta + TikTok) — MUST HAVE PROVEN RESULTS

Build, launch, manage and optimise campaigns (not “boosting posts”)

Develop and test creative angles, hooks, formats, and iterations

Understand how to drive enquiries/leads for a premium service brand

Provide weekly performance notes: what’s working, what’s not, what we test next



5) TikTok Setup + TikTok Ads (Immediate Priority)

Set up TikTok properly (profile, content pillars, posting rhythm)

Bring a Gen Z approach to hooks, trends, pacing and native-style creatives (while keeping a luxury finish)

Launch and optimise TikTok ads from the beginning



6) Blog Publishing + Squarespace (Must Have)

Publish blog posts and update content on our Squarespace website as required

Confident with Squarespace updates (swap imagery, add sections, embed video, basic edits)

Keep pages looking premium and on-brand



7) Bonus Tools (Ideal)

Experience with Madgicx (often misheard as “MagicX”) or similar ad tools is ideal







**What We’re Looking For**



You must have:

-A strong portfolio showing luxury-level design + short-form video

-Proven Meta ads results (must show evidence)

-Proven TikTok ads results (must show evidence)

-High attention to detail (spelling, formatting, brand consistency)

-Clear communication and reliability

-Ability to work independently and take ownership

-Long-term commitment is a MUST

-Advantageous: experience with music, events, weddings, hospitality, or performance-based content.







**Hiring Timeline (IMPORTANT)**



-Job ad open: Friday 13 February to Thursday 19 February

-Shortlisted candidates contacted: Friday 20 February

-Interviews: 30-minute Zoom interview on Monday 23 February or Tuesday 24 February

-Candidate selected: Wednesday 25 February







**To Apply (Please Include All)**



-Your timezone + typical availability

-Portfolio links (design + short-form video examples)

-Meta ads proof/results (screenshots or a short case study)

-TikTok ads proof/results (screenshots or a short case study)

-Confirm you can commit to ~10 hours per week / 40 hours per month ongoing and that you’re seeking a long-term contractor role



Answer these:

Q1: What makes content feel “luxury” (not cheap or templated)?

Q2: Share 5 content ideas you’d create first for a premium entertainment brand

Q3: What’s your process for testing ads creative and finding winners?



**Applications without portfolio links and Meta/TikTok ads proof will not be considered.**

title: Web Developer (GoDaddy to Hostinger Migration)
description:
About the Role



We are looking for an experienced Web Developer to assist with migrating our website from GoDaddy’s web platform to Hostinger. This is a project-based role requiring strong technical expertise in website migration, hosting environments, and platform optimization.



Key Responsibilities



Migrate existing website from GoDaddy Web Platform to Hostinger

Ensure full functionality, performance, and security post-migration

Transfer domain, databases, files, and
 configurations (if applicable)

Optimize website speed and performance on Hostinger

Conduct testing to ensure no downtime or broken links

Provide post-migration support for troubleshooting



Requirements



Proven experience with website migrations (GoDaddy to Hostinger preferred)

Strong knowledge of hosting environments, DNS configuration, and cPanel

Experience with WordPress (if applicable) or custom-built websites

Understanding of website security best practices

Ability to complete the project with minimal downtime

Strong communication skills



Nice to Have



Experience rebuilding or optimizing websites during migration

Basic SEO knowledge to ensure rankings are not affected



Deliverables



Fully migrated and functioning website on Hostinger

Confirmed domain and
 configuration

Backup of original website files

Documentation of migration steps completed



If you have successfully handled similar migrations, please send your portfolio and a brief outline of your approach.

Also include your expected salary for this Gig.

title: Senior Graphic Designer -  Long Term Goals
description:
Work Schedule: Monday–Friday | 8 hours/day | 40 hours/week

Salary: Negotiable based on experience, starting rate $600+ per month



DO NOT APPLY if you are not available for 40 hours per week.

This is a full-time role only.



About the Role

We are hiring a Senior Graphic Designer to join our creative team. This role requires strong attention to detail, excellent design taste, and technical execution across both print and digital platforms.



We are looking for someone who understands design systems, layouts, grids, typography, and consistency, and who can translate raw concepts or sketches into polished, production-ready designs.



This is not a junior or template-based role.



Responsibilities

• Design for print and digital platforms

• Translate rough sketches and ideas into refined final designs



Work on:

• Branding & visual identity

• Packaging design

• Web and
 layouts

• Logos

• Static and animated banner ads

• Simple animations (mostly Canva)

• Maintain and improve existing live designs and assets

• Ensure consistency across all brand and client materials

• Stay updated on current design trends and technology

• Work independently with minimal supervision

• Meet deadlines and follow instructions precisely



Required Skills

• Strong attention to detail

• Solid understanding of layouts, grids, and hierarchy

• Advanced typography skills

• Experience with branding and packaging design

• Photo editing and color management

• Responsive web and
 design

• Concept development



Required Software Knowledge

• Canva

• Google Workspace

Nice to Have (Not Required)

• HTML / CSS knowledge



Portfolio Requirement

• A portfolio is required to be considered! (If you don't have everything complied into a document or a website it is okay, just point me towards past client/projects websites and/or socials and let me know in a short paragraph what did you do for them)



Please do not apply if you cannot provide design samples that show:

• Strong layout and grid usage

• Clean typography

• High-quality execution across multiple formats



Work Environment & Growth

• Full-time, long-term position

• Stable work environment (Philippines team has been in the company since 2017, we value loyalty, ALOT!!)

• Opportunities for growth based on performance and reliability



This role may evolve into expanded responsibilities over time



How to Apply (IMPORTANT) We value applicants who can follow instructions.



Include:

• Your resume

• A link to your portfolio!  If you don't have everything complied into a document or a website it is okay, just point me towards past client/projects websites and/or socials and let me know in a short paragraph what did you do for them



Applications that do not follow these instructions will not be reviewed.

title: Executive Assistant (Operations) for Experienced Online Creator
description:
Are you a smart, reliable, and extremely detail-oriented VA who loves keeping things organized in Clickup? And do you have experience helping online creators with courses and funnels?




 (BHWA) is a well-established aging health and caregiving education website created by me, Dr. Leslie Kernisan, MD. I’m a geriatrician and blogger growing an online membership for people helping aging parents. I also have two YouTube channels and a podcast.



I’m now hiring for a smart and very detail-oriented executive virtual assistant who will be helping me execute, document, coordinate, and problem-solve in all areas of my business.



The role will start at about 20 hours per week, with potential to grow in hours (and in hourly rate!), if you are able to do the job well and take more off my plate. When you get the work done is flexible, but you’ll need to do at least a few hours every weekday.



Please note that I have been running BHWA for 10+ years, I’ve had the same Ph-based VA doing routine tasks and customer service since 2020, and I do have ongoing freelancers to help with things like video editing and complex automations. Although I am always learning and growing, at this point I know my business very well, and I know what works well for me when it comes to VAs.



This role is NOT for someone who just wants to be handed tasks to do. For this executive VA role, I need to find someone very much like me: smart, organized, proactive, and EXTREMELY detail-oriented. Someone who will double-check that things are done correctly (e.g. the links in an
 broadcast), so that I don’t have to. Someone who can figure out why something isn’t working and fix it, so that I don’t have to.



You will also need to be willing and able to document everything you do as you go along; I have found this is critical to running the business long-term. (So if you are the type who likes to go fixing problems but skips documenting what you changed and why, you are not a good fit.)



You must have previous experience with Clickup and Wordpress. Experience with ActiveCampaign, Kajabi, and YouTube is strongly preferred.



You will need to be excellent at following instructions and also resourceful enough to figure things out and solve problems when necessary. During your training phase, you will need to be checking with me often; once we have gotten to know each other and you’ve demonstrated that you can do the work according to my standards, I will be happy to give you more autonomy.



This will be a great steady job for the right person! If you think you are a good fit, please apply.



JOB TITLE

Virtual Executive Assistant

Executive Assistant & Operations Assistant



JOB DETAILS



Compensation

- $8-10/hour (negotiable depending on skills and experience), with the possibility of raising the rate once you have learned the business and are freeing up my time

- Paid every two weeks (or monthly) via Wise



Work hours:

- 3-4 hours every week day, up to 20 hours/week as a start. More may be occasionally needed. Weekly hours can be increased if you are able to take on additional responsibilities.

- My working hours are usually between 9am to 4pm Pacific Time. You do not need to do all your work within this window, but should be available for meetings if requested.

- The company tracks work hours using Hubstaff



Knowledge and experience requirement:

- Experience in task and project coordination using ClickUp

- Experience with online optin forms, basic automations and funnels

- At least one year experience of working-from-home as a virtual assistant, preferably as Executive Assistant

- Excellent problem-solving skills, resilient and determined to find or create solutions.

- A proven work ethic and the ability to anticipate needs, initiate decisions and coordinate the activities of others.

- Experience with data reporting and Excel spreadsheets

- Experience working with our current tech stack is strongly preferred: for BHWA these include Wordpress, ActiveCampaign, Kajabi, OptinMonster, Google analytics, Zapier, YouTube.



Scope of support:

Administrative and operations support to Dr. Leslie Kernisan, founder and principal of Better Health While Aging. Duties may include (but are not limited to):

- Attend, participate and take notes for weekly planning meetings

- Assist Dr. K with documentation of her work and with execution of her various tasks

- Project coordination using Clickup; monitor and communicate project status, ensure that it’s updated and next steps are clear for everyone

- Compile and present status reports

- Monitoring and reporting on key performance indicators

- Contribute to improving our process for handling member registrations, cancellations, and other customer support issues

- Assisting with the creation and organization of registration pages and other logistics, when we run our membership enrollment drives

- Assisting with the Company’s website and related
 subscriber list



HOW TO APPLY

To apply, you must do the following things:

- Make sure your profile in Onlinejobs.ph includes IQ and DISC assessment

- Include the words AGING IS IMPORTANT in the subject line of your message to me

- Send me a cover letter explaining why this position appeals to you and why you think you are an excellent fit



Only candidates who complete all the above will receive responses. Thank you for your interest, I appreciate it!

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Read This Before Applying

This is not a basic virtual assistant role.



If you are looking for simple task lists, calendar management, or repetitive admin work — this is not a fit.



This role exists to create leverage for a fast-moving CEO and COO at a growing U.S.-based marketing agency.



You will operate in a high-context, high-standards environment with frequent switching between hiring, writing, coordination, analytics, and execution.



If you thrive in ambiguity, think in systems, and use AI as a force multiplier — keep reading.



The Mission

Own the flow of information from raw input ? structured system ? finished output so leadership is no longer the bottleneck.

You will turn voice notes, Loom recordings, transcripts, and messy ideas into:

- Clean documents

- Structured hiring pipelines

- Organized dashboards

- Polished communication

- Reliable execution systems



If this role is done well, leadership feels:

- Fewer dropped balls

- Fewer repeated explanations

- Less mental clutter

- Cleaner systems

- Higher quality written output

If that does not happen, the role is not being executed correctly.



Core Areas of Ownership



1. Hiring Pipeline Execution

This is one of the highest-leverage areas.

- You will turn transcripts into:

-- Job descriptions

-- Scorecards

-- Interview questions

-- Must-have vs. nice-to-have lists

- Post jobs

- Track applicants

- Schedule interviews

- Send follow-ups

- Draft offer
s (approved before sending)

- Prepare offer letters from templates

- Coordinate references

- Manage onboarding logistics



You must be comfortable extracting structure fro
ssy conversations using AI tools.



2. “You Speak, They Build” Operations

The Founder communicates in:

- Loom videos

- Slack voice notes

- Call transcripts

- Bullet points



You turn them into:

- SOPs

- Checklists

- Notion docs

- Decision memos

- Organized execution plans

You are responsible for clarity.



3. COO Support & Internal Coordination

You will:

- Maintain executive priority trackers

- Prepare meeting agendas

- Capture notes and action items

- Follow up on commitments

- Build weekly summaries:

-- What moved

-- What’s stuck

-- What needs decision

You must follow up politely but persistently.



4. Travel & Logistics (Business + Personal)

You will own:

- Flights

- Hotels

- Itineraries

- Calendar adjustments

- Expense tracking

- Changes and cancellations

Mistakes here cost real money and time. Accuracy matters.



5. Data Organization & Reporting

You will:

- Clean messy spreadsheets

- Standardize naming conventions

- Structure data so it becomes usable

- Create charts for leadership review

- Maintain simple dashboards in Google Sheets

- Use AI tools to accelerate reporting

- Dashboards must support decisions — not decoration.



6. AI-Enabled Writing & Communication

You will draft:

- Internal announcements

- Client
s

- SOPs

- Hiring documents

- Onboarding materials

- Meeting follow-ups

- Templates



Writing must be:

- Clear

- Direct

- Professional

- No fluff

- Strong written English is mandatory.



Required Skills

You must demonstrate:

- Excellent written English

- Strong organizational ability

- High attention to detail

- Comfort working independently

- Ability to manage multiple workstreams



Proficiency with:

- Google Docs

- Google Sheets

- Calendars

- Slack

- Loom

- ChatGPT / Claude

You must be comfortable using AI daily to increase speed and clarity.



Work Expectations

- Full-time (35 hours/week)

- Minimum 6-hour overlap with US Pacific Time

- Responsive during working hours

- Written updates without prompting

- Issues escalated same day

- Missed deadlines without notice are unacceptable



This Role Is Not For You If:

- You need step-by-step instructions

- You wait to be told what to do

- You dislike writing

- You struggle with ambiguity

- You avoid follow-up

- You prefer repetitive task-only roles



Compensation

- $12,480–$16,640 USD per year

- Paid bi-monthly (1st and 15th)

- Full-time, long-term position

- Annual performance-based raise

- Stable role inside a growing company



What Good Looks Like After 60 Days

Leadership experiences:

- Cleaner systems

- Organized hiring pipelines

- Clear documentation

- Fewer dropped balls

- Less reactive scrambling

- Higher writing quality with less revision

If you are still waiting for instructions after 60 days, this role is not a fit.



Application Instructions (Required)

To be considered, you must include:

- A 3–5 minute Loom video introducing yourself

- Your internet speed (upload & download)

- Confirmation of US PT overlap hours

- A short explanation of how you use AI tools in your daily workflow

Applications missing these will not be reviewed.



What to Expect After Applying

If your application meets the requirements listed above, you will receive a skills assessment within 48 hours. The assessment is a practical exercise based on a real scenario you would encounter in this role. It is designed to take a strong candidate 60–90 minutes. We will evaluate your ability to gather information, organize it clearly, and communicate with a team — not whether you used AI to help. Candidates who score well on the assessment will be invited to a live interview. We respect your time and move quickly. 



Final Note

We are not hiring a helper. We are hiring a high-agency Executive Assistant who thinks like an operator and uses AI as leverage. If you want stability, growth, and real ownership — apply.

title: Personal Virtual Assistant for Business Executive
description:
We're looking for a sharp, reliable Virtual Personal Assistant to help a busy entrepreneur stay fully organized across personal life - health and fitness tracking, travel planning, reservations, errands, research, and daily logistics. You need to be fast, responsive, and always a step ahead. Strong research skills, attention to detail, and high integrity are non-negotiable.



This isn't a gig - it's a long-term partnership. I invest in people who invest in me. That means competitive pay now, raises over time, and real stability. The right person will never have to worry about finding another job. You have my back, I have yours.



---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

WHAT DAY TO DAY LOOKS LIKE



- I send you a photo of my lunch — you estimate macros and log it in my tracking sheet within minutes

- I screenshot my body composition scan — you log every measurement and flag any trends

- I tell you "plan a weekend trip to Tulum for me and my girlfriend" — you come back with flights, hotel, restaurant reservations, and a full itinerary without asking me 20 questions

- Track all my subscriptions and flag me before anything renews so I can cancel what I don't need

- Find me the best cold plunge under $5,000 — compare features, dimensions, cooling systems, warranties, and give me a top 3 with pros and cons

- I want to start a new supplement stack for sleep optimization — research the science, find the best brands, figure out timing and dosages, and put it all in a clean doc I can follow

- I mention I have a headache and haven't been sleeping well — you cross-reference my recent meals and macros to flag if something's off nutritionally before I even ask

- I'm comparing two different health protocols I saw online — break down the science behind both, pros and cons, and tell me which one actually makes sense for my goals

- I got bloodwork back — organize the results in a spreadsheet, flag anything out of range, and research what supplements or dietary changes could help

- I'm training for a specific physical goal — research the best approach, recovery protocols, and adjust my nutrition tracking to match



There are plenty more tasks but hopefully that gives you a real picture of what this role looks like.



---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

WHAT I'M LOOKING FOR



- Proven experience as a personal assistant — this is not an entry-level role

- Fast communicator — responsive throughout 9am-9pm EST, 7 days a week

- Proactive and independent — you figure things out and anticipate needs before being asked

- Strong researcher — you dig deep, not just surface-level Googling

- Organized and detail-oriented — nothing falls through the cracks

- Comfortable using AI tools like Claude for research and efficiency (very important) - means your good at prompting

- Interest in health and fitness — you'll be working with nutrition and body composition data daily

- Honest and direct — if you make a mistake, tell me immediately. I'm understanding, I just need to know

- Takes feedback well and always looking to improve

- Trustworthy and discreet



---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

WHY YOU'D WANT THIS ROLE



Long-term stability — I don't cycle through assistants. I'm looking for someone to grow with for years, not months

I'm a kind, direct, and reasonable person to work for. I don't micromanage. I give you goals and trust you to figure out the how 



Competitive pay with consistent raises as we build together — your growth is tied to mine



Variety every single day — no two days look the same. You'll never be bored



You'll be genuinely valued, not treated like a task robot. I take care of the people who take care of me



Actual work is roughly 3 hours a day — the rest of the time you're on-call but free. You're being paid for availability and reliability, not busywork



You'll learn a ton — health optimization, travel planning, business operations. This role makes you better at everything

If you're the right person and you bring your best every day, this is the last job you'll ever need to find



---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

HOW TO APPLY

- Start your application with the word "organized" so I know you read this



- Record a 2-3 minute Loom video: who you are, your experience as a personal assistant (who you worked for, what you handled, how long), one specific example of a time you anticipated a need before being asked, and why you're looking for a long-term role



- Send examples of past work — itineraries, spreadsheets, trackers, anything that shows how you organize and deliver

title: Creative Video Editor for Travel & Wine Content + AI video ad training included
description:
I’m looking for a creative video editor to help me turn years of backlogged travel footage future travel footage into engaging Reels, TikToks, and YouTube Shorts.

The Opportunity:

This role starts with two immediate projects (general travel content and wine education/wine travel), but if we work well together, you’ll get access to professional AI video training (valued at $5k) and the opportunity to scale your skills and earnings.

The Projects (Starting February-March):

Project 1: Travel Content - I’ve traveled to dozens of countries and have years of footage I’ve never done anything with. I also have two big trips coming up (Dominican Republic next week  and France and Italy in March). I need someone who can take raw travel footage and make it scroll-stopping.

Project 2: Wine Content - Wine education and wine travel content (combining sommelier-level expertise with travel).

If These Go Well (April Onward):

AI Video Ad Training - You’d join me in learning an 8-week AI video ad creation program (valued at $5k, my discounted rate is $2k). We’d learn together how to create humor-leaning video ads for small businesses using cutting-edge AI tools.

Once you master this system, you’d be welcome to take on your own local clients using what you’ve learned. I’d focus on US clients (at higher rates), which means your pay would grow as we scale together.

What I Need Right Now:

Someone who can look at raw footage and immediately see the story. I don’t want to have to explain every edit - I want someone who understands what makes people stop scrolling and can bring creative ideas to the table.

Specifically:

 ? Strong hooks (the first 3 seconds are everything)

 ? Good pacing and retention (keep people watching)

 ? Clean captions and text overlays

 ? Understanding of what performs on Reels/TikTok/Shorts

 ? Fast turnaround - I’m traveling soon and need content posted while it’s timely, not weeks later

What I’m Looking For:

? Creative eye - Can spot interesting 
nts and turn them into engaging stories? Self-starter - Can work with direction but also bring your own ideas? Growth mindset - Excited to learn new AI tools and build high-value skills? Long-term thinker - This starts with travel content, but the goal is to grow together

To Apply - PLEASE INCLUDE:

???? Portfolio: Links to 2-3 Reels, TikToks, or YouTube Shorts you’ve created (travel/lifestyle content preferred but not required)

???? Tools: What editing software do you use? (CapCut, DaVinci Resolve, Premiere, etc.)

? Availability: How many hours per week can you commit?

? Why you: What excites you about this opportunity specifically?

Applications without portfolio links of some kind (even if it’s your personal Instagram) will not be reviewed.

This isn’t just a VA job - it’s a chance to learn high-value skills and grow your earning potential. If that excites you, I’d love to see your work!

title: SHORT FORM VIDEO EDITOR | Flexi Schedule
description:
We’re hiring someone who knows how to turn long-form content into sharp, high-retention short videos for platforms like TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts.



This role is for someone who understands pacing, hooks, and visual rhythm in short-form content, and knows how to edit with intention rather than just cutting clips.



—-----------------------------------------------------------------------------



READ THE ENTIRE JOB LISTING CAREFULLY. The final step of the hiring process will require the candidate to provide at least 1 former employer/team lead reference and at least 1 character reference. These will be verified prior to extending an offer.



--- ABOUT THE TEAM ---

Want to work in a rewarding, fast-paced, start-up atmosphere? Looking for significant growth and performance bonus opportunities? Have a growth mindset, value relationships, and dedicated to getting results? Then we might be a fit!



What is it like to work with us? HEAR FROM OUR TEAM!   





Our Core Values:

1) DELIGHT THE CLIENT:  We consistently exceed expectations by anticipating needs, delivering outstanding service, and creating those “magic 
nts” where every client feels seen and heard.

2) MASTER YOUR CRAFT:  We commit to continuous learning, share our expertise openly, and tackle every challenge with precision and a deep sense of duty.

3) FOLLOW THROUGH, ALWAYS:  When we say something will happen, it does—every time. We own every task, ensuring that nothing falls through the cracks, and when mistakes occur, we learn and improve immediately.



Our core values are important and the right candidate will share our values. We are building an awesome place to work, not just cutting together videos for our real estate business.



--- ABOUT YOU ---

Do you have strong creative instincts and know how to spot 
nts that make people stop scrolling? Are you proactive, adaptable, and detail-oriented? Do you have a sharp sense of pacing, an instinct for hooks, and a clear understanding of how short-form videos need to flow to hold attention? Do you take pride in clean edits and delivering videos that feel intentional and finished? Do our core values sound like a fit for who you are?



Then keep reading to see if we're a fit!



Responsibilities:

Short-Form Editing & Story Selection

- Review long-form videos, transcripts, or raw footage to identify short-form clip opportunities

- Select 
nts that are clear, engaging, and platform-appropriate

- Edit vertical videos optimized for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts

- Create strong hooks, clean cuts, and natural pacing

- Deliver publish-ready videos that meet brand and platform standards



Captions, Visuals & Formatting

- Add on-screen captions (burned-in or SRT as required) with proper timing and readability

- Apply basic motion, zooms, punch-ins, and visual emphasis where appropriate

- Follow platform-specific formatting (aspect ratio, duration, safe margins)



Iteration & Workflow

- Implement feedback efficiently and meet agreed turnaround times

- Maintain clear file naming and folder organization

- Track edits, revisions, and delivery status as required



Requirements:

- A STABLE, HIGH-SPEED INTERNET CONNECTION, REQUIRED (at least 150mbps)

- Experience with Final Cut Pro X (or other editing software, such as Adobe After Effects and Premiere Pro) is required

- Strong preference for MacOS users

- Experience editing short-form vertical content for social platforms, required

- Strong understanding of short-form pacing, hooks, and retention

- Experience working from transcripts or long-form content, required

- Clean file organization and understanding of post-production workflo

- Portfolio of completed short-form video projects, required

- General understanding of brand, content marketing, YouTube, etc, required

- GREAT interpersonal and communication skills, required

- Ability to self-start, work on a tight schedule, and manage multiple project deadlines, required

- Ability to follow directions and a LOVE of completing lots of projects according to consistent specifications, required

- Growth mindset, required



--- APPLICATION & RECRUITMENT PROCESS ---

STEP 1:

Fill out the application form through the link below and write "green kangaroo" in the Additional Comments field.


 



STEP 2:

Qualified candidates may be invited to participate in two PAID test projects, $10-20 USD for each test project estimated to be 2-3hrs of work for each (a total of $40 USD!).



STEP 3:

Candidates who advance through the test project rounds will be invited to an interview.



STEP 4:

Before extending a trial offer, we will conduct a CHARACTER REFERENCE CHECK for the final candidate(s). CONDUCTING A REFERENCE CHECK will be the last step in the hiring process.



STEP 5:

Upon receiving a trial offer, you will be onboarded as a Video Editor with a 90-day PAID trial period. During this period, we expect you to demonstrate your video editing expertise, meet project deadlines, be a team player, and excel at what you do. A successful trial will lead to a permanent offer to join the team.

title: Ecommerce Growth Manager (Shopify & Klaviyo Expert)
description:
Role Overview

We are a legacy health and nutrition brand (Agape Nutrition) transitioning from a "supplement department store" to a "protocol-based authority." I am seeking a high-level Growth Manager to act as my "external brain" and project lead. You will be responsible for executing a structured roadmap in Smartsheet to move our revenue from $6k/month to our historical high of $40k/month.

Key Responsibilities

Shopify Optimization: Audit our store for mobile speed, remove non-essential apps, and restructure our navigation from "Categories" to "Solution-Based Protocols" (e.g., Gut Integrity, Neural Calm).

Klaviyo Management: Clean and segment a database of 18,000 profiles in Shopify. Build advanced automated flows (Welcome, Browse Abandonment, and Post-Purchase Support).

Data & Operations: Manage our 3000+ SKU inventory and customer lists via Google Sheets/CSV bulk edits.

Project Management: Update and maintain our Smartsheet Master Plan, providing weekly "Pulse Reports" so the Founder stays informed without being overwhelmed.

Requirements

Expert Mastery of Shopify and Klaviyo (Certification preferred).

Experience with Smartsheet or similar high-level project management tools.

Strategic Thinking: Ability to build product "bundles" and "pathways" similar to the Amy Myers or Thorne models.

Self-Starter: You must be able to work independently. I have limited energy for micromanagement; I need you to bring solutions, not just problems.

title: Patient Booking & Marketing Automation Specialist
description:
FULL TIME ROLE — Are You Our Next Patient Booking & Marketing Automation Specialist?



About Earworx

Earworx is a purpose and values-driven Australian healthcare business committed to delivering safe, professional and connected care. We are growing rapidly and are looking for a high-performing, proactive Virtual Assistant to help optimise our patient booking systems and marketing automation.

This is a full-time, 100% virtual role working Australian (Hobart, Tasmania) business hours. You will play a key role in managing patient reactivation campaigns, marketing automation, and booking optimisation through our CRM systems.

Who We Are Looking For

• Aligned with our values: Safe. Professional. Connected. Always Improving.

• Highly organised with exceptional attention to detail.

• Comfortable working autonomously and being accountable for results.

• Confident using CRM systems (Go High Level experience highly regarded).

• Strong written English communication skills.

• Proactive, solutions-focused and systems-driven.

• Reliable internet connection and ability to work remotely full-time



Core Responsibilities & Outcomes

• Build and optimise marketing automation campaigns inside Go High Level (POD).

• Manage SMS reactivation and patient recall campaigns.

• Respond to and manage patient enquiries from marketing campaigns.

• Ensure accurate transfer and management of recall lists between systems.

• Track, report and improve campaign performance KPIs.

• Continuously optimise systems to improve booking conversion rates.

• Clear and responsive communication during working hours

• Create and update standard operating procedures

What Success Looks Like

• Consistent increase in bookings generated from marketing campaigns.

• High campaign accuracy and on-time execution.

• Strong conversion rates from recall and reactivation lists.

• Clear, professional and prompt communication with patients and tea
mbers.

• Ongoing system improvements that increase efficiency and performance.

Why Join Earworx?

You will join a supportive and professional healthcare team committed to excellence and continuous improvement. We value accountability, initiative and growth. This role offers long-term stability, structured systems, and the opportunity to directly contribute to patient care outcomes.



How to Apply

Please send your most current Resume and a brief cover letter and short 'Loom' video outlining how you can help improve patient bookings and marketing performance if you joined our Team and the experience that you will bring to us.

Important: Include the word “APPLICATION” in the subject line for your application to be reviewed.



We look forward to hearing from you.

The Earworx Team

title: EXPERIENCED FREELANCE AD GRAPHIC DESIGNER (WFH, Remote)
description:
UpSell is a Singapore-based performance marketing agency helping interior designer brands scale through data-driven advertising and creative storytelling.



We don’t create “pretty posts.”

We create high-converting ad creatives that drive enquiries, booked appointments, and real revenue.



If you design for aesthetics only, this is not for you.

If you design for performance and results, keep reading.



Explore our work:


/heyupsell



???? Who We’re Looking For

We need an expert-level ad creative designer — not a beginner, not a hobbyist.



You must:

- Have at least 3–4 years of professional graphic design experience

- Hold a Diploma or Degree in Multimedia Arts, Graphic Design, or a related field

- Be highly skilled in designing conversion-focused ad creatives

title: Client Relations / Customer Service Support (Remote - Night Shift)
description:
We specialize in providing tailored mortgage services to homebuyers and real estate professionals. Our goal is to build strong partnerships within the real estate industry to help clients secure the best mortgage options available. We are seeking a dedicated, personable, and results-driven Dialer to reach out to prospective clients and real estate agents, establish relationships, and promote our mortgage services.



Key Responsibilities:

• Client Outreach: Make outbound calls to prospective real estate agents and clients to introduce our mortgage services.

• Relationship Building: Develop and maintain strong, positive relationships with real estate agents, brokers, and clients.

• Service Promotion: Communicate the benefits of our mortgage services clearly and effectively to potential partners and clients.

• Lead Generation: Identify and qualify new leads from incoming inquiries or research and cold outreach.

• Application Intake: Take initial client applications and gather required information to prepare clients for the loan officer.

• Follow-Up: Track all interactions and schedule follow-up calls to ensure continued engagement with leads.

• Reporting: Maintain accurate records of calls, outcomes, and progress toward relationship-building goals.

• Team Collaboration: Work closely with the sales and loan officer teams to ensure smooth transitions and effective communication with clients.

________________________________________

Qualifications:

• Experience: Prior experience in telemarketing, customer service, or sales is a plus. Real estate or mortgage industry experience is highly desirable, but not required.

• Communication Skills: Excellent verbal communication skills with the ability to build rapport quickly.

• Attention to Detail: Ability to accurately capture client information and ensure smooth transition to loan officers.

• Self-Motivated: Ability to work independently, manage time effectively, and stay organized in a remote setting.

• Goal-Oriented: Strong drive to achieve goals and contribute to the growth of the company.

• Tech-Savvy: Comfortable using CRM systems and other communication tools.

• Professionalism: Must be highly professional, reliable, and able to work in a fast-paced environment.

• C1 English Proficiency: Must have C1 level English proficiency (Advanced) or higher. This includes the ability to understand and produce detailed, complex communication in both spoken and written English.



________________________________________

What We Offer:

• Competitive base salary + performance-based commissions/bonuses.

• Flexible work hours and the ability to work remotely.

• Comprehensive training and ongoing support.

• Opportunity to grow within a dynamic and growing company.

• A collaborative and positive work culture.



****To Apply:



Complete the following questionnaire: 
/to/tZyKGM5o

Event posters and digital flyers



DJ announcements and weekly event promotions



If you do not have nightclub, DJ, party, bar, or live event design experience, this role is not a good fit.



This Role Is Social & Design Focused (Important)



This is not a general VA role.

This is not a strategy role.

This is not corporate design work.



The priority is:



Scroll-stopping social media image ads



High-energy Instagram and
 posts



Nightclub event posters



DJ lineup announcements



Story graphics and countdown creatives



You must understand nightlife culture, bold typography, lighting effects, dark themes, and attention-grabbing layouts.



Key Responsibilities

Following creative briefs from the marketing team

Meeting weekly campaign deadlines



(No paid ads management. No marketing strategy required.)



Required Experience (Non-Negotiable)



To be considered, you must have:



Experience designing for nightclubs, DJs, festivals, bars, or live events



A strong portfolio of nightlife posters and social media graphics



Experience designing both paid image ads and organic social posts



Strong typography and layout skills



Ability to create bold, energetic, modern visuals



Experience using Photoshop, Illustrator, Canva, or similar tools



If your experience is mainly corporate, real estate, ecommerce product ads, or minimalist branding — this role is not suitable.



We are specifically looking for someone who understands nightlife energy and culture.



Design Style We’re Looking For



Dark backgrounds



Neon accents



Strong lighting effects



Bold fonts



High contrast



Visually loud and scroll-stopping



Energy and movement in static graphics



What Success Looks Like in This Role

Working Hours & Compensation



Part-time role (20–30 hours per week initially)

Must be responsive during agreed working hours



Ability to handle urgent requests when required



Long-term opportunity with potential to move to full-time



Compensation:

Please include your expected hourly rate in AUD in your application.



This role is not suitable for freelancers juggling multiple clients. We are looking for someone committed and available during working hours.



How to Apply (Important – Read Carefully)



To apply, you must include:

Applications without relevant nightlife/event samples will not be considered.

title: Legal AI Sales & Client Success VA (Operations & Administration)
description:
This role is a virtual assistant position with a sales and client success focus for AI Legal Assistant. You are responsible for the administrative coordination that keeps our sales and client success workflows running smoothly—scheduling, sales operations, free trial stage coordination, CRM discipline, and new-client administration.



Your accountability is operational: ensuring all steps are completed, documented, and actioned with precision—so every lead and client feels the experience is organised, professional, and well managed.



Two defining expectations of this role are:

Proactivity and Accountability (you anticipate next steps and remove blockers before they appear)



Exceptional communication (excellent phone manner and outstanding written English)



Key responsibilities

1) Sales administration and scheduling coordination

Book and coordinate meetings across multiple stakeholders; manage invites, joining details, agenda notes, and required attendees.



Maintain diary integrity for the COO and relevant stakeholders: avoid conflicts/double bookings, manage time zones, and keep scheduling clean and efficient.



Run appointment confirmation and reminder workflows via phone/SMS/email (as required) to reduce no-shows and protect 
ntum.



Manage rescheduling quickly and professionally, ensuring sessions are rebooked and not lost.



2) Free trial administration and stage coordination (process discipline)

Coordinate free trials across defined stages, ensuring all administrative steps are completed accurately and on time.



Track trial readiness and required inputs (e.g., stakeholder lists, checklists, session bookings, attendance confirmations, required information captured).



Ensure every trial has a clear status, owner, next action, and date—no ambiguity and no stalled trials due to admin gaps.



Escalate risks early when a trial is likely to stall (missing info, delayed scheduling, incomplete steps).



3) New-client administration (handover hygiene)

Coordinate the admin steps that occur when a client converts: client record completeness, stakeholder mapping, key dates, internal handover notes, and task creation.



Ensure documentation is consistent and complete so the team can execute without operational friction.



Track completion of required internal admin tasks and close gaps quickly.



4) Basic client and lead enquiries follow-up (non-technical)

Follow up and respond to basic enquiries from clients and leads (scheduling, process steps, “what happens next”, standard access instructions where defined).



Route product, security, pricing, legal, or complex questions to the appropriate owner and ensure the loop is closed with the client.



5) Team task accountability and blocker removal (internal coordination)

Track key tasks across sales admin, trial admin, and new-client admin to ensure owners complete them on time.



Proactively chase outstanding actions, confirm completion, and escalate blockers before timelines slip.



Maintain clear internal visibility: what’s done, what’s pending, what’s blocked, who owns it, and the deadline.



6) CRM & schedule management (ClickUp)

Record all interactions, updates, and booking outcomes within ClickUp with high accuracy and consistency.



Tag and organise leads/clients to maintain pipeline visibility and prioritisation.



Maintain CRM hygiene: accurate statuses, contact details, stakeholder roles, trial stages, next actions, and follow-up dates.



Ensure ClickUp is reliable enough to run day-to-day operations without “backchannel” updates.



7) Reporting & feedback

Provide regular updates on admin activity, lead status, appointment conversion/show rates, trial stage progression (admin completion), and outcomes captured.



Ensure company protocols regarding the recording of important metrics are followed diligently.



Share recurring questions, objections, and process bottlenecks observed to support continuous improvement.



8) Proactivity and communication excellence (explicit expectations)

Anticipate next steps and prepare them in advance (draft confirmations, pre-create tasks, prompt stakeholders early, keep records current).



Maintain an exceptionally high standard of phone and written communication: calm, concise, polished, and appropriate for senior legal stakeholders.



Maintain templates, checklists, and workflows that improve consistency, speed, and quality.



What success looks like

Leads, team and clients consistently feel the process is organised, responsive, and professionally managed.



No blockers caused by missing admin steps, unclear ownership, or poor follow-through.



High show rates due to strong confirmation/reminder discipline.



Trials and new-client admin progress smoothly with accurate stage tracking and clean handovers.



ClickUp/CRM is current and trusted: every record has a status, history, and next action.



Required skills and capabilities

Exceptional diary management and multi-stakeholder scheduling capability.



Excellent phone manner and highly professional presence.



Outstanding written English: clear, accurate, client-ready communication.



High attention to detail, speed, and comfort operating from checklists and workflows.



CRM experience is essential (ClickUp preferred; equivalent accepted).



High accountability and self-direction: you close loops and keep 
ntum without being chased.



Must be able to work Sydney business hours (Sydney timezone) reliably.



Preferred experience

Experience in the legal industry 

Experience in sales appointment setting or managing 

Familiarity with B2B SaaS sales operations, onboarding coordination, or client success operations.



Working requirements

Must be able to work Sydney business hours (Sydney timezone) reliably.

High availability during business hours for calls, scheduling, and urgent rescheduling.

Professional home/remote setup suitable for client phone calls.



Attributes we will screen for hard

Extreme organisation and attention to detail.

Fast execution without sloppiness.

Clear, confident communication (written + phone).

Proactive follow-through: you eliminate silence and ambiguity for clients.

Calm under volume: you can handle busy weeks without dropping standards.

Accountability: we don’t need to follow you up because it’s already done





HOW TO APPLY:



To apply for the position, please send:

A freshly recorded face-to-camera video explaining why you want the role and why you are the ideal candidate. 

Your resume

At the end of your application, please write the word "kangaroo" so I'll know you aren't mass applying and have read this entire job post.

Company Overview:

We are a service based company seeking a highly analytical and detail oriented Real Estate Market & Licensing Research Specialist to support our investment and development initiatives. This role is ideal for someone passionate about real estate, market analysis, and helping identify profitable opportunities for investment and growth.



Position Overview:

This position focuses on conducting thorough research on real estate markets, property rehabilitation opportunities, and state-specific licensing requirements for certain programs. The ideal candidate is highly detail-oriented, great with numbers, experienced with the BRRRR Method (Buy, Rehab, Rent, Refinance, Repeat), understands basic construction pricing and workflow processes, evaluates auction properties, demonstrates out-of-the-box thinking, and is capable of performing in-depth research on programs such as Article 28 and Article 31, compiling step-by-step guides for licensing and approvals. The role requires strong follow-through to ensure all aspects of a project are completed from research to execution



Key Responsibilities:



Conduct detailed real estate market research to identify the best-performing and emerging markets for investment



Provide comprehensive market analysis reports, including metrics such as average home prices, rental rates, property values, and local market trends



Research rehab (renovation) opportunities in targeted markets and estimate potential costs, returns, and project feasibility



Understand basic construction pricing, set up, and workflow processes to better evaluate rehab projects



Evaluate auction properties, identifying promising deals and assessing potential risks and returns



Prepare clear and organized Excel reports summarizing findings, including property data, rehab budgets, auction analysis, and deal breakdowns for management review



Perform state-by-state research on rules and procedures for obtaining licenses or approvals required to run certain programs (e.g., Article 28, Article 31, etc.)



Compile step-by-step guides detailing how to file and obtain necessary licenses or program approvals in each state



Present research findings and recommendations in a clear and concise format, using innovative approaches to problem-solving



 Follow through on all aspects of projects from initial research to final execution, ensuring accuracy, completeness, and actionable outcomes  

On-site engagement  from A-Z



Requirements:



Experience in real estate research, data analysis, or investment support



Strong understanding of market evaluation, property trends, and basic rehab cost analysis



Knowledge of basic construction pricing and workflow processes



Experience evaluating real estate auctions and identifying profitable opportunities



Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel (formulas, data organization, and presentation)



Proven ability to conduct independent, detailed research and summarize findings effectively



Excellent written and verbal communication skills



Strategic, detail-oriented, and solution-focused mindset



Demonstrated out-of-the-box thinking to find creative solutions and uncover unique opportunities



Great with numbers and experienced with the BRRRR Method



Fluent in American English (spoken and written)



Position Details:



Type: Full-time



Schedule: Monday to Friday



Hours: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM (1-hour lunch break)



Compensation: $550 USD per month (paid monthly)

title: Marketing and Creative Assistant
description:
About the Client



You’ll be supporting an Australian creator-led business in the dance/education space with a large back-catalogue of video content and an active audience across YouTube and
. The work is practical, fast-moving, and focused on getting consistent content out the door—without overcomplicating things.



Your Impact



Within 90 days, you’ll help the creator publish short-form content consistently, reduce the weekly “content bottleneck”, and build a simple, repeatable workflow that keeps 
ntum. This isn’t about perfection—it’s about reliable output, clean execution, and steady improvement.



Key Responsibilities



Repurpose existing long-form videos into YouTube Shorts using an efficient workflow (AI clip generation + selection + light editing).

Create batches of draft shorts, flag the strongest clips, and refine them so they’re clear, watchable, and on-brand.

Apply a consistent style using existing templates (captions/look & feel), with small improvements over time.

Export, upload, and schedule Shorts to the YouTube channel (titles, basic metadata, consistency).

Create/update thumbnails in Canva using provided templates (no need to design from scratch).

Track performance basics (views, retention, simple trends) and share a weekly snapshot to guide what to double down on.

Communicate daily: end-of-day update covering what you did / what didn’t work / what’s next / blockers.

As capacity allows (later stage): cross-post selected Shorts to
/Instagram and assist with simple marketing admin (e.g., basic newsletter or opt-in support using existing tools/templates).

Must-Have Qualifications (Self-Check)



2+ years editing short-form content (Shorts/Reels/TikTok) with a focus on speed + clarity

Comfortable working with Filmora (Wondershare) or willing to learn it quickly (and/or propose a faster tool that achieves the same outcome)

Confident uploading and scheduling content on YouTube

Canva skills (template-based thumbnails and simple visual assets)

Strong English comprehension (you can judge whether a clip “makes sense” and catch awkward cut points)

Proactive communicator: You raise blockers early and don’t disappear

Can work within AEST overlap and provide daily EOD updates

Reliable home setup: stable internet, headset, and a distraction-managed workspace

Nice-to-Have Skills



Experience using YouTube optimisation tools (e.g., vidIQ/keyword tools) for titles and basic SEO

Experience 
 content across
/Instagram (platform-specific formatting awareness)

Familiarity with newsletter/email platforms (Kajabi/Mailchimp/Beehiiv or similar)

A strong creative eye: you can suggest small tweaks that lift quality without adding hours

Success Outcomes (30/60/90 Days)



30 Days: You can run the full Shorts workflow end-to-end with minimal supervision; publish consistently (target range: 8–15 Shorts/week, depending on complexity), with clean captions and sensible clip selection.

60 Days: You help lock in a repeatable “house style” (templates + do/don’t examples), reduce rework, and improve titles/thumbnails consistency.

90 Days: Publishing is steady and predictable; weekly reporting is clear; turnaround time improves; the creator feels confident the content machine runs without chasing.

Job Type: Part-time

description:

*** THIS IS NOT A FREE LANCE POSITION, YOU ARE NOT ALLOWED TO WORK FOR MULTIPLE EMPLOYERS IF HIRED WITH US ***



We are hiring a reliable, self-managed Social Media Content Creator & Community Manager to run our
, Instagram, and LinkedIn presence. This is a results-focused role where your attitude and determination will have a major impact on your success. The first month will involve some collaboration and onboarding; afterward, the role becomes independent where you are expected to perform.

Content Creation:

, Instagram, and LinkedIn.

title: Sales Executive (Tekla Detailing)
description:
Sales Executive (Tekla Detailing): Full-Time Permanent WFH 



Job description: 



About us



We are a specialized engineering firm, delivering high-quality miscellaneous and structural steel detailing services. With over 50 years of combined team experience, we produce drawings, 3D modelling renders, and project takeoffs—particularly for railings, stairs, canopies, balconies, and other miscellaneous steel components. Our clients include architectural, construction, and fabrication firms globally. 



Position Overview 



We are looking for a driven Tekla Steel Detailing and Sales Engineer to help expand our client base and sales revenue in the steel detailing / structural engineering market. This person will identify prospects, nurture leads, close deals, and build long-term relationships with firms that require detailing, modelling, and estimating services. The role requires strong technical understanding so as to communicate clearly about our services and differentiate our quality and attention to detail. 



Key Responsibilities 



Generate new business opportunities and leads in the construction, steel fabrication, architectural, and engineering sectors. 



Develop and maintain relationships with existing clients to generate repeat business and referrals. 



Present our capabilities (detailing, 3D rendering, takeoffs) to potential clients via online meetings. 



Work closely with the engineering team to understand project requirements, estimate costs, and prepare proposals. 



Follow up on proposals, negotiate terms, and close sales successfully. 



Maintain accurate sales pipeline data in CRM; forecast sales and report results. 



Collaborate with marketing to develop materials (case studies, portfolios, presentations) that highlight our past projects and expertise. 



Monitor market trends and competitor activities, especially related to steel detailing and detailing software such as Tekla Structures. 



Qualifications & Skills 



Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Architecture, Construction Management, Business, or a related field preferred. 



Proven sales experience in construction, architecture, engineering, fabrication, or similar technical fields. 



Strong understanding of steel detailing, structural drawings, 3D modeling, or estimating. Familiarity with Tekla Structures or similar software is a plus. 



Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills. 



Ability to understand technical drawings and ask clarifying questions. 



Strong organizational skills; ability to manage multiple leads, proposals, and clients. 



Proficiency in using CRM systems, MS Office, and possibly technical drafting / model-viewing platforms. 



Self-motivated, results-driven, with the capacity to work independently and meet sales targets. 



Job Types: Full-time, Permanent 



Benefits: 



Additional leave 



Company Christmas gift 



Company events 



Paid training 



Pay raise 



Work from home 



Please reply with your resume via
, include a cover letter answering the following questions: (we will not entertain applications without these requirements).



Application Question(s): 



Are you familiar with steel detailing, structural drawings, or 3D modeling software (e.g., Tekla, AutoCAD, Revit)? 



Are you comfortable with lead generation, cold outreach, and negotiating contracts? 



Experience: 



B2B sales or business development: 3 years (Preferred) 



Work Location: Remote

o Harvest potential clients through LinkedIn.

mbers to resolve any client or agent related issues.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

mbers

title: Remote VoIP Sales and Account Manager (AU Timezone)
description:
Company: FibreMax (Australia)

Location: Remote (Philippines), full-time

Schedule: Mon–Fri, Australian Western Standard Time (AWST, same as PH time)



About FibreMax



FibreMax is a Perth-based telecom provider offering business phone systems (FibreMAX®fone) and NBN internet services across Australia. We’re a small, fast-moving team—big on customer care, practical solutions, and long-term relationships.



The Role



You’ll own the full sales cycle for our VoIP phone systems and support your customers long-term. This is a hands-on role combining outbound sales, solution design, onboarding coordination, and ongoing customer care. You’ll also assist with basic NBN modem/router support over the phone for our internet customers.



What You’ll Do



Prospect & Sell

Make cold calls and warm follow-ups to AU businesses (daily dial goals).

Qualify opportunities; conduct discovery to assess business requirements.

Prepare and present proposals/quotes; handle objections; close deals.

Keep CRM notes up to date; forecast pipeline and hit monthly targets.



Solution Design & Onboarding

Translate needs into VoIP solutions (extensions, call flows, IVR, queues, numbers, porting).

Coordinate implementation with in-house or local IT teams.

Arrange number porting and service activations; schedule cutovers.

Train end users (short remote sessions, quick guides, how-tos).



Customer Success & Support

Be the account manager for your customers—own the relationship.

Provide first-line support on phone system features and basic NBN setup (modem/router phone support and simple triage).

Liaise with our technical team for escalations; follow through to resolution.

From time to time, discuss billing queries and assist customers to update payment details.



Team & Process

Contribute to playbooks, scripts, FAQs, and training materials.

Suggest improvements to proposals, onboarding steps, and support workflows.



Must-Have Qualifications

Proven VoIP/PBX sales experience (B2B) with a track record of closing.

Solid understanding of SIP, DIDs, IVR, ring groups/queues, call recording, and number porting.

Experience with one or more PBX platforms (e.g., Enswitch, Yeastar) and Grandstream or similar IP phones.

Confident phone presence for cold calls to Australian businesses; excellent English (clear, neutral accent).

Strong written skills 
, proposals, step-by-step instructions).

Comfortable with Microsoft 365 apps and general tools (CRM, ticketing, Calendly/Zoom/GSuite).

Ownership mindset: proactive, organised, reliable, and calm under pressure.



Nice-to-Haves

Familiarity with Australian NBN (FTTP/HFC/FTTC/FTTN), basic modem/router setup.

Grandstream ecosystem (GRP/DP handsets, GWN routers/switches) and provisioning basics.

Helpdesk experience (Freshdesk/Zendesk/Jira) and light network troubleshooting.



KPIs (what success looks like)

Daily call activity and quality discovery notes in CRM.

Weekly qualified opportunities created and proposals sent.

Close rate and monthly new MRR targets achieved.

Onboarding timelines met; first-response time and CSAT on support interactions.

Low-churn, high-retention customer relationships.



Work Setup Requirements

Quiet workspace with minimal background noise.

Reliable computer capable of running current Microsoft applications.

Stable wired internet (recommended 50 Mbps+ down, 20 Mbps+ up) with a backup connection (LTE hotspot).

USB noise-cancelling headset.

Modern mobile phone for business calls.

(Nice to have) UPS/power backup to ride out short outages.



What We Offer

Competitive hourly rate (PHP) and performance bonuses.

Training on our products, pricing, processes, and sales playbooks.

Stable AU-timezone hours (aligned with PH time).



How to Apply (follow these steps exactly)



1. Subject line: `Remote VoIP Sales & AM – FIBREMAX PRO`

2. Short cover letter (max 200 words) describing your VoIP/PBX sales experience and biggest deal you closed.

3. 1-minute voice recording introducing yourself and summarising your PBX experience (Vocaroo/Loom link is fine).

4. Speed test screenshot (speedtest.net) taken from your work location today.

5. Top 3 PBX or VoIP tools you’ve used and your role in each (1–2 sentences per tool).

6. Optional: A short Loom video (?3 min) walking through a proposal you created (hide confidential info).



Hiring Process

Application screening ? Initial interview ? Skills task (light proposal & call-flow) ? Final interview ? Offer.

Probation: 90 days with clear goals, coaching, and feedback.



Want to stand out? Share a brief call-flow you’d propose for a 10-seat clinic (reception, billing, overflow to mobiles, after-hours message, voi
-to
, simple IVR).

title: TECHNICAL CUSTOMER SUPPORT, AUSTRALIAN TELCO AND NBN, VOIP
description:
About FibreMax

FibreMax is an Australian telecommunications provider delivering NBN internet and business VoIP phone systems. We are known for fast support, clear communication, and getting issues resolved properly.



Role summary

We are hiring a Technical Customer Support specialist with real experience in the Australian telco industry. You will support customers with NBN services, modem and router setup, fault finding, and VoIP troubleshooting. You will work closely with our technical lead and follow our internal processes for ticket updates, customer communication, and escalation.



Key responsibilities



1. Provide technical support to customers via phone,
, and tickets.

2. Troubleshoot NBN connectivity issues and guide customers through practical checks and fixes.

3. Assist with modem and router configuration, Wi Fi performance, and basic network troubleshooting.

4. Support VoIP services including extensions, call flows, call quality issues, and common PBX settings.

5. Understand and assist with number porting and the steps, documents, and checks required.

6. Diagnose VoIP call quality issues and confirm network requirements for reliable voice performance.

7. Work with upstream carriers and suppliers when escalation is required, and keep customers updated.

8. Keep accurate notes and real time status updates on every ticket, with clear next steps and outcomes.

9. Follow internal checklists and continuously improve documentation and troubleshooting guides.



Requirements



1. Relevant experience in the Australian telco industry.

2. Strong and well rounded NBN knowledge, including practical troubleshooting and common fault scenarios.

3. Hands on experience with modem and router configuration and fault finding.

4. Experience supporting VoIP systems, familiarity with call flows, number porting, and network requirements for quality VoIP calls.

5. Strong written and spoken English, professional and calm on calls, able to explain technical topics simply.

6. Quality, fast, and stable internet connection suitable for VoIP support work.

7. Reliable computer or laptop suitable for multiple web tools and ticketing systems.

8. Mobile phone with a noise reduction headset and microphone.

9. Quiet, dedicated work area with minimal background noise.



Nice to have



1. Experience with ticketing systems, CRMs, and structured escalation workflows.

2. Understanding of SIP concepts and basic networking, including latency, jitter, packet loss, QoS, and LAN versus Wi Fi impacts.

3. Experience supporting business customers, multi site setups, and mobile softphone users.



What we value

Calm under pressure, strong ownership, great attention to detail, and a customer first mindset. We care about doing things properly, not rushing and leaving problems half solved.



How to apply

Please include the following in your application.



1. A short summary of your Australian telco experience, including NBN and VoIP.

2. Examples of modem and router troubleshooting you have done.

3. The VoIP systems or PBX platforms you have supported, and what you worked on.

4. Your internet speed and reliability details, and a brief description of your work from home setup.

5. Your availability, preferred working hours, and expected monthly salary.

title: Design Assistant
description:

title: Admin/Social Meida Specialist
description:
We are looking for a highly organized, detail-oriented, and tech-savvy Administrative & Social Media Virtual Assistant whose primary responsibility is to manage client communication, support customer success, and help oversee day-to-day operations for Seaside Media Group. This role plays a key part in ensuring clients and potential clients feel informed, supported, and confident throughout every stage of their interaction with our brand, while also helping our internal team operate efficiently and productively.



This position is focused on client communication, Instagram outreach, customer success, and operational support. A good portion of this role involves Instagram-based work, including outreach to potential clients, messaging with both potential and current clients, and helping move conversations toward potential phone calls when appropriate. Strong communication skills are essential, as you will be handling conversations via Instagram DMs, potential phone calls, text messages, and
 on a daily basis. Your English must be very good, and you must have a reliable internet connection. You will work closely with our Quality Control (QC) Team to ensure seamless communication across the business.



A day in the life of this role will look something like this: starting the day by monitoring and managing all incoming communication through Instagram DMs, potential phone calls, text messages, and our support inbox, responding promptly and professionally to both potential and existing clients. Throughout the day, you’ll conduct Instagram outreach to potential clients, initiate conversations, answer questions, follow up with interested leads, and help transition qualified conversations into potential phone calls when needed. You’ll also provide regular project updates to active clients so they always know the status of their media and feel supported.



As situations arise, you’ll focus heavily on customer success by answering questions, assisting with requests, and resolving concerns. You’ll flag urgent or complex issues to the appropriate tea
mber and ensure proper follow-up. You’ll communicate consistently with our CEO and QC Team to keep projects moving smoothly and clients taken care of.



In addition to client-facing responsibilities, you’ll help oversee day-to-day operational activities to ensure efficiency and productivity. This includes assisting with the development and implementation of operational policies and procedures, optimizing workflows, managing and allocating resources when needed, monitoring key performance indicators, and identifying areas for improvement. When things slow down, you’ll collaborate with cross-functional teams to streamline systems and improve overall business performance.



If you are seeing this sentence, please send us an
 with the word “Pizza” in the subject line. In the
, please explain why you would like to apply for this position and why you believe you would be a great fit for Seaside Media Group. We will only be accepting applications through
. Thank you!



A few of the software systems we currently use include Spiro (Real Estate Photography Management Software), OpenPhone (Quo), 
, Slack, Instagram,
 platforms, and social media tools. Please let us know if you have experience with any of these systems ???? (experience is a plus — training will be provided).



We look forward to hearing from you!



Brad | Seaside Media Group

description:

• Redesign and optimize all core flows

• Increase revenue per recipient

s
