title: Experienced Property Management Specialist (OwnerRez & Remote Operations Expert)
description:
Are you a Property Management Rockstar who is fast, efficient, and tech-savvy?



We are an established, San Francisco Bay Area-based property management firm with nearly 8 years of success in the short-term (STR) and long-term rental (LTR) industry. We have built a reputation for excellence, and we are looking for a seasoned professional to join our stable, high-performing team.



We don’t just need "customer service"—we need a Property Management Expert who understands the mechanics of the industry, moves quickly, and never lets a detail slip through the cracks.



Why Join Us?

Proven Stability: Work for a company with an 8-year track record of growth and industry expertise.

High-Speed Environment: We value efficiency. If you are fast and productive, you will thrive here.

Professional Standards: We have clear processes in place—no "startup" guesswork.

100% Remote: Long-term, stable remote work from your home office.



The Requirements (Strict)

Please do not apply if you only have general Call Center/BPO experience. We require specific industry expertise.

Direct Property Management Experience: Minimum 2+ years managing Short-Term Rentals (Airbnb/VRBO) and Long-Term Rentals.

PMS Mastery: Advanced proficiency in OwnerRez is highly preferred. You should know how to navigate workflows, triggers, and guest communication within the platform.

Operational Speed: You must be fast-thinking, fast-typing (60+ WPM), and able to handle multiple guest issues simultaneously without losing quality.

Reliability: We require high accountability. As an established firm, we rely on teammates who respect schedules and deadlines.

Tech Stack: Knowledge of AI tools (ChatGPT), Time Doctor, and dual-monitor setups.



Your Responsibilities

End-to-End Guest Management: Manage inquiries, bookings, and high-stakes resolution cases across Airbnb, VRBO, and direct sites.

Property Oversight: Coordinate check-ins/outs, send and track lease agreements, and monitor security footage.

Logistics & Maintenance: Schedule cleaning teams, review quality assurance photos, and manage supply inventory.

Listing Optimization: Maintain and optimize listings to ensure maximum occupancy and 5-star reviews.

Process Contribution: Use your experience to help refine our established internal workflows.



Compensation & Benefits

Base Pay: Starting at $5/hour (Negotiable for candidates with extensive Property Management experience).

Schedule: Pacific Standard Time (PST) | Includes Weekends

Paid Leave: Accrued leave credits after 1 year

Bonus: Performance-based bonuses



How to Apply

To filter for the high-attention-to-detail candidates we need, please follow these steps exactly:

 your Resume to 
 Introduction: Record a brief intro highlighting your specific experience with PMS and STR/LTR management. (Share via Dropbox/Google Drive link).

Subject Line: Must be: [Property Management Specialist] – (Last Name, First Name)

Expertise Check: In your
, briefly describe the most complex issue you resolved in OwnerRez or a similar PMS.



Bonus: End your
 by telling us who the current Prime Minister of the United Kingdom is.

title: VFX / Velocity Editor - Lethal Luxury Short-Form Video
description:
VFX / Velocity Editor - Lethal Luxury Short-Form Video



**Brand:** Prismiera (Luxury Jewelry)

**Pay:** $1100 USD/month

**Type:** Full-time, 40 hours/week

**Location:** Remote (Philippines)

**Software:** Premiere Pro + After Effects (mandatory)



---



## The Mission



Prismiera is a pre-launch luxury jewelry brand launching a short-form video series - 35–50 second stories about mythology, history, spies, poisoners, queens, alchemists, and other on-brand topics posted across TikTok, Reels, and YouTube Shorts.



The aesthetic is **History and mythology meets high fashion**. The editing energy is closer to a perfectly-timed **After Effects edit** than a corporate product video. Every cut serves the story.



You will receive a script, a voiceover file, and a mood reference. Your job is to **build the scene from nothing**: generate AI visuals, voiceovers, source archival footage, layer sound design, and deliver a short where every second earns the next. A visual storyteller.



---



## The Style



**YES:** Dark luxury. Museum. AE VFX edit. Stylish/Lethal. Rich textures. Clean typography. Controlled palette. Both silence and impact used with intention.



**NO:** CapCut default presets. Anything that looks like a stock photo slideshow or a corporate deck.



You understand that more effects does not necessarily mean better. Every cut has a reason.



---



## Core Skills (Non-Negotiables)



**Motion Graphics** You can build scenes, transitions, and visual elements from scratch in After Effects - not just cut footage.



**Voiceover-First Storytelling.** You are editing to a *narration* primarily, music track second. You know when to let a line breathe and when to accelerate. You never bury the script's punchline under a flashy transition. The voice leads - the visuals serve.



**Retention Instinct.** You understand that the first frame is an ad for the second frame. You know what stops a scroll. You build hooks visually, not just with text overlays. Every 2–3 seconds, something changes.



**Rhythm & Beat-Sync.** You can sync cuts, zooms, and effects to music. You understand "the drop." If you've made AMVs, fan/anime edits, or phonk edits, you already have this skill - we want you to apply it with restraint.



**AI-Assisted Asset Creation.** You are comfortable generating images and short clips using tools like Midjourney or Kling. (We usually move onto new tools as soon as they are released). You treat AI as a production tool, not a novelty. We provide all paid accounts - you bring the creative judgment.



---



## Bonus Skills (Not Required, But We'll Notice)



- After Effects compositing - Mocha tracking, light matching (future projects will involve product placement in video scenes)

- Typography sense - fonts that feel intentional, never default

- Color grading - pushing AI output and footage into a consistent palette

- Sound design beyond music - layering SFX on movement, crafting risers and hits



---



## Weekly Output



**Ramp-up (first 2–3 weeks):** 2–3 shorts as you learn the brand voice and pipeline.

**Steady state:** 4–5 shorts per week at the locked quality standard.



You will work from clear creative briefs with reference scripts, mood boards, and audio clips for most batches.



---



## How to Apply



**Do not send a generic cover letter.**



**Subject line:** Lethal Editor - [Your name]



Use 7 apply points or more when applying.



**Send the following (in this order):**



1. **The Story Test.** Link to ONE short-form video you edited that includes **voiceover or spoken dialogue**. We need to see that you can pace visuals to a script.



2. **The AE Style Test.** Link to ONE video that shows your **visual rhythm and editing craft** - an AMV, fan edit, fashion reel, or anything where the editing itself is the skill. It doesn't need to be "dark" or "luxury." It needs to show us how you think about pacing and impact.



3. **AI Experience (1 sentence).** What is your experience level with generative AI tools (Midjourney, seedream, Kling, etc.)? If none, say so - we'll evaluate the rest of your application on its own merits.



4. **Hardware.** Your PC specs: CPU / GPU / RAM. Plus your internet upload speed.



5. **Turnaround Estimate.** How long does a 30–50 second high-quality short typically take you, start to finish?



6. **The Rewrite.** Rewrite this sentence to sound dark, powerful, and modern: *"She is really cool and strong and she wins."*



---



## Paid Trial (Shortlisted Candidates)



Before any full-time commitment, we run a weekly paid trial. We provide real scripts and style references. You deliver 30–50 second shorts. Trial is compensated at $250 USD at the end of each week (after work). If it's a mutual fit after 30 days, we transition to $550 USD payments every 2 weeks (before work).



This protects both of us - you see whether the work fits your strengths, we see whether the output fits our brand.



---



## What We Offer



- **Paid accounts** for all frontier AI tools; seedance2.0, seedream5.0, etc.

- **Creative identity** - you're building the visual identity of a brand from launch, not filling someone else's template

- **Clear briefs** - most, if not every batch comes with scripts, audio files, mood boards, and specific reference videos

- **Direct feedback** - specific, constructive notes on every edit.

- **A brand worth building** - Prismiera launches April 2026. A second AI native game/anime brand after that. You're not joining a machine. You're helping build one.

title: Sales Closer
description:
How to Apply

* Send your most updated resume to 



About us:



Gushwork.ai builds AI Agents that help small and medium businesses automate their entire inbound marketing stack — from SEO and website content to reviews, blogs, and lead funnels. Our current focus is the manufacturing and industrial distributors industry.



In plain English: we’re replacing bloated marketing agencies with intelligent, always-on software.



Backed by Lightspeed, SIG, Beenext, and B Capital, Gushwork.ai is one of the fastest-growing AI companies globally.



In just a year, we’ve grown to $1.5M ARR and are scaling fast toward $15M ARR in the next 12 months — helping thousands of small businesses grow smarter, not harder.



The Role:



We’re looking for a closer who thrives in fast-paced, high-velocity sales environments. You’ll own the full sales cycle from discovery to close for qualified meetings booked by our 10-person BDR team. This is a quota-carrying role where you’ll close 4-8 deals monthly, with deal cycles ranging from 1-3 calls.



Working Hours: US Shift (9:00 AM - 6:00 PM EST)

Work Mode: Remote



What You’ll Do:



- Run discovery calls with qualified prospects (OEMs, distributors, manufacturers) to uncover pain points around lead generation and digital presence

- Deliver compelling demos that connect our AI SEO solution to specific business outcomes and revenue impact

- Navigate buying committees within SMB organizations, typically engaging with Marketing Directors, Sales Leaders, and C-suite

- Close deals on 12-month contracts with ACV of $5k-$25k, meeting or exceeding monthly quota

- Manage pipeline with discipline—forecast accurately, maintain detailed CRM hygiene, and move deals forward with urgency

- Partner with Growth Managers post-sale to ensure smooth handoffs and identify expansion opportunities

- Iterate on sales methodology by sharing wins/losses and collaborating on improving conversion rates



What Success Looks Like:



- Month 1-2: Ramp on product, market, and sales process; close your first 2-3 deals

- Month 3+: Consistently hit/exceed quota of 4-8 closed deals monthly

- Ongoing: Maintain 30%+ demo-to-close conversion rate and sub-30 day sales cycles



You’re a Great Fit If You Have:

title: Senior Amazon Wholesale Product Research Specialist (U.S. Drop Shipping Experts Only)
description:
We are a growing U.S.-based Amazon wholesale drop shipping operation seeking a high-level, experienced Amazon Wholesale Product Research Specialist.

This is NOT a beginner role.

This is NOT retail arbitrage.

This is NOT online arbitrage.

We are only interested in professionals who have proven experience sourcing profitable products from legitimate U.S. wholesalers and distributors who drop ship under the seller’s name.

If you do not have direct experience working with U.S.-based wholesale suppliers that offer drop shipping, please do not apply.

What You Will Be Responsible For

Identifying profitable products from U.S. wholesale supplier catalogs

Researching and verifying legitimate wholesale distributors

Analyzing supplier price lists against Amazon listings

Calculating ROI, margins, fees, and break-even points accurately

Evaluating competition, Buy Box rotation, sales rank, and pricing stability

Managing and adjusting pricing using repricing software

Monitoring account health risks related to wholesale drop shipping

Ensuring all sourcing aligns with Amazon policies

Required Qualifications (Non-Negotiable)

Proven experience in Amazon wholesale drop shipping (U.S. market)

Existing knowledge of legitimate U.S. wholesale distributors

Strong expertise in Amazon Seller Central

Advanced experience using tools such as:

Keepa

SellerAmp

Tactical Arbitrage

Repricing software

Deep understanding of:

Buy Box mechanics

Sales rank analysis

Brand restrictions

Amazon compliance and policy risks

Ability to work independently and think strategically

What We’re Looking For

We want someone who:

Thinks like a business owner, not just a VA

Prioritizes long-term account safety

Understands risk management in wholesale drop shipping

Has strong analytical skills and attention to detail

Can deliver consistent, scalable results

This role is for a serious professional who understands the wholesale ecosystem in the United States.

We offer a starting fixed salary of $600 per month (full-time).

This is a performance-based growth position. Salary increases and bonuses will be based strictly on:

Quality of product research

Accuracy of ROI and profit calculations

Number of profitable products approved

Overall contribution to business growth

Consistency, reliability, and attention to detail

High performers can earn raises and performance bonuses, with total monthly compensation reaching up to $1,000+ per month, depending entirely on results.

We reward quality, not volume. If you consistently bring profitable, sustainable wholesale products and help grow the account safely, your compensation will grow with it.

This is a long-term opportunity for someone serious about building and scaling a U.S. Amazon wholesale operation

How to Apply

To confirm you have read and understood this entire job description, begin your application with the following sentence:

“I AM AN EXPERIENCED U.S. AMAZON WHOLESALE DROP SHIPPING SPECIALIST.”

Then briefly list:

The U.S. wholesalers/distributors you have worked with

The tools you use daily

Your average ROI target

Applications that do not follow these instructions will not be considered

title: n8n Expert Needed — AI Product Infographic Pipeline (Last Mile) (Nano Banana)
description:
## What We Have



A working n8n workflow (36 nodes) that generates 6 product infographic images per product for Amazon using Gemini AI. Pipeline: Shopify webhook ? product analysis ? strategy ? prompt generation ? image editing ? Google Drive upload.



Output quality is at ~85%. Prompts, brand system, and image strategy are done.



## The Problem



AI-generated text on images is inconsistent:

- Font weight/size varies between images

- Occasional spelling errors

- Hero image sometimes misinterprets the brief



We need 100% production-ready output with zero manual intervention across 3,000+ products.



## What We Need



Someone to architect and build the solution that gets us from 85% to 100%. Options we've considered:

- QC retry loop (Gemini Vision checks output, retries on failure)

- Programmatic text overlay (AI generates scenes without text, code node adds real fonts after)

- Something else entirely — we're open to better ideas



## Requirements



- Strong n8n experience (complex workflows, not basic flows)

- Image processing skills = Nano Banana

- Familiar with Gemini API or similar AI image models

- We'll share the full workflow JSON



## To Apply



Tell us: what's your approach to solve this, rough hours estimate, and when you can start.

title: Framer Website Designer (Front-End) – New Builds + Ongoing Updates
description:
What This Role Is

We build and maintain Framer websites for small businesses. Some projects are new builds, others are updates to existing Framer sites. We need a Framer-experienced front-end designer who can deliver clean, modern work without breaking layouts.



What You’ll Do



* Build new marketing pages in Framer when needed

* Make updates to existing Framer websites (design tweaks, new sections, fixes)

* Create and manage reusable components / variants

* Ensure clean responsive layouts across desktop/tablet/mobile

* Add/adjust sections (hero, services, FAQs, CTAs, testimonials, contact, etc.)

* Update copy, images, buttons, links, navigation, and page flow

* Set up or edit Framer CMS/Collections when needed (blog, services, locations)

* Keep projects organized (naming, structure, consistency)

* Provide a short Loom walkthrough for larger updates



Must Have 



* 3+ live Framer websites you personally built or worked on

* Strong responsive design skills (no broken mobile layouts)

* Excellent typography and spacing (clean, modern, consistent)

* Experience both building and editing (maintenance work matters here)



Nice to Have



* Basic conversion knowledge (CTA placement, section order, clarity)

* SEO structure basics (headings, internal linking, clean layout structure)

* Subtle motion/animation skills (tasteful, not distracting)



How To Apply (Required Answers)



1. Share 3–5 live Framer links you built or edited

2. For each link, say what you personally did (new build, responsiveness fixes, new sections, component system, CMS edits, etc.)

3. What’s your process for making changes to an existing Framer site without breaking it?

4. Have you used components/variants? Give a real example

5. Have you used Collections/CMS? Example (if yes)

6. Confirm you can complete a paid test task (small Framer build + edit scenario)

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Full Stack Developer to design, build, and maintain a robust, custom-built reservation and management system tailored for the unique needs of airport transportation and limousine companies.



This is a remote contract role focused on delivering a high-quality, scalable, and user-friendly platform from the ground up.



---



Compensation & Terms



* Monthly Rate: 55,360 PHP

* Payment Schedule: Paid bi-weekly.

* Contract Type: Initial 6-month contract with potential for extension based on performance and project milestones.



---



Project Goal: The Reservation System



The successful candidate will be responsible for creating a complete, end-to-end web application that includes:



1. Customer-Facing Booking Portal: A fast, responsive, and intuitive website/portal for clients to get quotes, book reservations, and manage their trips.



2. Admin/Dispatch Dashboard: A comprehensive back-end system for managing reservations, tracking payments, generating reports, and assigning trips.



3. Chauffeur Mobile Interface (API/Web App): A simplified interface or robust API endpoint for drivers to view assigned trips, update status (en route, on location, dropped off), and log hours/mileage.



4. Payment Gateway Integration: Secure integration with a major payment processor (e.g., Stripe, PayPal, etc.).



5. Mapping/GPS Integration: Integration with mapping services (e.g., Google Maps) for route calculation, real-time vehicle tracking display, and geo-fencing features.



---



Key Responsibilities



* Architect and implement the entire system, from the database schema to the front-end user interfaces.

* Write clean, well-documented, and performant code that is easy to maintain and scale.

* Collaborate with stakeholders to define requirements and translate business logic into technical specifications.

* Manage deployment, testing, and troubleshooting across development, staging, and production environments.

* Ensure the system is secure, especially regarding payment processing and client data.



---



Qualifications



* Minimum 2-3 years of experience as a Full Stack Developer.

* Proven ability to complete an entire web application development lifecycle independently.

* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

* Ability to work autonomously in a remote environment.

* Prior experience building logistics, booking, or e-commerce platforms is a massive advantage.



---



To apply, please submit your resume, a link to your portfolio/GitHub profile, and briefly describe your experience with developing real-time scheduling or reservation features in a previous role.

title: Legal Document Editor (New Zealand - Full Time)
description:
A bit about us:

I run 
. We help New Zealanders who have lost their driver’s licences get back on the road legally so they can keep their jobs and support their families.



Losing a licence in NZ is a massive crisis for most people. We provide the "pathway out" by preparing their Limited Licence applications. 



Our new clients fill out an online form and then their data is automatically merged into our precedents. A detail orientated person then needs to revise the documents to turn the information that our clients have provided into polished and formatted court ready documents.



The Role:

I am looking for a sharp, detail-obsessed Law Graduate (Juris Doctor) or a high-level Legal VA to join the team as a Legal Document Editor.



Your job is to take the drafts our system generates and give them a rigorous "human polish." You’ll be ensuring that the Affidavits sound authentic, the Draft Orders are legally precise, and every single detail is accurate and correct.



I presently have two staff based in New Zealand who handle the whole process. We are wanting to have someone dedicated to  the initial document so that we can focus on client management and the other elements in the application process/



This role will begin solely in document drafting but there is room for the role to grow into handling other aspects of the business.



What you’ll be doing:



Document Editing: Taking the raw data a client puts into our form and smoothing it out so it reads as a professional, sworn statement for a Judge.



The "Logic Check": If a client says they work in Auckland but their driving route says Christchurch, you need to catch that. You are the filter that prevents embarrassing errors in court.



Further Information: Our clients frequently give us incomplete and poor answers. We need you to pick up on what further information would be required to complete the document.



Police/Court Readiness: Making sure the final PDF is formatted exactly how a Registrar or Police Prosecutor expects to see it.



Who you are:



A Law Degree is a massive plus. If you've spent years reading and drafting motions or orders, you’ll find this work straightforward but rewarding.



You are a "Detail Hawk." You’re the type of person who gets annoyed by a misplaced comma or a inconsistent font.



You understand "High Stakes." You know that if we get a driving hour wrong (e.g., 7am instead of 7pm), our client could end up in legal trouble. You take that responsibility seriously.



Native-level English. Your writing should be indistinguishable from a New Zealand legal professional.



The Setup:



Pay: Pay is dependent on qualifications and experience. If you are a JD who is over-qualified for "general VA" work, this may be a good role for you.



How to Apply (The Attention Test):

I get a lot of applications, so I only respond to those who follow these steps:



Subject line: "Limited Licence Specialist - [your name]



Attach a CV and an example document that you have drafted.



I’m looking for a long-term partner who wants to help me scale this business as we grow.

title: Lead Generation Manager
description:
Lead Generation Manager (LGM)

Company: Serviceflo

Location: Remote

Schedule: Full-Time | U.S. Business Hours

Base Salary: $1000 USD / month

Performance Bonuses: Monthly, uncapped

Start Date: Immediate



About Serviceflo

Serviceflo is a U.S.-based company that builds automation and growth systems for service-based businesses. We work with owners who want cleaner operations, stronger sales systems, and predictable growth — not chaos.

We operate with high standards, clear expectations, and a long-term mindset.

We value people who take ownership, follow process, and care deeply about the quality of their work.

This is not a call center.

This is a professional sales environment.



Why This Role Exists

- The Lead Generation Manager (LGM) is a critical front-line role at Serviceflo.

- Your job is to start high-quality conversations, identify whether a business is a good fit for Serviceflo, and book qualified discovery calls for our senior sales team.

- The quality of your work directly impacts:

- Revenue

- Close rates

- Client experience

- Brand reputation

- We are hiring carefully and intentionally for this role.



Role Overview

As an LGM, you will:

- Conduct outbound calls to U.S.-based service business owners

- Speak clearly, confidently, and professionally in English

- Ask structured questions to assess fit and intent

- Book discovery calls only when qualification standards are met

- Protect the sales calendar from low-quality or unprepared prospects

- This role requires discipline, consistency, and strong communication skills.



Key Responsibilities

- Outbound Outreach

- Make outbound calls daily using company-provided lists and systems

- Follow approved scripts and messaging frameworks

- Represent Serviceflo professionally in every interaction

- Maintain steady daily activity to generate pipeline consistently



Lead Qualification

- Identify whether a prospect fits Serviceflo’s Ideal Customer Profile

- Assess decision-making authority, business size, pain points, and urgency

- Ask clear, professional qualification questions

- Disqualify poor-fit leads quickly and confidently



Discovery Call Booking

- Book discovery calls only when qualification criteria are met

- Clearly explain the purpose and expectations of the discovery call

- Ensure prospects are prepared, informed, and committed to attending

- Reduce no-shows through proper expectation setting



CRM & Documentation

Log all activity accurately in the CRM

- Write clear, detailed call notes for every live conversation

- Capture key insights that help the sales team close effectively

- Maintain clean, reliable data at all times

- Process Adherence & Improvement

- Follow Serviceflo’s sales process without deviation

- Accept feedback and coaching without ego

- Improve performance through repetition and execution

- Participate in training, reviews, and tea
etings as required



Compensation Structure

Base Salary

- $500-$750 USD per month

- Paid reliably and on time

- Intended to provide stability while performance bonuses reward excellence



"Performance Bonuses"

In addition to base salary, LGMs earn monthly performance bonuses, including:

- Bonuses for qualified discovery calls

- Bonuses for closed deals

- Bonus amounts are determined by:

- Lead quality

- Accuracy of qualification

- Overall contribution to revenue

- Top performers earn significantly more than base pay (Some near $1750-$2200)



What We’re Looking For

- We are looking for someone who:

- Speaks excellent, clear, professional English

- Is confident on the phone with U.S.-based clients

- Has outbound sales or call experience (preferred, not required)

- Follows instructions and structure precisely

- Is emotionally steady and professional under rejection

- Wants a long-term role with growth potential



This Role Is NOT a Fit If You:

- Avoid phone-based work

- Struggle to communicate clearly in English

- Dislike scripts, structure, or accountability

- Need constant supervision

- Are looking for short-term or temporary work

- Work Environment & Growth

- Fully remote

- Structured onboarding and training

- Clear expectations and feedback

- Opportunity to grow into senior sales or leadership roles

- Long-term stability for high performers



How to Apply

When applying, please answer the following questions clearly in a LOOM VIDEO:

- Are you comfortable making outbound calls daily to U.S.-based businesses? (Yes / No)

- Can you work full-time during U.S. business hours? (Yes / No)

- How would you rate your spoken English? (Basic / Good / Excellent)

- Give us a brief explanation of your relevant work experience

- What do you like to do outside of work?

Applications without complete answers may not be reviewed.



Final Note

We are building a serious company with serious standards.

If you take pride in:

Clear communication

Consistent execution

Doing things the right way

…this role could be an excellent long-term opportunity.

We look forward to reviewing applications from top-tier candidates only.

title: Sales Representative
description:
Join a fast-growing US online home goods retailer and enjoy the learning and opportunities that you have while working with us.



We strive to provide 5-star service & shopping assistance to all of our clients, and all of our team is accountable to fulfill this.



We are looking for a Sales Representative who can assist prospective buyers and close online ecommerce sales.



We're only looking for full-time, long-term, ongoing cooperation.



Work schedules available:

8 AM to 4 PM US EST

4 PM to 12 AM US EST



Your work week will be 5 days per week, with 2 days off per week. Days off will be selected with your manager. We will try to accommodate your preferences for which days you like, based on availability.



This role starts ASAP!!



Job Duties and Responsibilities:

Receive incoming phone calls and live chats from potential customers (prospects) who indicated that they need shopping assistance. This does not include calls and chats from existing customers that need help with their orders (that’s a job for a different department)

Makes follow-up calls, writes follow-up
s, and text messages to potential buyers. We try to follow up 5x with each person that contacted us (unless they indicate that they are no longer interested). We don’t do cold calling. Only reaching out to prospects who interacted with our online store and left their contact information.

After each interaction with a prospect/customer, writes notes & comments in our CRM (Asana)

Communicate efficiently and build rapport with potential customers

Assists prospects in their shopping journey and helps make the purchase decision

Ensures that all prospects’ questions and objections are addressed

Leads every interaction to a close sale, which means an order is placed on our online store

Prepares custom quotes, price matches competitors if necessary, and offers custom discounts. This requires calculating margins & ensuring profitability.

Answering questions about the products we offer, including technical questions. Learns the specifications, features and benefits of our bestsellers. Over time, becomes an expert in the industry.

If not able to answer product-specific questions, conducts research in the materials provided by the supplier, or reaches out to the supplier to get the information

Confirms stock availability and lead times when offering products to prospects

Documents standard procedures and best practices in a written form, so that other tea
mbers can learn from them



Requirements:

At least 2 years of experience in sales on the phone

Experience must include both inbound and outbound sales

Excellent written and verbal English communication skills

Experience in Customer Service on the phone is a nice to have

Experience in the e-commerce (online shopping) industry is nice to have

Home improvement, construction, and gas plumbing industry experience is a plus

Outgoing, friendly, and lively

Can-do mindset, with a sense of ownership, pride in your performance, and its impact on the company’s success

Long-term commitment - treat this as your career



What we can offer:

Sales commission: 8% of gross profit from all orders closed. Gross profit means the sale amount minus the product and shipping costs. Paid monthly. No upper limit. Monthly commission payouts range between $1,200 (the guaranteed minimum) and as high as $3,000 (for the top performer). The average monthly payout is $1,465 (average from the last 2 years).

$1,200/month minimum guaranteed pay

15 days paid days off per year (also convertible to min. guaranteed commission)

Paid training on all aspects of the role

Opportunities for professional development

Friendly atmosphere

Online Interview process

Fully remote position

title: Sales Representative
description:
READ THE JOB DESCRIPTION CAREFULLY:

title: Virtual Sales Operations Support
description:
Independent Contractor | Approximately 20 hours per week

Remote role | U.S. business hours required



Role Overview

This role supports a founder-led consulting business where priorities evolve quickly and preparation sometimes happens close to execution. Your job is to bring structure, follow-through, and accuracy behind the scenes so sales activity, executive meetings, and internal workflows stay organized and moving forward without constant oversight.

This is not a sales or closing role. It is an operational and executive support role for someone who stays steady under pressure, tracks details naturally, and takes pride in clean execution.



This Role Is NOT a Fit If

• You need stable, unchanging processes to work well

• You get frustrated when priorities shift

• You dislike last-minute requests

• You need highly detailed instructions before acting

• You want a sales or relationship-ownership role

• You are uncomfortable supporting live executive-level calls

• You are new to using AI tools and expect to learn them on the job

title: Junior Revit Documenter
description:
Company Description

Graphcad, founded in 1994, specializes in planning and documentation for the retail and commercial design sectors. The company is known for offering comprehensive design, detailing, project planning, and rollout strategies, with a focus on enhancing design efficiency to meet client expectations effectively. Leveraging a network of international partners and in-house expertise, Graphcad delivers tailored solutions for projects ranging from bespoke designs to large-scale rollouts. Utilizing the latest technology, the company ensures high-quality results aligned with client goals. Graphcad is committed to building strong, trust-based partnerships with a client-driven and responsive approach.



Role Description

The Junior Revit Documenter will assist in providing accurate and detailed Revit documentation for retail and commercial design projects. Key responsibilities include creating and maintaining Revit models, drafting 2D and 3D drawings, collaborating with senior tea
mbers, and ensuring compliance with design standards and project timelines. This is a contract role, based in Manila, with a hybrid working arrangement allowing some tasks to be completed remotely.



Qualifications

• Proficiency in Revit, AutoCAD, and other design software

• Ability to interpret architectural plans and technical specifications

• Attention to detail and strong organizational skills

• Familiarity with retail and commercial design projects is a plus

• Strong communication and teamwork abilities

• Ability to effectively manage time and meet deadlines

• Relevant educational background in Architecture, Drafting, or a related field

• Previous experience in a similar role or exposure to the retail/commercial fit-out design process is advantageous



Freelance Service Agreement to be offered with hourly rate of $8 to $12 AUD. Contractors to provide their own laptop that is capable of running Revit 2026. The Company will reimburse pre-approved, reasonable, and necessary out-of-pocket expenses directly related to the Services, provided receipts are submitted with invoices.



All required software will be provided by the company.



please submit all applications to 





Looking forward to it!

title: Creative Strategist – Meta Ads (DTC Performance)
description:
Type: Full-time or Part-time (contract-to-hire OK)



Works with: Founder, Media Buyer, Video Editor, Designer



Primary channels: Meta 
/Instagram) + landing page / advertorial funnel



What you’ll own

- You’ll own end-to-end creative strategy for paid social: customer research ? messaging angles ? creative briefs ? AI statics production ? iteration based on performance.



Responsibilities



Market + customer research

- Research competitors, offers, funnels, and creative patterns

- Build customer avatar docs (pain points, desired outcomes, objections, language)

Creative ideation + direction

- Generate weekly/monthly creative roadmap (themes, angles, concepts)

- Write clear briefs for static + video (hook, structure, scenes, b-roll, overlays, CTA)

- Develop testing matrices (angle x hook x format x offer)



Copywriting

- Draft / improve landing page copy, advertorial copy, and quiz copy

Creative production (AI statics)

- Generate static concepts using AI tools (Midjourney / Nano Banana / OpenAI image, etc.)

- Ensure brand consistency (palette, font style, layout discipline)

- Deliver ready-to-launch assets to the editor/designer



Collaboration

- Work daily/weekly with the video editor and designer to execute briefs fast

- Provide clear feedback based on performance and brand guidelines



Performance iteration

- Review results (thumbstop/CTR/CPC/CPA/CVR) and propose next tests

- Kill/scale creative based on data and learning, not opinions





What “good” looks like in 30 days

- You deliver a clear creative testing plan and run weekly cycles

- You ship consistent briefs and assets without hand-holding

- Creative velocity increases (more variants, better structure, faster iteration)



Requirements

- Proven performance creative experience for DTC (Meta is a must)

- Strong copy instincts (hooks, objections, offers, landing pages)

- Ability to produce AI statics (or willingness to learn fast)

Nice to have

Deliverables you’ll produce

- 10–30 static variants/week (depending on scope)

- 5–15 video briefs/week

- Landing page + advertorial + quiz copy drafts/iterations

title: Mortgage Loan Processor
description:
As a Mortgage Processor, you will play a crucial role in guiding loan files from submission through underwriting. Your responsibilities will include collecting and verifying documentation, maintaining clear and consistent communication with clients and internal teams, and ensuring each file meets all compliance requirements and lender guidelines. This position requires exceptional organizational skills, keen attention to detail, and the ability to work independently in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.



Key Duties and Responsibilities:

• Review and organize borrower documentation such as bank statements, ID, income docs, credit reports, etc.

• Ensure completeness and accuracy of the loan file prior to underwriting

• Communicate with borrowers, loan officers, and third-party vendors to gather missing documentation

• Submit files to lenders and follow up on conditions in a timely manner

• Maintain detailed notes in the CRM for each file

• Identify red flags or compliance issues and escalate as needed

• Stay updated with lender guidelines and loan product changes

• Work collaboratively with the processing and sales teams to meet deadlines

• Deliver white-glove service to every client by being proactive and solution-oriented



Success in This Role Looks Like:

• Fast turnaround on document collection and submission

• Clean, organized files with minimal back-and-forth from underwriters

• Consistent and professional communication

• Ability to handle multiple loan files at once with minimal supervision

• Contribution to a positive, accountable team culture



-Residential Properties

-Commercial Properties

-Non-QM loans



DON'T need but would benefit from knowing:

-Fix & Flip Loans

-New Construction

-Bridge loans



To Apply please send:



- A short video or voice message telling us why you’re the right person

- Your resume or short write-up of past experience

- List a prior job or employer that helped prepare you for this role

title: Finance Operations Lead (Standalone role) - Australian business
description:
Key Selling Points

• Join the inner circle of a unique Australian business… from your office!

• Learn from fun, hardworking & passionate coworkers in English

• Earn an above market income for your excellent contribution and grow with the business



Who we are?

We are an established Australian childcare group with five entities and A$10m turnover. Checkout this video as well as our website (
),
 (
/bilingualbyfive) and Instagram (
/bilingualbyfive) for more information. Our team has 80+ staff in Australia plus some remote support team based overseas! 



Who we’re looking for:

A reliable and autonomous Finance Operations Lead to independently manage the day-to-day finance function of the group. This is a standalone role suited to someone who takes ownership, builds structure, and works independently with less than four hours/week oversight.  



What you will do

You will effectively run the finance department operationally. This includes transactional finance tasks such as:

• Accounts payable management, bond and deposit receipts and repayment

• Payroll processing (multi-entity, approx. 80+ staff) 

• Bank & credit card reconciliations

• Intercompany charges and reconciliations

The role also includes accounting tasks such as:

• BAS & PAYGi preparation and submission.

• Monthly balance sheet reconciliations.

• Monthly P&L reviews and report to management.

• Payroll tax, superannuation preparation and submission.

• Annual tax return (prepared for external tax accountants).

• Workers compensation & insurance declaration and dividend statements.

• Ad hoc requests – you’ll receive different for initiatives to support the group.

Accounts receivable is largely automated via our billing system; this role focuses primarily on finance operations, accuracy, and reporting discipline.



Who we’re looking for:

• 7+ years experience in SME finance or bookkeeping

• Has worked as the “only finance person” somewhere (standalone role, minimal supervision)

• Has strong Xero experience

• Communicates clearly and confidently in English

• A motivated self-starter having a high level of self-discipline, accountability, great organization habits and keep moving forward without someone looking over your shoulder.

• Strong attention to detail and ability to check your own work

• Expertise in Outlook, Excel, Word, Sharepoint & Powerpoint and is able to document business processes

• Experience using Asana or equivalent task management software is preferred

• Availability and commitment to work within GMT+8 working hours. (8:30am-5:30pm Perth time)

• Someone who handles confidential and sensitive information with discretion and professionalism.

Work environment requirements

- A dedicated space for the home office that free from distractions 

- A steady and fast internet connection with the minimum speed of 50 Mbps, which the internet modem available next to the working desk for the IP phone installation

- Credit towards coworking office costs for the right candidate



Employment type:

• Full time



Remuneration

• Full time starting from A$2,000/month (?85,000/month)



The Perks:

• Working from your own home office or local coworking space!

• 32 days per year of paid leave! (covering Australian Public Holidays as well as holiday and sick absences)

• Reimbursement of internet and electricity or coworking space costs

• Company provided laptop and phone

• Up to 20% bonus every month if you make your supervisors love you

• Learn from and experience ex-accountant owner, external accountants and consultant bookkeeper



If you’re up for the challenge, suitable with the requirements that we need, we look forward to receiving your application. The more clearly you show your qualities against our job description requirements higher the chance of us requesting an interview with you.

mber.

description:

title: Part Time Executive Assistant to the Founder
description:
About Lavea Content Lab

Lavea Content Lab is a content distribution and visibility agency helping real estate brands stay consistently visible across platforms through disciplined execution and structured systems.



We operate with clarity, ownership, and operational precision. We value structure over chaos, follow-through over noise, and execution over intention.



We are hiring an Executive Assistant to work directly with the Founder and help strengthen the operational backbone of the agency.



Role Overview

This is not a general virtual assistant role.

This is a structured execution role designed for someone who thrives in systems, communicates proactively, and takes ownership of outcomes.

You will support founder priorities, operations, marketing coordination, hiring support, and CRM administration.

The role begins on an hourly basis (time tracked per task). Based on performance and business growth, this may transition into a long-term or full-time position.



Your core mandate:

Protect priorities.

Create clarity.

Ensure follow-through.



Work Schedule

Hourly engagement (task-based time tracking)

Supporting US Eastern Time (EST)

Monday to Friday availability required



Core Responsibilities

1. Executive & Founder Support

Manage calendar scheduling across time zones

Monitor inbox and prioritise messages

Convert rough instructions into:

Structured ClickUp tasks

Action lists

Organised trackers

Prepare summaries, outlines, and research briefs

Conduct independent online research to support decisions, outreach, and strategy

You are expected to organise ambiguity and present it clearly.



2. Operations & Project Coordination

Track client and internal projects inside ClickUp

Follow up with tea
mbers on deadlines and deliverables

Update task statuses accurately

Flag blockers early

Maintain visibility so leadership knows:

What is in progress

What is delayed

What requires decisions

You are the accountability layer between planning and completion.



3. Marketing & Content Support

Assist with content scheduling and uploads

Format and organise blog posts and captions

Support podcast and collaboration outreach:

Research

List building

Tracking

Scheduling

Assist with basic
 marketing setup and performance tracking



4. CRM, Sales & Administrative Support

Maintain organised and updated lead trackers

Manage Google Sheets / Excel data accurately

Support prospect and partner follow-ups

Prepare contact lists and outreach sheets

Ensure no lead, message, or follow-up is missed



5. Hiring & Systems Documentation

Track job applications and candidate progress

Organise interview schedules

Maintain hiring scorecards and notes

Help document repeatable workflows into SOPs

Strengthen internal systems over time



Tools You Should Be Comfortable With

Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Calendar)

Google Sheets / Excel (intermediate level required)

Slack

ClickUp or other project management tools

CRM systems and structured trackers

AI tools (ChatGPT or similar) to increase efficiency

You should be tech-comfortable and able to learn new tools quickly.



Requirements

Experience as an Executive Assistant, Operations Assistant, or Senior VA

Strong research skills (accurate, structured, efficient)

Strong written and spoken English

Highly organised and detail-oriented

Independent — able to execute without constant supervision

Proactive communicator (updates before being asked)

Comfortable with time tracking and structured workflows



What We Value at Lavea Content Lab

Discipline – respect for systems and deadlines

Communication – clear, early, professional updates

Transparency – visibility into progress and blockers

Care – thoughtful execution and respect for the work



What Success Looks Like

Founder priorities are protected and organised

Tasks move forward without reminders

Deadlines are met consistently

Systems stay structured and updated

Operations feel calm, predictable, and efficient



Who This Role Is For And Who It Is Not

This role is for someone who takes pride in responsibility.

You enjoy structured environments.

You respect systems.

You like making complex things organised.



This role is not for:

Someone looking for passive task execution

Someone who needs step-by-step instructions for everything

Someone uncomfortable with accountability

Someone who avoids proactive communication

Someone who sees Executive Assistant as entry-level



We are building a disciplined agency.

The person in this role supports the operational backbone of growth.



Make sure to fill out this form so you can proceed to the next step: 



You can check the full detail of the role here:

title: Influencer Research, Outreach VA (NO EXPERIENCE NEEDED)
description:
TURN YOUR SOCIAL MEDIA SCROLLING INTO A REMOTE JOB (Influencer Research + DM VA)

If you spend way too much time on Instagram/TikTok checking gym creators, this might be the easiest job you ever land.



We’re a Gen-Z–run app studio building a fast-growing fitness app, and we’re hiring VAs to help us research, reach out to, and build relationships with influencers.



- No experience required.

- No resume required.

- Just strong English + good judgment + social media instincts.

- Must work NYC timezones! (in between 9am to 5pm)



If you understand gym culture, talk like a human, and type like a native English speaker, you’re already ahead of 99% of applicants.





WHAT YOU’LL DO

This role is part lead generation, part DM outreach, part relationship management.



Your daily tasks:

- Find new fitness creators (gym/lifting niche only)

- Add them to our Google Sheet with the correct info (username, followers, country,
, etc.)

- Evaluate their profile quality (are they legit, on-brand, and worth reaching out to?)

- DM influencers using our scripts

- Handle the conversation in a friendly, natural, professional way

- Answer questions, keep the convo alive, and push creators toward collaboration

- Follow up consistently

- Track responses and organize leads properly



You’ll basically be the person discovering new influencers and bringing them into the brand.

We’ll teach you everything, you just need strong English and social media instincts.





YOU’RE A FIT IF YOU

- Have very strong written English (this is the #1 requirement)

- Can communicate clearly and confidently

- Know the gym/fitness niche (huge bonus)

- Are organized and detail-oriented

- Can follow instructions EXACTLY

- Are comfortable reaching out to people on social media

- Have good judgment (can spot fake/farm accounts instantly)

- Are under 28 (our team is young)

- Want part-time remote work you can do from anywhere



We don’t care about degrees. We care about output, consistency, and attitude.





WHAT WE OFFER

- Remote work

- Fast replies, fast onboarding

- Fun Gen-Z team

- Simple tasks anyone smart can do

- Performance-based promotions

- The chance to handle creator deals + negotiations once you prove yourself





TEST 1 (WHEN APPLIYING)— Influencer Sheet Review + Research



Use this Google Sheet template (make a copy): 
/drive/folders/1hDVQyxHEi-ZmaKfmGk1KWSzqrxKSM-Q7?usp=drive_link



You must complete:

Rows 5–15 — PASS or FAIL



Look at the creators already listed and ONLY fill the PASS / FAIL column.

Base your decision on:

- Fitness relevance

- Content quality

- Legitimacy

- Whether they make sense for a collab

- Don’t edit any other columns.

* A little tip, there are less than 5 that are good :) *



Rows 16–25 — Add 10 New Fitness Creators

Add:

- Username

- Profile link

- Number of followers

- Median views (approximately)

- Full name

-
 (if public)

- Any other obvious info



These must be real gym/lifting creators. No deep digging. Just fast and accurate.





TEST 2 (AFTER YOU GOT SELECTED FOR THE 2ND ROUND) — 1-3 Minutes Introduction Video



Record a simple phone video (no editing needed) and answer:

- Who you are

- Any experience with customer support jobs, social media or research

- How comfortable you are chatting with influencers through DMs

- Why you’re a good fit for this role



Just speak clearly and naturally.





HOW TO APPLY

Reply to this job post with:

A Google Drive link containing:

- Your completed Google Sheet (for TEST 1 tasks)



Answers to these short questions (in text form in the message you send when applying):

- How many hours/day or week can you work?

- Working Regular NYC TIME hours

- Are you more comfortable with part-time or full-time?

- Are you comfortable handling DM conversations?



Applications missing either test 1 OR answers to the questions will be ignored automatically.

Write “Philippines #1” at the end of your last question's answer so we know you actually read this :)

title: Pricing & Promotions Assistant
description:
Company 

Kathy Kuo Home is a luxury online home furnishings destination on a mission to help everyone #lovewhereyoulive.  Kathy Kuo Home carries a highly curated collection of home furnishings while offering clients premium interior design services and easy-to-shop look books. Kathy Kuo Home believes that shopping for great design should be fun, easy, and inspiring, so it provides everything from design inspiration to flawless execution in one vertically integrated platform, allowing customers to create a space they will cherish for years to come. 



Curated Collection and Ecommerce

Under the direction of celebrated designer Kathy Kuo, the company serves as the premier online boutique for luxury furniture, lighting, and home decor. The assortment is curated with a design-first approach that offers exclusive access to impeccably-crafted designer pieces from top manufacturers and artisans around the world. 



Full Service Interior Design Studio

In addition to its aspirational collection, Kathy Kuo Home is also a full-service interior design studio with a robust menu of Design Services. Kathy Kuo Home’s roster of professional interior designers combine a high-touch, personalized approach with the latest in design technology to help customers with all of their design needs—from small updates and refreshes, to gut renovations and building entirely new homes.



Trade Business

Kathy Kuo Home is proud to offer a top-tier Trade business that provides the interior design and architecture communities with an inspiring selection of luxe homewares and furnishings at competitive trade prices. Additionally, Kathy Kuo Home provides its Trade customers with a dedicated concierge team to ensure a best-in-class customer service experience throughout the entire design process. Combining service, commerce, and technology, Kathy Kuo Home is the ultimate one-stop home and design destination.



_______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________



About the Role:

We’re looking for a detail-driven and proactive Pricing & Promotions Assistant to support the accuracy and execution of our promotional strategy and product pricing. This role will work cross-functionally with the buying teams to ensure all pricing and promotional updates are correctly reflected across our catalog and website. You’ll help maintain data accuracy, flag discrepancies, and support timely updates to drive margin, revenue, and a seamless customer experience.



Responsibilities:

*Execute and QA all promotional pricing and discount uploads in collaboration with the buying team

*Monitor and resolve pricing discrepancies across our site listings and invoices

*Support price updates across categories, collections, and exclusive lines in a timely and accurate manner

*Conduct regular audits to ensure accuracy in promotional calendars and sitewide pricing

*Maintain documentation of active promotions, historical pricing, and vendor promo terms

*Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure smooth execution of price changes during major sale events



Qualifications:

*1–2 years of experience in e-commerce operations, merchandising, or data entry

*Highly organized and detail-oriented with a strong sense of ownership

*Proficient in Excel/Google Sheets and comfortable managing large datasets

*Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with frequent updates and deadlines

*A self-starter mindset and a passion for process improvement



Please submit a 2 minute video introduction and your resume. 

___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________



Culture and Values

The Kathy Kuo Home tea
mbers are design-obsessed, entrepreneurial-minded and empathy-oriented individuals that seek to create more impact and beauty in the world of interiors.  As one of the fastest growing online companies in the home and garden space, it is a fantastic time to join Kathy Kuo Home’s fast-paced, nimble, and creative team. 



Core Values

*We Employ First Principles Design Thinking | First principles design thinking  involves breaking down a complex problem or situation into its fundamental components and then reassembling them from scratch by challenging assumptions and developing a deep understanding of underlying principles. 



*We are Limitless Learners | We are curious by nature and aim to be 1?tter every day by learning 1 new thing a day.



*We Strive To Be Self-Aware | We are self-reflective and deeply curious about ourselves. We believe with a deep awareness of oneself, can one develop awareness for others.



*We Play the Long Game | We have an infinite horizon for growth and lean into business decisions that have a long-lasting impact on brand growth



Core Principles

*We have Deep Kindness and Respect for All | Our business model is supported by the relationships that we have with our customers, vendors, and shippers. We treat our tea
mbers, shippers, and vendors with the same spirit of kindness, willingness to collaborate, and respect for their needs.



*We Lead with Empathy | When faced with hard choices, we lean into empathy and compassion first as our primary decision drivers. We proactively reach out to celebrate each other's success and buoy those that need us.



*We Require Feedback | Giving and receiving feedback promotes a culture of self-awareness, growth, and humility, the foundations of strong inter-department connection.



*We are Humble and Hungry | We operate with a startup mentality, scrappy and intentional with how we use our human and financial resources no matter what scale of business we are in.



*We Audit the Details - Design and Service | We deeply audit all details and have hyper-awareness of process, cause, and effect and how this relates to our design and service quality output.



*We Keep Calm / Grace Under Fire | We solve problems by being self-aware, open-minded, and accepting of different ideas and opinions and strive to be calm, reflective, and not defensive.

_______________________________________________________________________________________________________

title: Part-Time Virtual Assistant (AI & Video Apprenticeship – Paid Training Included)
description:
Important Note About Pay (Please Read First)



This role starts at a lower hourly rate because it includes paid professional training valued at over $2,000 USD.



If you are mainly looking for the highest hourly pay, this role is not a good fit.

If you are excited to learn valuable skills, gain real experience, and grow long-term, please continue reading.



?



About the Role



I’m building a video advertising and personal content business focused on short-form video (Reels, TikTok, YouTube Shorts) and AI-assisted workflows.



I’m looking for a motivated, reliable Virtual Assistant who wants to learn while working and grow alongside a business from the ground up.



This is an apprenticeship-style role:

You’ll be paid for your time and trained in skills that are in high demand worldwide.



?



What You’ll Be Doing

 • Assisting with short-form video content (Reels, TikTok, YouTube Shorts)

Important:

Training time is paid.

Starting Pay & Growth

 • Skills improve

This role is designed to grow with you.



?



Required Skills

Beginner experience is absolutely fine.



?



Who This Role Is Best For

While you’re free to use the skills you learn elsewhere, priority opportunities and advanced training will go to team members who stay engaged and committed.



?



Commitment Expectation



Because this role includes paid training, applicants should be open to a minimum commitment period once training begins.



?



How to Apply

title: Full-time Healthcare Accountant
description:
This job requires a person with a keen eye for detail and is good at following instructions so be sure to read the job description until the end!



Location: Remote

Job Type: Full-Time

Work Hours: 8 am to 4 pm Central Time (9 pm to 5 am Philippine Time)

Salary: $1000 +shift differential +benefits

Hours Per Week: 40



Benefits:

- Competitive salary.

- 10 days Paid time off.

- 4 US and 5 Philippine holidays.

- 13th month pay

- Internet, SSS, Pag-ibig & PhilHealth reimbursement.

- Opportunities for professional development and growth.

- Collaborative and supportive work environment.



Are you one of those unique accountants that likes the 'clean-up' a messy balance sheet or help build processes from scratch? We are professional services company in the healthcare industry. We are currently growing our accounting services line quickly and need a full-time experienced accountant to assist in accounting and controllership functions. You will be working on a number of entities (clients) depending on the volume. 



Key Responsibilities:

- Implementation of accounting software. 

- Leading desktop valuation projects - obtaining asset lists from clients and performing the valuation research. 

- Preparing valuation reports. 

- Bank and balance sheet reconciliations - monthly reconciliations are required. And many of our clients choose us because they aren't where they need to be. You'll need to be comfortable spending some time to figure out what the process is that will help us fix any recon issues. 

- Monthly closing - We target closing the books upon reconciliation and all entries made within 7 days of the month-end. 

- Monthly reporting - Accountant will distribute monthly reports (Balance Sheet / Income Statements / A/R / Segment Reporting and Consolidated Reporting). 

- Calculating G/L entries and accruals - Each G/L account has its own controls and SOPs. Our accountants learn each, track historical trends, calculate and enter journal entries. 



Qualifications:

- Bachelor’s degree in a related field.  

- Experience with implementing software is a plus. 

- Experience with valuations is a plus. 

- Excellent attention to detail and accuracy.  

- Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.  

- Strong written and oral English communication.  

- Excellent time management and organizational skills.  

- 3-5 years of experience in accounting.

We've worked with OnlineJobs.ph for many years and currently employ more than a dozen tea

title: Shopify Brand Designer & Storytelling Strategist
description:
TYPE OF EMPLOYMENT



Contract / Freelance (Open to Long-Term)



JOB DESCRIPTION



I’m looking for a skilled Shopify professional who understands brand storytelling, visual identity, and symbolic messaging, not just surface-level design.



Allegedly Enlighten is a clothing brand built around a core truth:

Reality is layered. Identity is constructed. We exist inside illusion, samsara, and systems that shape perception (what many would call “the matrix”).



This brand is not about preaching or explaining everything explicitly.

The people who get it will recognize the message immediately.

Everyone else will simply see mystical, symbolic, and visually striking designs that feel meaningful even if they can’t fully explain why.



Your role will be to rebuild the brand image and Shopify store so it tells a cohesive, honest story through:



Visual hierarchy



Layout and flow



Copy tone



Symbolism and subtle narrative cues



Key Responsibilities



Rebuild and refine the Shopify storefront (design + structure)



Develop a cohesive brand aesthetic that feels mystical, grounded, and intentional



Help translate abstract philosophical ideas into clean, wearable branding



Improve product page storytelling (without over-explaining)



Ensure the site feels premium, intentional, and emotionally resonant



Optimize for clarity, flow, and conversion without losing meaning



What I’m Looking For



Strong Shopify experience (themes, layout, UX)



A good eye for symbolism, minimalism, and narrative-driven design



Comfort working with philosophical, spiritual, or metaphysical concepts



Someone who understands that less explanation often creates more impact



Ability to collaborate and interpret vision, not just follow instructions



This is not a generic streetwear brand.

This is a signal.

title: Video Editor needed for regular, ongoing work
description:
THE COMPANY

Avalon Creative Group is a dynamic and innovative company headquartered in the heart of the San Francisco Bay Area and Silicon Valley in California. We specialize in the creation of captivating and immersive content for corporate clients, offering comprehensive content design, production, and creative services. Working with Avalon Creative Group presents an exciting opportunity for individuals seeking to collaborate with renowned brands, while also offering a continuous learning environment that fosters personal and professional growth.



JOB DESCRIPTION

Avalon Creative Group is seeking a talented and experienced video editor and 3D animator based in the Philippines to work with us as an independent contractor. Our work includes videos to inspire audiences at corporate events, on-demand marketing webinars, internal corporate training and sales enablement, product demos, highlight reels, social media ads, interviews, customer testimonials and more. 



Our goal is to establish a long term working relationship with a creative, reliable and ambitious video professional. After successfully completing an initial trial period, the right person will become an integral member of our creative team on a full-time contract basis.



RESPONSIBILITIES

> Edit high quality videos from a variety of sources, including single-camera, multi-camera, stock footage, AI generated video, graphic elements, music, sound effects, etc.

> Effectively and efficiently generate video footage and elements using the latest AI tools

> Manage accuracy and correction of color and audio

> Understand and apply corporate branding and style guidelines and templates (MOGRTs)

> Manage, organize and backup video assets and deliverables, including raw footage, graphics, sound files, stock footage, projects, files, etc.

> Adhere to budgeted time constraints while incorporating client feedback and changes through multiple rounds of review and revisions

> Contribute to and consistently apply efficient workflow processes and standards (SOPs)

> Document guidelines and process details for tea
mbers and clients

> Pursue ongoing professional development and skill enhancements



REQUIRED SKILLS

> Having a proven track record of punctuality, reliability and professionalism is essential

> Excellent attention to detail and adeptness at managing multiple concurrent projects is required

> Strong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a remote team environment

> English fluency (written and spoken) along with excellent communication skills are essential

> You must be based in the Philippines with fast, reliable internet access and a robust computer

> You must have a quiet workspace where you can work without distractions and join Zoom calls



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE

> At least 2 years of professional experience and proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite, specifically Premiere Pro and After Effects

> Bonus if you have experience or proficiency with using 3D software like Blender, Cinema4D, or anything similar.

> You must have strong creative skills and a portfolio of work that demonstrates your passion and experience with video editing and motion graphics

>> Your portfolio must include examples of the type of work listed in the job description section

> Expertise in video editing fundamentals and techniques, including pacing, storytelling, and continuity

> Knowledge of different video formats and codecs for various delivery platforms



PREFERRED EXPERIENCE

> 5 years of experience with Adobe Premiere Pro and After Effects.

> At least 2 years of experience and proficiency with Blender or Cinema 4D.

> Proficiency in color correction, audio editing, and mastering

> Familiarity with team communication and project management tools like Smartsheet, Slack, ClickUp, or similar platforms

> Familiarity or experience using AI post-production tools

> Strong understanding of visual composition, typography, and graphic design principles

> Completion of training and/or certifications in key software used

> Knowledge of social media platforms and video encoding specifications for each platform



COMPENSATION & ENGAGEMENT

> Compensation rate for full-time, independent contractor will be $1000 - $1300 USD per month

> Ten paid holidays and ten days of accrued paid time off (PTO) will be included annually

> Rate will be based on qualifications and experience

> This is a remote work position

> Work hours will need to overlap with standard business hours in California (9:00-6:00pm PT)



HOW TO APPLY

If you are interested in working with us as an independent contractor and you meet the required qualifications listed above, please APPLY HERE -

title: Procurement Manager
description:
We are a dynamic and growing food manufacturing company committed to delivering excellence in our products/services. Our team thrives on innovation, efficiency, and collaboration to meet our customers' needs. We are looking for a detail-oriented and proactive Procurement Manager to join our team and optimize our supply chain operations.



---



Job Summary



The Procurement Manager is responsible for managing the end-to-end supply chain process, from sourcing and purchasing materials to coordinating logistics and ensuring timely delivery. This role focuses on cost efficiency, supplier relationship management, and seamless logistics operations to support company objectives.



---



Key Responsibilities



Procurement:



· Identify, evaluate, and select suppliers based on quality, cost, reliability, and service.

· Negotiate contracts, terms, and pricing with suppliers to secure favorable agreements.

· Process purchase orders (POs) and ensure timely placement of orders.

· Monitor supplier performance and maintain strong relationships to ensure compliance and continuous improvement.

· Conduct market research and analysis to identify cost-saving opportunities and new suppliers.

· Manage inventory levels to prevent shortages or excess stock, optimizing working capital.



Supply Chain Coordination 

· Track shipments and ensure on-time delivery.

· Coordinate with brokers to handle customs clearance and international shipping documentation (if applicable).

· Collaborate with warehouse teams to ensure efficient receipt, storage, and dispatch of goods.

· Resolve logistics-related issues, such as delays, damages, or losses, and implement corrective actions.

· Ensure compliance with relevant regulations, including safety, environmental, and trade laws.



Data Management & Reporting:



· Maintain accurate records of purchases, shipments, inventory, and supplier information.

· Use ERP to manage procurement and logistics data.

· Prepare reports on procurement metrics, logistics performance, and cost analysis.

· Support budgeting and forecasting activities related to procurement and logistics.



Cross-functional Collaboration:



· Work closely with production, sales, finance, and quality assurance teams to align supply chain activities with business needs.

· Participate in process improvement initiatives to enhance efficiency and reduce costs.



---



Qualifications & Skills



Education:



· Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or Supply Chain Management or a related field.



Experience:



· Proven experience in procurement, logistics, or supply chain roles 

· Familiarity with procurement processes, inventory management, and international logistics (if applicable).

· Experience with ERP systems and procurement software.



Skills:



· Strong negotiation and vendor management skills.

· Excellent organizational and time-management abilities.

· Analytical mindset with proficiency in data analysis and reporting.

· Effective communication and interpersonal skills.

· Ability to work under pressure and solve problems proactively.

· Knowledge of supply chain regulations and best practices.



How to Apply



Interested candidates should submit their resume and cover letter to 
 with the subject line “Procurement Manager – [Your Name].”

title: Senior Level Meta Media Buyer
description:
Meta Ads Media Buyer 
 & Instagram) Senior Level Long Term



Company: Candor Marketing

Compensation: Based on experience plus performance bonuses

Start Date: ASAP



About Candor Marketing

Candor Marketing is a growing U.S. based digital marketing agency that helps service businesses generate leads and build authority through content and paid advertising.



We are looking for a high level Meta Ads Media Buyer who can take ownership of ad accounts, think strategically, and improve performance without needing constant direction.



This is a long term role for someone who wants stability and growth with an agency over the next several years.



Who This Role Is For

You deeply understand Meta Ads and do more than boost posts.

You understand funnels, buyer psychology, and conversion strategy.

You can build, launch, optimize, and scale campaigns on your own.

You check accounts daily and actively look for ways to improve performance.

You bring ideas, tests, and recommendations without being asked.

You think like a strategist, not just someone who manages ads.



We are looking for someone who can take ownership so our team does not have to manage the ads day to day.



Responsibilities



Campaign Strategy and Setup

Build and structure Meta campaigns from scratch

Create and manage the following campaign types:

Lead generation campaigns

DM campaigns (Messenger and Instagram)

Follow and engagement campaigns

Traffic and conversion campaigns

Landing page campaigns



Build full funnel structures:

Cold audiences

Warm audiences

Retargeting campaigns

Top of funnel, middle of funnel, bottom of funnel



Set up and manage:

Meta Pixel

Conversion tracking and events

Custom audiences

Lookalike audiences

Conversions API when needed



Funnel and Conversion Optimization

Understand and optimize landing pages, lead forms, VSL funnels, and appointment funnels

Identify drop off points and recommend improvements

Work with our team to improve offers, hooks, messaging, and creative direction



Daily Optimization and Account Management

Check all active ad accounts daily

Monitor CPL, CPA, CTR, CPM, frequency, and conversion rates

Pause underperforming ads quickly

Adjust budgets and scale winning campaigns

Continuously test new audiences, creatives, angles, and campaign structures



Audits and Performance Improvement

Perform full ad account audits when needed

Identify structure issues, tracking problems, funnel bottlenecks, and scaling opportunities

Provide clear recommendations to improve performance

Continuously look for ways to increase lead volume, improve lead quality, and lower costs



Reporting and Communication

Provide weekly performance summaries

Share key wins, losses, tests being run, and next optimization steps

Communicate proactively and clearly without needing to be asked for updates



Required Experience

At least 3 years of professional Meta Ads experience

Proven results generating leads for service based businesses

Experience with DM campaigns, lead forms, and landing page conversion campaigns

Strong understanding of retargeting and full funnel strategy

Experience managing multiple ad accounts



Preferred Experience

Agency experience

Experience with GoHighLevel, ClickFunnels, or similar platforms

Experience setting up and troubleshooting Pixels and Conversions API

Ability to review ad creative and suggest improvements



What Success Looks Like

Ad accounts are checked and optimized daily

Campaigns are structured correctly without constant direction

Cost per lead improves over time

New tests and ideas are launched regularly

Our team does not need to manage or babysit the ads



Work Expectations

Full time availability preferred

Partial overlap with U.S. working hours

Reliable internet and communication

Long term mindset



Compensation

Competitive monthly salary based on experience

Performance bonuses based on results

Opportunity for long term growth and increased responsibility



How to Apply

Please include the following:



Your years of experience running Meta Ads and the types of campaigns you manage

Screenshots or case studies showing results such as CPL, CPA, or ROAS

A short Loom video (2 to 3 minutes) explaining a campaign you built, how you structured it, and how you optimized it

The word Candor at the top of your application so we know you read this



We are looking for a serious, high level media buyer who takes ownership, thinks strategically, and wants a long term role with a growing agency.
