title: Online Reputation Manager & SEO Specialist – E-Commerce Brand
description:
Online Reputation Manager & SEO Specialist – E-Commerce Brand



We are a growing health & wellness dropshipping brand operating in the DACH region (Germany, Austria, Switzerland). We've been live with this store for 5 months.



The Problem:

A single negative Trustpilot review from late January 2026 triggered a chain reaction – we now have 3 one-star reviews (100% negative), rating at 2.8. The complaints center around product expectations, pricing perception, and return policy confusion. Before this, we had zero complaints. This is now severely affecting our conversion rate and brand trust in Google search results.



What We Need:



1. Trustpilot Reputation Recovery & Review Removal

- Analyze existing negative reviews for potential Trustpilot guideline violations

- Report and request removal of reviews that violate Trustpilot's policies (false claims, defamatory content, competitor sabotage, etc.)

- Handle the full dispute and flagging process with Trustpilot on our behalf

- Develop a strategy to generate genuine positive reviews from our satisfied customer base

- Set up automated post-purchase review request flows

- Craft professional responses to any remaining negative reviews

- Ongoing Trustpilot profile monitoring and management



2. SEO & Search Reputation

- Push positive brand content higher in Google search results

- Suppress negative content visibility in SERPs

- On-page and off-page SEO optimization

- Content strategy to build brand authority (blog posts, PR mentions, quality backlinks)



3. Overall Brand Trust Building

- Strengthen social proof across platforms

- Review platform diversification strategy

- Social media reputation monitoring

- Build trust signals that support a dropshipping business model (shipping transparency, brand storytelling, customer testimonials)



About Our Business:

- Dropshipping model – products sourced from suppliers and shipped directly to customers

- 3 negative Trustpilot reviews (all 1-star, all from Jan-Feb 2026)

- Main complaints: product-price perception gap, return policy clarity, delivery times

- We are actively working on improving the underlying operational issues

- Products sold via our own branded webshop



Ideal Candidate:

- Proven track record in Online Reputation Management (ORM) with case studies

- Experience with Trustpilot review removal/dispute process specifically

- Familiarity with managing reputation for dropshipping or e-commerce brands

- Strong SEO skills (on-page, off-page, technical)

- Understanding of German/DACH market is a strong plus



In Your Proposal, Please Include:

- Examples of successfully removed or disputed Trustpilot reviews

- Past ORM projects with measurable before/after results

- Your specific strategy for recovering from 100% negative Trustpilot reviews

- Experience with dropshipping brand reputation challenges

- Realistic timeline for visible improvement

- Pricing structure (hourly or project-based)



Budget: Open to discussion based on experience and proposed scope

Project Type: Ongoing, starting immediately

Urgency: High

title: Wedding Video Editor
description:
Hello there,



Hope you are doing well!



My wife and I are wedding photographers based in Canada and we are expanding our services to now offer wedding highlight films. We are looking for a talented wedding video editor to help us craft emotional, cinematic 2 to 3 minute highlight films for our couples.



This will be a project based role.



- 2-3 minute highlight wedding video

- Creation of 2-5 Instagram Vertical Reels for our Instagram and Tiktok of select 
nts of the day. 



Our vision is simple. We want films that feel intentional, elevated, emotionally driven, and beautifully paced. Not flashy. Not over edited. We want storytelling that feels refined and timeless. Clean color grading, thoughtful audio layering, strong music selection, and smooth transitions are essential.



You must have experience editing weddings. Please do not apply if you have not worked with wedding footage before. Understanding vows, speeches, emotional pacing, and storytelling structure is critical.



We are looking for someone who can take raw footage and turn it into a powerful short film that feels cinematic and heartfelt. Strong English comprehension is important since dialogue and speeches will be central to the story.



This will be hired per project, depending on our bookings. As we introduce video into our packages, volume will grow over time.



We are easy to work with and open to collaboration, but we do have a clear aesthetic and brand direction. We are looking for someone who wants to grow with us and refine this offering together.



If you are passionate about emotional storytelling and crafting beautiful wedding films, we would love to connect.



Example videos:







Thank you for your

title: Tax Attorney
description:
The ideal candidate has exposure to U.S. federal tax matters and is comfortable working within structured systems, meeting deadlines, and supporting IRS administrative proceedings under supervision.



MANDATORY QUALIFICATIONS



• Active bar license in at least one U.S. state or U.S. territory

• In good standing with all applicable bar authorities

• Must have or be eligible to obtain an IRS CAF (Centralized Authorization File) number

• Juris Doctor (J.D.) from an accredited law school

• Minimum 2 years of legal experience

• Exposure to U.S. federal tax law (controversy, compliance, or planning)

• Strong legal research and drafting skills

• Excellent written English

• Reliable high-speed internet and professional remote work setup



PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS



• Experience with IRS administrative procedures

• Familiarity with IRS transcripts and collections processes

• Drafting experience including audit responses, protest letters, appeals submissions, penalty abatement requests, and Offer in Compromise documentation

• LLM in Taxation (preferred but not required)

• Experience using legal case management systems



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES



• Legal research and preparation of memoranda

• Drafting IRS correspondence and administrative submissions

• Reviewing tax returns, financial records, and supporting documentation

• Assisting in audit defense and appeals preparation

• Supporting tax planning research and analysis

• Maintaining organized case documentation

• Collaborating with supervising attorneys to meet internal production timelines



COMPENSATION

Performance-based incentives available. Long-term growth opportunity within an expanding tax practice.

title: Welcome to K-POP Universe : Office Admin Role for E-Commerce ! Join the Beat !
description:
- Recruitment validity period: Until 3 business days from the date of the first recruitment announcement

- A PH VA team of more than 5 people has already been formed, and business collaboration is possible using Tagalog in a comfortable atmosphere.

- Providing educational tutorial videos and operating a mentorship program to help new comers quickly adapt



[About Us]

* Company Introduction (Video):

youtu.be/dO2mWWZANx8



[Join Summitree and Write Your K-POP Legacy Alongside Filipinos]

Summitree envisions leveraging their Filipino employees' intelligence and English fluency to expand globally while sharing their passion for K-POP. They highlight the Philippines' crucial role in their expansion plans, emphasizing collaboration with their Filipino team to make a mark in the K-POP world. Joining Summitree means joining a multicultural team (Korea, Philippines, Mongolia, Others) with a shared goal of making K-POP history.



[Responsibilities]

We are looking for a “Full-Time” Office Admin to handle our business.

You will be doing a variety of tasks, almost all of which we will create tutorials for you.

1. Order fulfillment and shipping label generation

You will be responsible for gathering and processing customer orders accurately and efficiently. This includes coordinating with third-party logistics (3PL) providers for inbound and outbound shipments to ensure smooth operations.

2. Product listing and scheduling

As a distributor of K-POP records and merchandise, you will be involved in registering new products into our system. This includes managing inventory, updating product information, and ensuring accurate data entry. Additionally, you will be responsible for scheduling release dates and managing timelines using tools like Google Calendar.

3. Sales & Marketing

You will be responsible for studying and trying how to gain traffics to our shopping mall. Active working on research articles related to SEO, social marketing and finding where and how to promote our shopping mall is required.

4. Customer service support

providing excellent customer service is crucial to us. You will be responsible for addressing customer inquiries, resolving issues, and ensuring customer satisfaction. Your communication skills and problem-solving abilities will play a vital role in maintaining strong relationships with our valued customers.



[Required qualifications & skillset (must have)]

* Excellent written and verbal English communication skills

* Experience in puchasing K-POP Album or knowledge of K-POP related products (album, merchandise)

* Idea of how to promote K-POP albums and gain traffics in our shopping mall in PH online K-POP community for each artists



[Desired qualifications & skillset (nice to have)]

* Experience in handling customer service

* Experience in Photoshop

* Experience in
 Ads or Google Ads

* Knowledge and Experience of Microsoft Excel & Familar with Using Various Formula

* Experience in experience in Amazon Business (Familiar with Interface and function) or other E-commerce Platform



[Compensation & Employment Terms]

* ONLY Looking for a full time employee

* $300~$400/mo. determined based on the candidate’s skills, experience, and overall evaluation relative to other applicants

* One-year renewable Contract

- Compensation and terms may be adjusted based on attendance, teamwork, and performance.

- Exceptional performers may be considered for early renewal or adjustment. (multiple successful cases)

* 6-month probationary period with possibility of early conversion to regular position based on performance (multiple successful cases)



[Perks & Benefits]

1. Regular Employee Benefits

- 13th Month Salary provided

- 10 additional paid leave days upon regularization

2. Birthday Benefit (After 6 Months of Employment)

- Receive one free K-POP album of your favorite artist on your birthday

3. Paid Holidays (Regardless of Employment Status)

- January 1st (New Year’s Day) and Christmas Day are paid holidays

- Applies to both probationary and regular employees

4. Performance-Based Incentives

- Additional incentives may be provided during high-performance sales periods

(Example: major comeback seasons for artists such as BTS or Stray Kids)

5. Long Service Incentive Program

- 1-Year Service / 3-Year Service / 5-Year Service



[How To Apply for the job]

Just Fill out 10 Simple Questions through Google Form






Interview via google meet will be conducted after first screening and candidates will be notifed to their
s or
 



Thank you



Human Resource Dept.

Summitree

title: Customer Service Representative w/Intercom Experience
description:
Job Overview:



We are seeking driven and exceptional individuals to join our Clinical Patient Support Team. You will be responsible for providing outstanding phone and
 support to our U.S.-based pharmacy clients. This role is a great fit for those who are passionate about delivering excellent customer service, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and appreciate the flexibility of a fully remote job.



Key Responsibilities:



Respond to inbound phone calls and
s, addressing patient inquiries and concerns in a professional and timely manner.

Provide knowledgeable and compassionate support regarding prescriptions, medications, and pharmacy services.

Collaborate with internal teams to resolve issues, ensuring a seamless patient experience.

Maintain detailed and accurate patient records and documentation.

Adhere to company guidelines, ensuring compliance with HIPAA and other regulations.



Qualifications/Requirements:



Advanced English communication skills (spoken and written) are required.

Previous BPO experience of at least 5 years is required. Medical experience/knowledge preferred (nursing, pharmacy, etc). We are looking for highly trainable and adaptable individuals.

Intercom experience required.

A team player who values trust, commitment, and integrity.

Must have the discipline to work independently and remain productive in a fully remote setup.

Comfortable working the graveyard shift (U.S. time zones).

Be part of a supportive and collaborative team where trust and commitment are key.

No daily commute—save time, energy, and money while staying close to family.

If you are looking for a meaningful role that offers the flexibility to work from home, and you take pride in being part of a team that makes a difference, we'd love to hear from you!



How to Apply:



Please send your resume and a 2-minute video introducing yourself, and share an experience where you had to quickly learn a new skill or tool to complete a task or project. How did you approach it? (Please do not read off a script.) Please note, applications without a video introduction with not be considered.



If chosen, we will begin onboarding immediately.



We look forward to welcoming you to our team!

title: Client Sales Communication & Events Assistant
description:
| ARE YOU THE DIAMOND WE ARE LOOKING FOR? | Amazing role with high level benefits! | Immediate / ASAP Start



Are you bored with the same old jobs?



Do you know that if you were in the right role, one where your problem solving, communication, human connection, and sales psychology skills could truly shine, you would THRIVE?



If this sounds like you, welcome. You might just be our person. Welcome to your Ultimate career move!



| ABOUT THE ROLE |



We are hiring for one role and looking for a diamond. You are rare, and so are we. This Sales and Client Communication Strategy Consultant will join our long-term and well-established Filipino team at My Ultimate Events, Australia’s leading events company for hens, bucks, and team celebrations.



This is not your standard sales role. It is fast paced, human first, and deeply strategic. You will be working as a Sales Pair with an Australian based consultant, where both of you are equal partners working toward shared goals while also owning your individual responsibilities within the pipeline.



In this role, you will manage warm inbound leads and existing clients through fast, natural written communication and occasional phone calls with clients who are already working with us. Speed of lead is critical in this environment, and your ability to think fast, respond fast, and adapt fast will define your success.



You will collaborate closely with your Australian partner, brainstorming, strategising, checking logic, and troubleshooting client scenarios together. And you will also work independently when needed, owning your workload, making sound decisions, and keeping the pipeline moving without requiring constant direction.



Think like a problem solver, communicate like a human, and operate like a strategic sales partner. You will rely on templates where appropriate, but you will also know instinctively when a situation needs a tweak, a reword, or a more nuanced approach.



We are not filling a seat. We are searching for someone who is clever, warm, fast, thoughtful, witty, and capable of juggling multiple moving parts with accuracy, confidence, and very high attention to detail.



We are 15 years established and operating across Australia, with a Filipino Australian team that has worked together long term.



We reward loyalty, invest in growth, and offer genuine long-term stability within an inspiring, high performance culture, with excellent training and a team of managers who genuinely want every person in the business to succeed.



Only one role is available due to our sales department expanding.



| CORE RESPONSIBILITIES |



-Work in a paired sales structure with an Australian Sales Consultant, collaborating daily, syncing strategies, and supporting shared goals while owning your individual responsibilities in the pipeline.



-Respond to warm inbound leads quickly, naturally, and with real human connection. You must not rely on ChatGPT to do the work or the thinking for you. Spell check is fine, but the logic, strategy, and language must be your own genuine skillset.



-Call clients back when needed to clarify details, answer questions, or support them through their existing booking journey.



-Use templates as a foundation but adapt them when the situation calls for nuance, logic, or personalised communication.



-Read between the lines of what clients really mean, not just what they type, and respond with warmth, intelligence, and strategy.



-Create customised event recommendations using persuasive, human centred communication.



-Handle objections with logic, empathy, and confidence, focusing on clarity and problem solving rather than pressure.



-Work at a very fast pace. Juggle multiple conversations and tasks while keeping accuracy and attention to detail consistently high.



-Brainstorm solutions and sales approaches with your Australian partner, contributing ideas and helping refine strategies.



-Think fast, solve problems in real time, and keep 
ntum moving throughout the client journey.



-Maintain CRM accuracy, manage your workload, and prioritise effectively in a dynamic environment.



| WHO YOU ARE |



-Intelligent, human, fast thinking, and persuasive, with strong social intelligence.



-A natural collaborator who enjoys bouncing ideas, refining strategies, and achieving results as a team, but also independent enough to operate confidently without constant guidance.



-Able to rely on templates when appropriate, but also able to instinctively recognise when a situation needs a different angle, wording, or strategy.



-Comfortable on the phone with warm clients, confident speaking with both kindness and clarity.



-Fast paced and energised by juggling multiple conversations and deadlines.



-Emotionally intelligent and capable of understanding clients beyond the literal words they use.



-High attention to detail. Spelling, logic, accuracy, tone, and data entry matter deeply to you.



-Thrive in a high performance, strategy driven environment.



If you need AI to write messages for you or think for you, this is not the role for you. You will be great somewhere else, but not here.



| YOU MUST HAVE |



-Real sales or client facing experience where communication, problem solving, and human connection were essential.



-Highly skilled in written English and able to write naturally, quickly, and with personality, without relying on AI to think for you.



-Confident speaking to clients by phone when needed. All calls are warm leads or existing clients.



-Experience working in partnership with a colleague or tea
mber and comfortable sharing a pipeline, strategy, and daily collaboration.



-Social intelligence and the ability to read what a client really means, not just what they say.



-Experience using Microsoft Teams, Outlook, Word, OneDrive, and CRM systems.



-Strategic mindset and confidence handling multiple moving parts under pressure.



-A quiet home office, fast wired internet, and a Windows PC (not Mac)



-Previous offshore experience with an Australian, US, or UK based company is an advantage.



| WORK HOURS |



Please only apply if you can consistently commit to these exact hours every week. These are essential to match your Australian sales partner and maintain operational rhythm.



Hours Brisbane Time



Monday to Friday 8am to 5pm Brisbane Time



Brisbane is UTC+10 and does not use daylight savings.



| SALARY AND BENEFITS |



-50,000 to 60,000 PHP per month depending on experience and skill.



-13th month pay.



-All Filipino public holidays fully paid and you do not come to work.



-15 days paid annual leave.



-Team huddles, mentorship, collaboration, and a culture that celebrates growth, initiative, and performance.



-Long-term, full time role with a trusted Australian company that genuinely invests in its team.



-Amazing role with high level benefits.



| ABOUT US |



My Ultimate Events is Australia’s leading events organisation for hens, bucks, and corporate team events.

We have been creating unforgettable experiences for over 15 years and have proudly built a strong, loyal Filipino Australian team.



We are bold, strategic, fun, and people focused. We celebrate wins, invest in growth, and value genuine collaboration and connection.



You will not be a freelancer or a temp. You will be a valued part of a thriving company that values loyalty, excellence, emotional intelligence, and partnership.



| HOW TO APPLY |



Send your application directly to 
 to WOW us. We do not look at the Online Jobs inbox, so you must
 to be considered. Only those who include all of the below will be considered due to the high volume of applications.



Include:



1. A personalised video of yourself telling us why you are the diamond we have been waiting for and what your favourite My Ultimate Bucks package in Melbourne is.



2. A cover letter outlining your real sales or client experience, whether you are currently working, and your notice period. This should demonstrate your natural writing style and logic, without AI or templated language.



3. Your CV.



4. Confirmation of your PC specs, internet speed, and workspace setup.



If you are fast thinking, emotionally intelligent, detail oriented, collaborative, and ready for a long term role where partnership, logic, speed of lead, and human connection all matter, we cannot wait to meet you.



| WELCOME TO YOUR ULTIMATE CAREER MOVE | We cannot wait to hear from you!!! |

title: Tax planning specialist
description:
We are a fast-growing, high-performance tax firm focused on helping business owners retain more of what they earn through strategic tax planning and expert representation. This role is ideal for a technically strong, proactive professional who thrives in a structured, excellence-driven environment.

Position Overview

The Business Tax Planning Specialist will support sophisticated U.S. business tax planning strategies while preparing and reviewing business tax returns. This is not a basic tax preparation role — we are seeking someone who understands the strategy behind tax planning and can think beyond compliance.

This is a remote offshore position requiring availability during U.S. business hours (or partial overlap, as needed).

Key Responsibilities

• Prepare and review U.S. business tax returns (1120, 1120S, 1065)

• Analyze financial statements for tax planning opportunities

• Assist in implementation of advanced tax strategies

• Model tax savings scenarios and projections

• Conduct technical tax research

• Identify risk exposure and compliance gaps

• Coordinate with internal legal and planning teams

• Ensure accuracy, documentation, and adherence to U.S. tax law

Qualifications

• Minimum 3–5 years of U.S. business tax preparation experience

• Strong working knowledge of federal tax law for business entities

• Experience with tax planning strategies (not just compliance)

• Enrolled Agent (EA) or CPA designation highly preferred

• Strong analytical and financial statement review skills

• Experience with U.S.-based tax software (e.g., Lacerte, ProSeries, UltraTax, etc.)

• Excellent written and verbal English communication skills

• High attention to detail and strong organizational skills

• Ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment

Ideal Candidate Profile

• Strategic thinker who understands tax minimization principles

• Proactive problem-solver

• Highly organized and process-driven

• Comfortable working with high-level professionals

• Committed to accuracy and professional excellence

• Growth-minded and eager to continuously improve

What We Offer

• Long-term opportunity with a respected U.S. tax firm

• Exposure to advanced tax planning strategies

• Professional development and training

• Performance-based growth opportunities

• Collaborative, high-standard team environment

5. You will be given different task everyday. You work 6 days a week. You will be paid in a daily rate which equals $400/month. You should be able to finish all your daily task under max 5-8 hours. the faster you get the job done with quality the faster your job is over for the day.



6. Efficient, reliable, and accountable in meeting deadlines.

title: AI Agents & Automation Assistant
description:
The LLM & AI Automation Analyst is responsible for managing, monitoring, and continuously improving LLM-powered systems, AI agents, and automations, including chatbot applications.



This role sits at the intersection of AI, data, automation, and operations. You will ensure AI systems deliver accurate, reliable, and context-aware outputs by maintaining knowledge bases, refining prompts, monitoring performance, and building automations and reports. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys analytical thinking, process optimization, and working with evolving AI systems.





Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

-Maintain and improve LLM-powered agents, including chatbot workflows, prompts, and response logic



-Design, test, and refine prompts to improve accuracy, consistency, and behavior



-Validate agent outputs across edge cases and real-world scenarios



-Curate, organize, and validate structured knowledge bases, FAQs, and internal documentation used by AI systems



-Ensure knowledge sources remain accurate, up to date, and logically structured



-Review AI conversations and agent outputs to identify errors, gaps, and logic failures



-Define, track, and document quality metrics for AI outputs



-Propose corrective actions based on recurring issues



-Track AI usage, accuracy, resolution rates, escalation rates, and user satisfaction



-Analyze trends and root causes behind performance changes



-Translate insights into actionable improvements



-Build formulas, scripts, and automations to improve AI workflows, reporting, and monitoring



-Use Google Apps Script and APIs to automate repetitive processes



-Assist in creating dashboards and reports to monitor AI performance and adoption



-Ensure leadership has clear visibility into system health and impact



-Maintain clear documentation of AI logic, workflows, automations, and improvement roadmap



-Partner with Data, Operations, HR, and Leadership to align AI capabilities with business needs



-Proactively identify opportunities to improve AI accuracy, efficiency, and reliability







Qualifications

Required:

-1+ year experience working with LLMs, chatbots, or AI-powered systems



-Strong proficiency in Google Sheets for analysis, tracking, and reporting



-1+ year experience using formulas and Google Apps Script



-Ability to analyze AI conversations, logs, and performance metrics



-Experience with prompt engineering and evaluation



-Strong attention to detail and quality assurance mindset



-Understanding of data privacy, access control, and responsible AI practices



-Clear written communication and cross-functional collaboration skills



Nice to Have

-Python for automation or data analysis



-Basic SQL for querying logs or analytics data



-Experience with APIs (REST, JSON)



-Familiarity with BI tools or BigQuery







Technical Stack



Languages

-JavaScript (Google Apps Script)

-Python (optional but valuable)

-SQL (basic)



Tools

-Google Apps Script

-Google Sheets Automation

-LLM / AI platforms (internal or third-party)

-API integrations (REST, JSON)



Data & Reporting

-Google Sheets

-BigQuery (optional)

-Dashboards / BI tools





Key Traits

-Highly analytical and detail-oriented



-Curious and passionate about AI and automation



-Process-driven and optimization-focused



-Proactive and self-directed



-Strong ownership mindset



-Comfortable working with ambiguity and evolving systems



 

Benefits & Perks:

-Strong focus on work-life balance



-Opportunity to work on cutting-edge AI and automation systems



-Direct impact on product, operations, and customer experience



-Long-term growth path in AI, Data, and Automation



All set to dive into this new adventure?

Please fill out the form so we can proceed with your application:



wkf.ms/4pPRX7N



(Remember to choose AI Agents & Automation Assistant from the dropdown so your application won't get lost!)

title: Ecommerce Brand Operator – 1M Subscriber Horror Brand
description:
An established horror storytelling brand with around 1 million subscribers is expanding 
 — a merchandise brand built around immersive “haunted” products, recurring lore, and limited drops.




 is still in its early phase. The opportunity now is to build it intentionally and scale it alongside a growing audience.



We are looking for a proactive designer/operator to help build this into a serious ecommerce brand.



The storytelling side of the brand continues to grow.

Your role is to build and scale the merchandise side alongside it.



You will:



Study the tone, stories, and recurring lore of the brand



Develop product concepts that naturally fit within the universe



Personally design high-quality, compelling merchandise



Build product pages that combine strong design with story



Plan and execute limited drops tied to audience engagement



Think long-term about brand growth, not one-off uploads



You will not be starting from zero.

You will be building on top of an engaged horror audience with real distribution already in place.



For the right person, this is a ground-floor opportunity to shape and grow a brand within an established universe.



You do not need to have already built a large ecommerce company.

But you must have strong design skills, good taste, initiative, and the drive to learn and execute.



Compensation:



Performance-based revenue share structured to reward growth and results.

As the brand scales, your upside scales with it.

Details discussed with qualified candidates.



Requirements:



Strong graphic design skills (portfolio required)



Good design taste and understanding of what makes products appealing



Interest in branding, limited drops, and audience psychology



Self-driven and capable of executing independently



Willingness to test ideas and continuously improve



To Apply:



Link your design portfolio



Put “HAT” in the subject line



What would your first product idea be for this brand?



Why are you a good fit for this role?

title: Content Feedback Manager (Giving Feedback): $1,000–$1,200 USD START RATE
description:
Start rate: $800 a month + performance-based bonuses (TOTAL: $1,000–$1,200 a month)



Paid twice per month via Wise.



ABOUT US







Young Publisher is an international digital marketing company working with content creators and online brands.



BENEFITS

- Full-time position: 8 hours daily, Monday-Friday; 40 hours a week

- Flexible schedule: Choose your own hours, as long as you show up for the daily meeting (MANDATORY)

- Stable income: Long-term role with regular, on-time payments

- Supportive team: Collaborative environment without micromanagement

- Growth path: Opportunities to increase responsibilities and earnings

- 100% remote: Work-from-home setup



TASKS



- Content & Client Feedback

- Review 30-60 short-form client videos (Instagram Reels, TikTok, YouTube Shorts) per day in our Slack feedback channel -before they are published

- Give constructive, actionable feedback on hooks (verbal/headline/visual), scripting, pacing, editing, and CTA, making sure each client knows exactly how to improve

- Cross-reference each piece of content with client niche, experience, and goals as outlined in their files

- Review previous feedback to ensure consistency and avoid contradictions

- Quality-control content ideas created by our Content Research Experts before delivery to the client, ensuring fit with niche, experience, and likely performance

- Oversee workload balance among Content Research Experts and make sure no one on the team is overloaded or underutilized

- Respond to client questions or tech issues in Slack within 24 hours

- Be tough but fair—only approve content that meets quality standards



Progress Tracking



- Complete daily End-of-Day (EOD) reports

- Attend daily tea
eting (mandatory, 3pm CET)

- Keep internal feedback and client progress records up to date



REQUIREMENTS (MUST-HAVE)

- C1+ English (written), with perfect grammar and clear, professional responses

- Significant experience creating or reviewing short-form content for Instagram Reels, TikTok, or YouTube Shorts

- Organized and detail-oriented

- Reliable internet and a quiet, professional home workspace

- Accountability mindset and deadline commitment

- Long-term commitment, eager to master a workflow and have direct impact on client success



IMPORTANT



- When recording a Loom video as part of your application:

- Camera must show your FACE & SCREEN

- Treat it as a LIVE interview with the Hiring Manager

- Have a professional background

- Have clear audio

- Wear business-casual attire



BONUS SKILLS (NOT REQUIRED)



- Experience supporting creators and social media beginners, especially ages 45+

- Familiarity with AI tools like ChatGPT, CapCut, etc.

- Strong understanding of trends/strategy for Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts



WHY JOIN US?



- Start rate: $800 a month + performance-based bonuses (TOTAL: $1,000–$1,200 a month once trained)

Note: Senior CFMs earn $1,500+ after 6–12 months.

- Performance bonuses: Up to $400+ additional monthly based on:

- Quality and clarity of feedback

- Task completion and consistency

- Teamwork and responsibility

- Payments: Twice per month via Wise, direct to your bank

- Tools access: All tools/software fully covered

- Work-life balance: No graveyard shifts

- Professional growth: Frequent feedback and advanced training



HOW TO APPLY



1: Message us on OnlineJobs.ph with "CFM" as the message title



2: Include ONLY the following in your message:



#1: Your CV.

#2: Your years of experience with short-form content.

#3: Your years of experience with content feedback or coaching.

#4: One sentence on why you're a good fit for this role.

#5: Your portfolio (including examples of your feedback or video/content work).



Note: Messages that do not follow this format will NOT be reviewed.

title: Sales Operations and CRM Support Consultant
description:
| ARE YOU THE DIAMOND WE ARE LOOKING FOR? |



Amazing role with high level benefits! | Immediate / ASAP Start



Are you bored with the same old jobs?



Do you know that if you were in the right role, one where your organisation skills, attention to detail, and your ability to think logically beyond a process could truly shine, you would THRIVE?



If this sounds like you, welcome. You might just be our person. Welcome to your Ultimate career move!



| ABOUT THE ROLE |



We are hiring for one role and looking for a diamond. You are rare, and so are we.



This Sales Operations and CRM Support Consultant will join our long term and well established Filipino team at My Ultimate Events, Australia’s leading events company for hens, bucks, and team celebrations.



This is a high volume, fast paced, admin heavy role, but it is not a rigid, robotic, box ticking position.



You will work as a pair with an Australian based consultant, where both of you are equal partners working toward shared outcomes while owning clearly defined responsibilities within a very busy pipeline.



Process matters here. CRM accuracy matters. Attention to detail is non negotiable.



But so does thinking.



You will be expected to understand the logic behind the process, not just follow it blindly. When a situation falls outside the standard path, you must be able to assess, think, and apply judgement, knowing when to adapt, when to escalate, and when to pause and ask the right question.



Speed of lead matters. Accuracy matters. Logic matters.



You will collaborate closely with your Australian partner, syncing daily, checking logic, flagging risks, and sense checking decisions. You will also work independently for large portions of the day, confidently managing your workload, making sound judgement calls, and keeping 
ntum moving without constant instruction.



This role sits at the intersection of structure and thinking. You must be comfortable operating within systems while also being able to step outside them when the situation genuinely requires it.



We are not filling a seat. We are searching for someone who is organised, sharp, thoughtful, adaptable, and capable of handling complexity in a consistently busy environment.



| CORE RESPONSIBILITIES |



-Work in a paired sales structure with an Australian Consultant, collaborating daily, aligning priorities, and supporting shared outcomes while owning your individual responsibilities within the pipeline.



-Manage a very busy workload with multiple conversations, systems, and tasks running at once.



-Maintain accurate, up to date CRM records at all times. Data accuracy, clean notes, and task tracking are essential.



-Follow established processes while understanding the logic behind them, and apply judgement when a scenario does not fit neatly into the standard workflow.



-Identify gaps, inconsistencies, or risks within client communication or bookings and think through the next best step, not just the next task.



-Respond to warm inbound leads and existing clients clearly, naturally, and professionally via written communication and occasional phone calls.



-Use templates and systems correctly, but adapt when clarity, tone, or logic requires a different approach.



-Know when to proceed, when to escalate, and when to pause and seek clarification.



-Work efficiently under pressure, maintaining quality and clear thinking during peak periods.



| WHO YOU ARE |



-Highly organised and detail oriented, with strong respect for process and accuracy.



-Equally capable of stepping outside a process to think logically and solve a problem when needed.



-Comfortable making judgement calls within defined boundaries.



-A strong written communicator who writes clearly, naturally, and with purpose.



-Calm, grounded, and reliable in busy environments with competing priorities.



-Confident working independently while collaborating closely with a partner.



-Intellectually curious and motivated to understand the “why” behind how things are done.



-Not someone who needs to be told every step, but also not someone who ignores structure.



If you are only comfortable following instructions without thinking, or if you prefer complete freedom without structure, this role will not be the right fit. We want someone who can do both.



| YOU MUST HAVE |



-Previous experience in an admin heavy, operations, sales support, or client coordination role that required judgement, not just task completion.



-Strong written English and high attention to detail across spelling, tone, logic, and data entry.



-Experience using CRM systems and working within defined workflows.



-Confidence speaking to clients by phone when required. All calls are warm or existing clients.



-Strong time management skills and the ability to prioritise under pressure.



-Experience using Microsoft Teams, Outlook, Word, OneDrive, and CRM systems.



-A quiet home office, fast wired internet, and a Windows PC (not Mac).



-Previous offshore experience with an Australian, US, or UK based company is an advantage.



| WORK HOURS |



Please only apply if you can consistently commit to these exact hours every week. These are essential to match your Australian sales partner and maintain operational rhythm.



Hours Brisbane Time



Monday to Friday 9am to 6pm Brisbane Time



Brisbane is UTC+10 and does not use daylight savings.



| SALARY AND BENEFITS |



-50,000 to 60,000 PHP per month depending on experience and skill.



-13th month pay.



-All Filipino public holidays fully paid and you do not come to work.



-15 days paid annual leave.



-Team huddles, training, mentorship, and operational support.



-Long term, full time role with a trusted Australian company that genuinely invests in its team.



-Amazing role with high level benefits.



| ABOUT US |



My Ultimate Events is Australia’s leading events organisation for hens, bucks, and corporate team events.



We have been creating unforgettable experiences for over 15 years and have proudly built a strong, loyal Filipino Australian team.



We value reliability, clarity, initiative, and intelligent execution. We expect people to think, not just follow.



You will not be a freelancer or a temp. You will be a valued part of a thriving company that values loyalty, excellence, and long term partnership.



| HOW TO APPLY |



Send your application directly to 
 to WOW us. We do not look at the Online Jobs inbox, so you must
 to be considered.



Please only apply if you genuinely enjoy roles that require both structure and thinking.



Include:



A personalised video telling us why you are the right fit for a role that combines process discipline with independent judgement.



A cover letter outlining your admin, CRM, or sales support experience and an example of when you had to think beyond a process to solve a problem. This must be written by you, not AI.



Your CV.



Confirmation of your PC specs, internet speed, and workspace setup.



If you are detail oriented, logical, adaptable, and ready for a long term role where both accuracy and thinking matter, we cannot wait to meet you.



| WELCOME TO YOUR ULTIMATE CAREER MOVE | We cannot wait to hear from you!!! |

title: Virtual Assistant | Coding Experience Needed | Dance Academy - Salsa/Bachata
description:
Full-time, long-term opportunity.



No virtual assistant experience needed.



Looking for tech-savvy people with coding experience.



Environment here is CREATIVE and FUN.



ABOUT US

We are the largest salsa & bachata dance academy in Los Angeles and are always expanding.



Busy times!



The culture here is FUN and friendly. Our goal is to make every student feel welcome and completely taken care of all the time.



Dancing changes lives - we are on a mission to deliver the best salsa/bachata educational experience on Earth.



The company is MaS Dance Academy.



YOUR FOCUS:

"Virtual Assistant"



This role has much a wider variety of tasks than working in a large corporation, which makes it more challenging but also more fun.



Some examples:

• Automating procedures (with or without A.I.)

• Website updates

• App updates (built on React Native - experience not required)

• Creating beautiful, concise, clean reports,

• Research

• Etc.



Our culture is fast-paced and every day is unique.



Although you'll begin by doing what is asked, over time (and the sooner the better), you'll need to pro-actively and independently handle tasks/projects without being told and recommend new projects based on opportunities you see. For a smart, motivated person, this role will be more stimulating than a traditional virtual assistant role.





SCHEDULE

9:00am - 6:00 PM PST (Los Angeles time) Monday - Friday 





GROWTH:

Payment increases over time.



If you are outstanding, long-term there may also be the opportunity to be promoted into a leadership role





TRAINING:

You'll receive basic training but many things you'll need to figure out on the fly. You must be a quick learner with a "can do" attitude.





COMPANY CULTURE

Working in a small business like ours is very different from a large corporation. Some of the differences are:



• More creativity: you'll handle a wide variety of tasks and projects. This is more challenging than just following strict templates, but also more stimulating and exciting.



• Impact: your actions will have a big impact on the business, which you will clearly see



• Feedback: your feedback on what we are doing well, and what could be better, is not only valued, but is mandatory! We want everyone here thinking as if they were the business owner.





ABOUT YOU:

• Excellent written English (show this in your application!)

• Coding experience

• Technical - great with computers

• Good listener - only needs to be told once

• Strong communicator (you must OVERcommunicate with management and tea
mbers)

• Smart, quick learner

• Fastidious - attention to detail

• Decent at basic math

• Pro-active - anticipates what may be helpful and goes above and beyond to contribute

• Meticulous, organized, methodical.

• Reliable! Always shows up and focuses.

• Critical, creative thinker. Not robotic. Always looking for better ways to do things. Always considering all the angles of a task.

• Willing to share your opinion - we NEED to hear your opinions

• Able to ask clarifying questions in order to get tasks right the first time

• Always eager to improve yourself and the company’s systems. Habitually thinks strategically and takes action for improvements.

• Self-starter

• Independent decision maker

• Flexible - can quickly adjust on the fly

• Comfortable with excel

• Fast computer

• Fast, dependable Internet

• Bonus if you have experience or interest in salsa or bachata!



APPLY NOW. FORMAT YOUR APPLICATION AS A NUMBERED LIST WITH THE FOLLOWING:



1. A brief intro about yourself



2. Can you work the hours requested?

title: Operations & Client Experience Coordinator – Remote
description:
About RDBC

RDBC makes world-class ballet training accessible to serious dancers anywhere. Our families and students expect a premium experience — the kind where someone remembers their name, anticipates what they need, and handles problems before they even notice.



We need someone who runs that experience every single day.



Apply here: 



About This Role

This is not a ticket queue. There is no "average handle time." You won't be reading from a script while someone waits on hold.

You'll be the person who makes sure a nervous parent gets the right answer in one message. The person who notices a teacher's Zoom isn't connecting and fixes it before class starts. The person who sees a promising lead sitting in the inbox and moves it forward — not because someone told you to, but because you know it matters.



If you've worked somewhere that charged a premium and expected the service to match — a boutique studio, a private school, a concierge-level program, a high-touch online business — you already know what this feels like.



If your experience is mostly large-scale chat support, help desks, or call centers, this probably isn't the right fit.



What You Own

- Live class operations. You host and co-host Zoom sessions for real students in real time. Meetings start on time. Students land in the right room. Teachers are supported. When something breaks, you fix it live — not after the class is over.

- Client support that feels personal. You answer
s and DMs from dancers and parents. You have scripts and FAQs to work from, but you know when to go off-script because the situation calls for a human, not a template. 95% of simple tickets answered within 15 minutes. 80% resolved on the first reply.

- Lead follow-through. When someone asks about our programs, you respond quickly, ask the right qualifying questions, send the right information, and route them to the next step. Nothing sits. Nothing gets lost. Every lead is logged.

- Clean systems. Attendance submitted same-day. Class reports filed. Checklists followed. When you spot a pattern — the same question keeps coming in, the same step keeps breaking — you flag it so the system gets better.



What Winning Looks Like



- 100% of your classes start on time with zero access issues escalated to the founder.

- Support replies are fast, accurate, and feel like they came from someone who cares.

- Zero leads go unlogged or unacknowledged.

- You follow the playbook and you improve it.



Who This Is For



- You have 4+ years supporting clients (not "users") in a high-touch environment — a boutique studio, private school, premium online program, or service business where people expected more and you delivered it. US-based experience required.

- Your written English is sharp. You write the way a trusted staff member talks — clear, warm, professional. No corporate filler.

- You're comfortable with Zoom,
, DMs, Notion, and spreadsheets. You pick up new tools fast.

- You work Monday through Saturday on a consistent schedule aligned with live class times.

- You don't need to be told to follow up. You notice what's slipping and you catch it.



Who This Is NOT For



- If your background is primarily call centers, high-volume chat support, or ticket-based helpdesks, this role will feel very different from what you're used to, and it's probably not the right match.

- If you need detailed instructions for every situation before you act, you'll struggle here. We give you structure and frameworks, but we need someone who can think on their feet when a class is live and something goes sideways.

title: Full-Time Appointment Setting Virtual Assistant (Phone-Based – Medicare)
description:
Company: De La Pena Insurance Solutions

Pay: $6 per hour

Position: Full-Time | Remote | Long-Term 



De La Pena Insurance Solutions is a Texas-based Medicare insurance agency. We help individuals turning 65 or currently on Medicare understand their options and enroll in the right coverage. We are hiring a dedicated Appointment Setting Virtual Assistant whose primary responsibility is to book qualified appointments for our licensed agents. This role is heavily phone-based and requires confidence, clarity, and professionalism when speaking with U.S.-based clients. We are not looking for freelancers managing multiple jobs. This is a full-time, long-term opportunity. Your main goal is to keep our agents’ calendars full with qualified appointments.



You will:

- Make outbound calls to leads who requested information

- Handle inbound calls and convert them into booked appointments

- Follow scripts naturally and confidently

- Overcome basic objections professionally

- Confirm appointments and send reminders

- Follow up on no-shows and missed calls

- Maintain accurate notes in our CRM

- Identify leads that need additional follow-up

- Ensure no interested prospect is left unattended

- This role is performance-driven and results-oriented.



What We’re Looking For

- Very strong spoken English

- Neutral to minimal accent suitable for U.S. phone calls

- Confident and natural phone presence

- Comfortable handling objections

- Ability to follow scripts while sounding conversational

- Organized and detail-oriented

- Self-starter who takes initiative

- Reliable internet and quiet work environment

- Full-time availability (no side jobs)

- Long-term commitment

- Appointment setting or call center experience is strongly preferred.



What We Offer

- $6 per hour (weekly pay)

- 100% remote work

- Long-term, stable role

- Clear expectations and structured support

- Opportunity for growth into leadership or higher-responsibility roles



How to Apply (Must Follow Instructions Exactly)



Step 1: Record a 60-Second Video (Required)

Using Loom or a similar platform, record a video (60 seconds or less) answering: “What makes someone successful in appointment setting, and which skill do you personally excel at?”



Ensure the video link is accessible

Include the link in your application



Step 2: Attach Your Resume

Incomplete applications will not be reviewed.

title: Social Media Content Creator & Community Manager
description:
Compensation: $450–$650CAD|PHP19207.42- PHP27744.05/month (depending on experience)

Schedule: Part time 5 Hours per day - 6 days a week



*** THIS IS NOT A FREE LANCE POSITION, YOU ARE NOT ALLOWED TO WORK FOR MULTIPLE EMPLOYERS IF HIRED WITH US ***



We are hiring a reliable, self-managed Social Media Content Creator & Community Manager to run our
, Instagram, and LinkedIn presence. This is a results-focused role where your attitude and determination will have a major impact on your success. The first month will involve some collaboration and onboarding; afterward, the role becomes independent where you are expected to perform.



Responsibilities

Content Creation:



* Create professional, on-brand visuals for
, Instagram, and LinkedIn.

* Write engaging, polished captions that match our tone and brand guidelines.

* Ensure all graphics follow brand colors, fonts, and overall style.



Content expectations:



* Month 1: 10–15 high-quality posts per platform (slower ramp-up while systems are established).

* Ongoing: 1 post per day per platform, with one scheduled day off per week (24 posts per month per platform).

* Schedule posts in advance using an Excel-based content tracker.

* Monitor posts for comments or interactions and update as needed.

* Engagement / Community Management

* Engage with relevant accounts, posts, and communities within the brand’s niche.

* Respond to comments and messages within 24 hours.

* Organically identify potential followers, partners, and relevant profiles.

* Maintain a simple daily log outlining engagement actions (comments, interactions, notes).



Reporting:

Submit a weekly report summarizing:



* Posts published

* Engagement completed

* Follower growth

* Basic engagement metrics (likes, replies, shares)

* Quality & Performance Standards

* All content and engagement must be professional and aligned with brand standards.

* Engagement must be genuine — no automation, bots, or spam comments.

* Any missed posting or engagement days must be communicated in advance.

* After the first month, the role is fully independent. Failure to consistently meet expectations will result in termination.

* KPIs (Key Performance Indicators)

* Daily posts published according to schedule

* Daily engagement actions completed

* Month-over-month follower growth

* High-quality visuals and captions

* Weekly reports submitted on time

* Missing KPIs for 2–3 consecutive weeks is considered a major performance issue.



Compensation- Canadian Dollar | PHP



$450–$650 OR PHP19207.42- PHP27744.05 / month depending on experience



$650/PHP27744.05 month reserved for highly experienced applicants (10+ years)

title: Fashion News Editor
description:
We are looking for an experienced and trend-savvy Fashion Editor to lead our women’s lifestyle coverage across fashion, celebrity style, beauty, and culture. This role sits at the intersection of editorial instinct and traffic performance, with a strong focus on daily newsletters, viral content, and audience growth.

You will be responsible for shaping a daily women’s newsletter, identifying what matters to women right now, and leading a small team of writers to produce engaging, high-performing fashion and lifestyle content.



Key Objectives



• Own and grow a daily women’s newsletter, driving strong open and click-through rates

• Identify daily fashion and women’s lifestyle trends worth covering

• Produce and commission traffic-generating fashion and entertainment stories

• Build a distinct editorial voice aligned with modern women’s interests

• Grow overall website traffic and newsletter engagement



Key Responsibilities

Editorial & Content Strategy

• Curate and edit a daily women’s newsletter, ensuring it is timely, relevant, and engaging

• D
 what fashion, beauty, and culture stories matter each day

• Develop content angles inspired by leading publications such as The Newsette, Stylist, ELLE, Vogue, and IBTimes UK Lifestyle

• Commission and write viral, SEO-optimised articles across:

?Celebrity fashion

? Red-carpet and street style

? Beauty and wellness trends

? Women-led culture and internet 
nts



Leadership & Team Management

• Lead and mentor a team of writers

• Assign stories, refine angles, and copy-edit articles to publication standard

• Ensure writers understand traffic-driven storytelling, headline optimisation, and audience behaviour



Newsletter & Social Growth

• Grow newsletter engagement by improving:

? Open rates

? Click-through rates

• Promote key stories via social media and newsletters

• Collaborate with social and growth teams to amplify reach



Performance & KPIs

• Monitor article performance and newsletter metrics

• Optimise content based on reader behaviour and analytics

• Use data to inform editorial decisions and improve output



Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

• Newsletter open rate and click-through rate

• Website traffic growth from fashion and women’s lifestyle content

• Engagement metrics (time on page, clicks, shares)

• Consistent production of high-performing, viral stories



What We’re Looking For

• Proven experience as a Fashion Editor, Lifestyle Editor, or Senior Fashion Writer

• Strong understanding of women’s fashion, beauty, and cultural trends

• Experience managing writers and editing content

• Ability to write viral, SEO-friendly headlines and stories

• Confident using data and analytics to guide editorial decisions

• Passionate about women’s interests and storytelling

• Comfortable balancing creativity with performance goals



Bonus Points

• Experience running or contributing to a daily newsletter

• Strong social media instincts

• Background in entertainment or celebrity coverage

• Familiarity with Google Discover and traffic-driven content



Why Join Us

• Opportunity to shape and own a growing women’s editorial vertical

• Creative freedom backed by data-driven strategy

• Lead a team and influence content direction at scale

• Work remotely with a fast-moving, ambitious editorial team

I am a multidisciplinary artist and creative entrepreneur building a two-brand digital ecosystem spanning scalable art products and high-end creative commissions.



I am seeking a Digital Commerce & Brand Operations Lead to build, manage, and scale my e-commerce systems so I can focus on creating artwork, murals, and commissions rather than managing inventory or logistics.

Boho chic minimal



Reactive and future-forward

Lower volume, higher value

Bol.com



TikTok Shop

Continuing Collaboration

Product updates



Customer communication



Store maintenance



Reliable operational support



Design & UX Expectations



Clean, modern, intentional



Dark Star Kumbaya: bold, accessible, brand-forward



Maya Sierra: refined, editorial, gallery-appropriate



Clarity and performance over gimmicks



Ideal Candidate



Strong Shopify experience



Comfortable with multiple fulfillment models



Experience with multi-channel selling



SEO and product research skills



Organized, proactive, systems-minded



Deliverables



Fully built Shopify store (Dark Star Kumbaya)



Product and fulfillment workflows



Multi-platform integrations



Maya Sierra website build or support (scope-dependent)



Clear documentation



Option for long-term collaboration



Important Note on Scope



This role may be fulfilled by one highly experienced person or multiple specialists.

Product strategy & SEO only



Website design/build (Maya Sierra) only



Or a combination of the above

title: TikTok Affiliate Manager
description:
About Us

Elevate FMCG is a UK-based digital growth agency specialising in Amazon and TikTok Shop management for consumer brands. We work with food, drink, and lifestyle brands to grow their online sales.



The Role

We're looking for a TikTok Affiliate Manager to handle creator outreach and affiliate coordination for our clients' TikTok Shop accounts. You'll be the engine behind our affiliate programmes - finding creators, managing sample sends, tracking content, and building relationships that drive sales.



This is a hands-on, high-volume role. You'll be working across multiple brand accounts, reaching out to dozens of creators weekly, and keeping everything organised and moving.



Responsibilities

Creator Outreach

• Research and identify relevant TikTok creators for each client brand

• Send outreach messages via TikTok Shop affiliate platform and direct messages

• Follow up with creators who haven't responded

• Build and maintain target lists of creators by niche/category



Sample Coordination

• Manage sample requests from creators

• Coordinate with clients on sample inventory and shipping

• Track sample sends and chase creators for content



Affiliate Programme Management

• Add creators to client affiliate programmes

• Set up commission rates and track performance

• Monitor which creators are posting and generating sales

• Flag top performers and underperformers



Reporting & Admin

• Maintain tracker of all outreach, samples, and content

• Provide weekly updates on affiliate activity

• Document processes and suggest improvements



Requirements

Must have:

• Experience with TikTok Shop and the TikTok affiliate platform

• Excellent written English

• Highly organised with strong attention to detail

• Experience with creator outreach and relationship management

• Comfortable working independently and managing own workload

• Reliable internet and home office setup

• Available to overlap with UK hours (at least 3-4 hours daily)



Nice to have:

• Experience working with FMCG or consumer brands

• Familiarity with Google Sheets, Notion, or similar tools



What We Offer

• Fully remote role

• Work with exciting UK and international FMCG brands

• Clear processes and support from the team

• Opportunity to grow as we scale TikTok services



How to Apply

Send your CV and a short message explaining:

1. Your experience with outreach or creator/influencer work

2. Your availability and hours you can work

3. Why you're interested in this role



Elevate FMCG is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Experienced Full Time Sourcing VA for German based Amazon Arbitrage Business
description:
Greetings from Austria,



We are currently seeking a full-time Sourcing VA to join our company and help us grow our AMAZON ARBITRAGE business. As such, we are looking for an experienced Sourcing VA with a solid track record of success.



Your primary responsibility will be to source profitable products from German retail stores that we can resell on Amazon.de with a margin. We will provide you with clear guidelines on the expected criteria (ROI, profit, etc.) for these products.



We are looking for someone who can commit to working full-time (40 hours/week) from Monday to Friday, with a focus on this role.



Qualifications/Requirements:



-At least 24 months of solid MANUAL SOURCING experience

- At least 12 months experience on the German Market

-Proficiency in reading and analyzing Keepa graphs

-Familiarity with different sourcing strategies and techniques

-Has experience using SellerAmp and Keepa

-Availability to work 5 days a week

-Good internet speed (at least 10 Mbit/s)

-Headphones and Web camera

-Quiet and professional workstation

-Sufficient English communication skills, particularly for phone conversations



You will have the opportunity to work within a dynamic and passionate company which is dedicated to helping you grow professionally. In addition, we offer growth opportunities within our company for the right candidate. You will work in young team with an other virtual assist from the phillipine.



In addition to the training and growth opportunities we offer, we also provide flexible working hours to accommodate your needs. We understand the importance of work-life balance and strive to create a positive work environment.



Once officially hired, the VA will enjoy the following benefits:



-A base salary with no result-related strings attached

-A fair bonus structure based on individual results

-Christmas Bonus

-Payed vacation days

-Personal days/leave 

-Be part of a growing company in the stable, German market

-Long-term growth opportunities



If you are interested in applying for this position, please
 your CV to 
 with the subject line "That's why you should hire me!" In your
, please provide specific details about your previous online arbitrage experiences, as well as the tools and strategies you used to find good products. If you have the opportunities you can also directly source for a product in the German Market that you think it is good an profitable and send us the links with your application. 



We look forward to receiving your application and welcoming you to our team.



Best regards,

Elias

title: Editor animation
description:

????? Audio (Voiceover): The recorded script (in Spanish).

title: Wedding Photography Photo Editor
description:
Hello there,



Hope you are having an amazing day.



My wife and I are a husband and wife wedding photography team based in Canada. We photograph refined, emotionally weddings for couples who care deeply about storytelling, culture, and elevated aesthetics. We are currently growing and looking for a skilled wedding photo editor to join us long term.



We are not looking for someone who simply applies presets. We are looking for someone who understands light, skin tones, polish, and consistency. Our work leans clean, crisp, true to life, and high end. Attention to detail is everything for us.



You must have previous experience editing weddings and portraits. Strong proficiency in Lightroom and Photoshop is required. We need someone who can cull efficiently and intelligently from 6000 to 10000 images down to a powerful storytelling gallery of 600 to 1000 images. Retouching skills such as blemish removal, subtle dodge and burn, fabric cleanup, bra strap removal, smoothing wrinkles, and refining distractions are extremely important.



We are detail oriented and value consistency, communication, and growth. We want someone who is coachable, learns quickly, and does not repeat the same mistakes. We are easy going but hold a high standard for the final product.



This role can be structured monthly or project based depending on season. Our busy season runs May through December and volume will vary each year. We are ideally looking for someone who wants to grow with us year after year and become part of our long term team. We are open to doing a per photo on-going contract or monthly. 



If you love weddings, storytelling, and refining images until they feel timeless and intentional, we would love to hear from you.



Thank you so much for applying.

title: People Operations Specialist
description:
Law Office of Pietro Canestrelli, A Tax Controversy Boutique, APC

We are a growing, multi-state tax controversy and compliance law firm seeking a People Operations Specialist to support and strengthen our internal HR systems. This role is ideal for a mid-level HR professional who understands California wage and hour fundamentals, enjoys building structure, and wants a clear pathway to grow into a People Operations Manager role. This is a hands-on operational role with real ownership.

Key Responsibilities

• HR Operations & Compliance

1. Support multi-state HR compliance with a focus on California wage and hour laws.

2. Track overtime, meal/rest periods, PTO, and leave compliance.

3. Maintain accurate employee files and documentation.

4. Support benefits enrollment coordination and payroll tracking.

5. Assist with updating policies and employee handbooks.

• Recruiting & Hiring

6. Post job ads and maintain applicant tracking.

7. Screen resumes and conduct structured first-round interviews.

8. Provide candidate summaries and recommendations.

9. Coordinate interviews with leadership.

• Onboarding & Training

10. Manage onboarding checklists and timelines.

11. Prepare new hire welcome materials.

12. Ensure documentation, access, and policies are delivered on time.

13. Assist in drafting SOPs and workflow documentation.

14. Maintain training guides and materials.

• Employee Relations Support

15. Serve as first point of contact for routine employee questions.

16. Support documentation for performance reviews and improvement plans.

17. Escalate higher-level concerns appropriately.

• Systems & Process Improvement

18. Maintain HRIS accuracy.

19. Track key HR metrics such as vacancy time and retention.

20. Identify process gaps and suggest improvements.

Required Qualifications

• 3–6 years of progressive HR or People Operations experience.

• Demonstrated knowledge of California wage and hour basics (overtime, meal/rest periods, leave requirements).

• Experience supporting multi-state U.S. teams preferred.

• Strong written communication skills.

• Highly organized and process-driven.

• Comfortable working independently in a fully remote environment.

• Tech-savvy and able to learn systems quickly.

Preferred Qualifications

• Experience in professional services (law firm, finance, consulting).

• Experience supporting offshore or distributed teams.

• HR certification (PHR, SHRM-CP) is a plus but not required.

Growth Path

This role has a clear pathway to People Operations Manager for a candidate who demonstrates mastery of California compliance tracking, strong documentation discipline, sound judgment in employee relations matters, ownership of recruiting and onboarding processes, and consistent KPI achievement. Promotions are performance-based and tied to measurable results.

Compensation & Work Environment

• Competitive compensation based on experience and location.

• Fully remote position.

• Offshore candidates preferred with verifiable U.S. HR exposure.

title: Phone & Chat Sales Operator (Work From Home – Full Time)
description:
Hi - we’re Solis Therapy, a fast-growing wellness tech brand selling clinical-grade red light therapy devices worldwide.



We’ve discovered something simple:

- When customers speak to a real human, they buy.

- So instead of hiring a big call centre, we’re hiring one dedicated, smart, reliable person to own all our calls and chats.

- This is not a typical customer support job.



It’s a sales + support hybrid role where you help customers, recommend products, and close orders.



If you’re confident on the phone and enjoy helping people make decisions, you can earn very well here.



What you’ll be doing each day



• Answer inbound pre-sales calls and close orders

• Respond to live chat messages

• Help customers with order/setup questions

• Do short 5–10 min check-in calls with existing customers

• Follow up warm business leads (gyms, clinics, salons, studios)

• Track leads and notes in Google Sheets/CRM



There will be quiet time during the day - we expect you to stay organised and proactive, not just wait for calls.



Working hours: Monday–Friday | 9am–5pm UK time (full-time, 40 hours)



You must:

• Be online and available during these hours

• Have fast internet

• Have a quiet workspace

• Use a good headset



Pay & commission

Base salary: $400/month

Commission (uncapped)



Inbound sales: $13–$68 per order

Outbound/B2B: 10% of order value



Realistic earnings: Strong performers typically earn $2,000–$3,000+ per month



So although the base is modest, the commission is where you make serious money.



If you’re good at closing, your income is directly in your control.



We cover all expenses



We pay for:

• Dialling/VoIP software

• Phone usage

• Any tools or subscriptions needed



You will never pay out of pocket for work costs.



Who this is perfect for?



You might be a great fit if you:



• Speak excellent English

• Sound confident and friendly on the phone

• Are persuasive but not pushy

• Enjoy sales and commissions

• Are organised and self-managed

• Want a long-term remote job with growth



Bonus:

• Ecommerce experience

• Sales or B2B experience

• Wellness/fitness interest



NOT a good fit if



? You want a passive support-only role

? You don’t like phone calls

? You need constant supervision

? You’re juggling multiple full-time jobs



We’re looking for someone who treats this like their main career.



How to apply



Please send:



- Your CV

- A short voice recording introducing yourself (1–2 mins)

- Why you think you’d be good at phone sales



Shortlisted candidates will have a meeting with founder.

title: Construction Operations & Finance Coordinator
description:
Summary

Job Title: Construction Operations & Finance Coordinator (HouzzPro & QBO Expert) Category: Administrative Support / Project Management / Bookkeeping Budget: e.g., $10–$25/hr] Hours: Part-Time (10–15 hours/week to start)



About the Role: Fast Bath Makeover LLC is a high-volume bathroom remodeling company. We have replaced "spreadsheet chaos" with a streamlined, automated tech stack. We are looking for a sharp, detail-oriented Operations & Finance Coordinator to manage our "back office" engine.



You are not just doing data entry; you are managing the lifecycle of a project—from the moment a homeowner picks their tile to the final profit analysis.



The Tech Stack You’ll Manage:



Project Management: HouzzPro (Estimates, Selections, & Procurement)



Accounting: QuickBooks Online (QBO) & Dext



Analytics: Fathom HQ



CRM: GoHighLevel (GHL)



Primary Responsibilities:



Procurement & Selections: Build Selection Boards in HouzzPro using our pre-set templates. You will use our "Price Decision Tree" to calculate Landed Costs (MSRP + Tax/Shipping buffers) and ensure all Purchase Orders (POs) are issued correctly to vendors.



Financial "Matchmaking": Audit automated invoice fetches in Dext, match them to HouzzPro POs, and sync them to QBO. You will flag any variances over 10% for owner review.



Labor Costing: Use our daily GHL labor logs to "split" weekly payments (Zelle/CashApp) across active projects in QBO, ensuring 100?curate job costing.



Change Order Management: Identify "surprises" (large format tile, herringbone patterns, double-vanity upgrades) and generate the necessary Change Orders in HouzzPro before materials are ordered.



Project Pulse: Maintain the GHL "Nudge" automations to ensure homeowners finalize selections on time and keep projects on schedule.



Qualifications:



HouzzPro Expert: You must have experience with the HouzzPro Clipper, Selection Tracker, and Room Templates.



Construction Knowledge: You know the difference between a mixing valve and a trim kit. You understand "Allowances" and "Landed Costs."



QBO Wizardry: You understand Job Costing, "Classes," and how to manage a bank feed without using "Uncategorized."



Analytical Mind: You enjoy looking at a project and figuring out why the margin was 30% instead of 35%.



How to Apply: Please send a brief cover letter. To prove you have high attention to detail, please start your application with the phrase "KISS Systems Ready." Also, answer the following:



Describe a time you caught a procurement error (wrong size/finish) before an order was placed.



How do you handle shipping and sales tax in a construction estimate to avoid constant change orders?



Are you comfortable using Loom to send quick video updates on project status?

title: Administrative Assistant with Bookkeeping Skills for Quick and Breezy rentals (Remote)
description:
About Quick and Breezy Rentals:

Quick and Breezy Rentals is a premier car rental company, offering a diverse fleet to meet the needs of Uber and Lyft drivers. We are committed to providing outstanding service and reliable vehicles to keep our clients on the road and earning. As we expand, we’re seeking a meticulous and proactive Administrative Assistant who can also handle some basic bookkeeping tasks.



Position Overview:

This role involves supporting our daily operations, assisting with client communication, managing records, and providing light bookkeeping support. We’re looking for someone organized, detail-oriented, and proactive, with experience in administrative support and a basic understanding of bookkeeping.



Key Responsibilities:



• Coordinate and schedule rental bookings, maintenance, and client communications.

• Track payments and manage invoicing processes.

• Maintain accurate records, including rental agreements, client interactions, and fleet data.

• Assist in preparing reports on fleet usage, maintenance, and customer feedback.

• Perform bookkeeping tasks, including expense tracking and financial report preparation.

• Support social media engagement as needed.



Qualifications:



• Experience in administrative support, customer service, or bookkeeping.

• Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

• Ability to work independently and manage multiple responsibilities.

• Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Google Workspace, and basic accounting software.

• Strong written and verbal communication skills.



To Apply:

Please send a short video introduction, your resume, and a cover letter to 
 (mohamed at 
) with the subject line:

“Applying for Administrative Assistant Role.”

Only applicants who follow all instructions will be considered.
