title: Marketing Manager
description:
About the Role

We are looking for a confident, hands-on Growth Marketing Manager to own our end-to-end investor marketing efforts.



This role is for someone who knows how to build demand, generate qualified leads, and make smart marketing decisions independently—not someone who waits for step-by-step instructions.



If you enjoy blending strategy + execution, care about results, and are comfortable working within financial/compliance guidelines, this role is for you.



Key Responsibilities

• Build and manage investor-focused marketing campaigns (content,
, digital, partnerships, events)

• Develop clear, credible brand messaging for the Company

• Create and manage lead magnets, nurture sequences, and authority content (guides, case studies, webinars)

• D
 which channels, content, and offers to prioritize (within approved budget and compliance rules)

• Track performance and optimize based on data (leads, cost per lead, conversions)

• Work closely with Investor Relations, leadership, and legal/compliance



Required Skills and Experience

• Proven experience in marketing, generating leads, creating pitch decks, one-pagers, and other investor-facing materials

• Strong background in content marketing and positioning

• Experience in B2B, financial services, or real estate marketing is preferred

• Comfortable working within a compliance or regulated environment



Non-Negotiable Must-Haves

• Demonstrated lead generation results

• Ability to work independently and take ownership

• Strong communication and cross-functional collaboration skills



Tech Requirements (non-Negotiables): Applications without device specs/screenshots will not be considered.

• Applicants must meet the following technical requirements and attach device specs/screenshots:

• Laptop or desktop (maximum 3 years service)

• CPU: Intel i5 (10th Gen or higher) or AMD Ryzen 5+

• RAM: 8GB minimum

• Internet: 50–100 Mbps with backup connection

• Working webcam, microphone, and headset



How To Apply

Step 1:
 your application to 

Subject line: Job Application — Marketing Manager



Step 2: Attach the following:

- Updated resume

- Device specs and internet speed screenshots



Step 3: In the
 body, answer briefly (2–3 sentences each):

- Your experience with investor or accredited investor marketing

- Your internet speed (main and backup) and preferred working hours



Tip: Links to a portfolio, sample dashboards, reports, or SOPs you’ve created are a plus.

title: Sales Development Representative
description:
Do you enjoy turning outreach into real connections and helping a business grow? This role is more than just cold calls and
s. You will help a fast-growing US-based construction franchise by finding leads, qualifying them, following up, and moving them through the sales process. You will work closely with the franchise owner and a supportive team, helping with both sales and operational tasks along the way. If this sounds like a fit for you, we’re excited to review your application and meet you!



What Your Days Might Look Like:

- Conduct targeted research to identify high-value leads.

- Make around 50 outbound calls daily to warm-ish B2B leads.

- Qualify leads and manage follow-ups to keep the sales pipeline moving.

- Maintain CRM data, track all communications, tasks, and pipeline updates in HubSpot.

- Create and optimize scripts,
 templates, and outreach sequences.

- Take on operational tasks as needed to support the business.

- Work closely with the owner to prioritize outreach and identify opportunities for process improvements.



Who We Think Will Thrive in This Role:

- 3+ years of experience in outbound sales or cold calling.

- 1+ year of remote work experience.

- Comfortable working directly with a US-based client and open to feedback.

- Self-motivated, consistent in outreach, and confident in building relationships.

- Strong communication, collaboration, and organization skills.

- Proficient in English, multitasking, and using CRMs like HubSpot.

- Experience in commercial construction or as a team lead is a plus.



Why This Role Matters:

Every call,
, and follow-up helps the business grow. You are not just moving leads. You are helping the franchise succeed while learning and growing your skills in a remote environment.



Salary and Benefits:

- Base salary: 55k PHP per month

- Paid time off and paid holidays

- 100% remote

- Flexible schedule and supportive team



Important Reminder:

This company does not ask for any payments or fees as part of the employment process. If you encounter any request for payment, please ignore it and report it immediately. Make sure all communications come from official company
s 

Candidates who apply for this position may be considered for similar roles depending on their qualifications, experience, and current market needs.



When applying, please send your CV and copy and paste this into your
: “I’m excited to be applying to Job #rec4Wur7vrdBxLYyI!” This will let us know what job you’re applying for and show us that you read this entire job description (attention to detail is everything). Thanks and hope to hear from you soon!

If you are a motivated and detail-oriented individual with a passion for healthcare administration.

description:
Attention, Rockstars! We’re looking for a full-time Executive Assistant. This role provides high-level administrative support to the CEO, ensuring the smooth operation of daily activities. This role involves managing schedules, coordinating meetings, handling communications, and performing a wide range of administrative tasks to support executives in their strategic responsibilities. The Executive Assistant acts as a key point of contact and is responsible for maintaining confidentiality, ensuring efficient workflow, and managing critical tasks with professionalism and discretion.



Responsibilities:

s, and visitors, and directing inquiries as appropriate.

Coordinate meetings, conferences, and events, including preparing agendas, arranging logistics, and ensuring all materials are available.

Prepare and edit correspondence, reports, presentations, and other documents on behalf of the executive.

Handle confidential information with the utmost discretion and ensure sensitive documents are securely maintained.

Assist with special projects, conducting research, gathering data, and preparing reports as required by the executive.

Qualifications/Requirements:

Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a professional and polished demeanor.

Strong attention to detail and accuracy in completing tasks.

High level of discretion and confidentiality when handling sensitive information.

Proficiency in GSuite (Doc, Sheet, Slides, Drive) and Zoom Workspace and familiarity with office management tools and software.

Ability to work independently and proactively, with a strong sense of initiative.

Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with executives, staff, and external contacts.

title: Cold Caller / Appointment Setter (SDR) – Commercial Cleaning
description:
You must have experienced in appointment setter/ cold calling and experience in go high level. 

We are commercial cleaning company is looking for a Cold Caller / Appointment Setter (SDR) to call lead lists into qualified walkthrough appointments for the sales team.



This is a long-term role for someone who is confident on the phone, organized in a CRM, and hungry to earn more based on performance.



Responsibilities



Daily Calling & Outreach

 • Make outbound calls to businesses from provided lead lists and CRM

 • Follow a clear script to:

 • Introduce the company and services

 • Ask qualifying questions (type of facility, size, cleaning frequency, current provider, contract timing)

 • Identify pain points with their current cleaning solution

 • Book walkthrough appointments for the sales/operations team

 • Send follow-up
s and SMS through the CRM to confirm and remind appointments

 • Handle light objections and keep conversations professional, friendly, and confident



CRM & Pipeline Management

 • Work from the CRM (e.g., GoHighLevel or similar) – no loose spreadsheets

 • Update lead status after every call (New, Contacted, Qualified, Walkthrough Set, Not Interested, etc.)

 • Add clear notes so the sales team knows what was discussed

 • Tag and mark leads that are not a fit (too small, residential only, wrong contact, etc.)

 • Schedule follow-ups for “call back later,” “renewing soon,” and other warm opportunities



Reporting & Communication

 • Attend short weekly check-ins via Zoom with the team

 • Send simple daily reports:

 • Number of calls made

 • Number of conversations

 • Number of qualified appointments booked and confirmed

 • Feedback on common objections or patterns you’re hearing

 • Suggest script or process improvements based on real conversations





Ideal Candidate

 • Strong spoken English – clear, confident, and easy to understand

 • Previous experience in:

 • B2B cold calling, and/or

 • Appointment setting, and/or

 • SDR/inside sales for service-based businesses (cleaning, home services, marketing, real estate, etc.)

 • Comfortable making 60–80 outbound calls per day

 • Able to follow a script AND adjust naturally in conversation

 • Familiar with any CRM (GoHighLevel, HubSpot, Salesforce, etc.) – willing to learn a new one if needed

 • Organized and disciplined: updates notes and statuses in real time

 • Thick-skinned and positive: not afraid of “no” and keeps going





What Success Looks Like



You are successful in this role if you consistently:

 • Hit 60–80 dials per day

 • Book 12–20 qualified walkthrough appointments per month

 • Keep no-show rates low by confirming and reminding prospects

 • Maintain clean, accurate records in the CRM so the team always knows:

 • Who has been contacted

 • Who is interested

 • Who is not a fit and why





Schedule

 • 40 hours per week (can start part-time and increase if it’s a good fit)

 • Must be able to work during U.S. business hours (Eastern Time overlap) for calling windows





Compensation



This role is paid with a mix of base + performance:

 • Base Pay: $640/month

 • Bonus: $20 for each qualified appointment that actually holds (not just booked)

 • Commission: 5% of the first month’s contract value on any contract over $2,500/month that comes from your appointments



If you perform well, your earnings can grow quickly month over month.





How to Apply



Please include:

 1. A short note about your cold calling or appointment setting experience

 2. A brief audio or Loom/video sample (1–2 minutes) of you introducing yourself as if you were calling a facility manager about commercial cleaning services

 3. Your availability (hours per week and time zone)

EST time zone required

title: Social Media & YouTube Marketing Manager (Real Estate)
description:
We’re looking for a strategic Social Media & YouTube Marketing Manager, not just a content poster.



This is a long-term, full-time role for someone who understands brand building, YouTube growth, video strategy, ads, and AI-powered marketing—someone who can think ahead, analyze data, and help grow a recognizable real estate brand with minimal supervision.



This role is not task-based. You will own the marketing direction, especially for YouTube and social platforms.



CORE FOCUS AREAS (VERY IMPORTANT)

- Brand Building – 60%

- Video Editing & Content Execution – 30%

- Other - 10%



PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES



1. YouTube

YouTube is our #1 growth channel.

You will be responsible for end-to-end YouTube management, including:



Long-form YouTube Content:

- Create high-converting thumbnails

- Write SEO-optimized titles, descriptions, and tags

- Use VidIQ for keyword research, optimization, and competitive analysis

- Upload, schedule, and publish videos

- Track performance, analytics, CTR, watch time, retention, and growth

- Continuously improve content based on data



YouTube Shorts:

- Repurpose long-form content into Shorts

- Edit, format, caption, and schedule Shorts

- Optimize hooks, pacing, and visuals for engagement



YouTube Ad

- Manage YouTube ad campaigns

- Support creative testing, hooks, thumbnails, and targeting

- Monitor performance and suggest improvements



2. Instagram &

You’ll manage and grow our presence across Meta platforms with a marketing-first mindset, not just posting.

- Create and edit Reels (intermediate level required)

- Design and schedule posts, carousels, and stories

- Write captions with strong hooks and CTAs

- Applicants must use Real Estate SMM

- Boost posts and manage sponsored content

- Handle Meta Ads at an intermediate level:

· Campaign setup

· Scheduling

· Basic optimization and monitoring

- Ensure consistency in branding, tone, and visuals



3. Google Presence & Analytics

- Manage Google My Business:

· Posts

· Updates

· Reviews

· Products/services

- Monitor Google Analytics and performance data

- Track how content and traffic support brand visibility and lead generation



4. Marketing Manager Responsibilities

You are not just executing — you are thinking like a manager.

- Plan content calendars aligned with business goals

- Propose campaigns and growth ideas

- Analyze what’s working and what’s not

- Report insights clearly and simply

- Coordinate with leadership on strategy and priorities



5. AI & Innovation

We expect you to use AI intelligently, not blindly.

- Use tools like ChatGPT, Canva AI, AI video tools, etc.

- Speed up workflows while maintaining quality

- Suggest better systems, tools, and processes

- Stay updated on trends in AI, marketing, and content creation



BASIC REQUIREMENTS

- Minimum 2 years of experience in Social Media Marketing or Digital Marketing

- Real estate experience is a strong advantage

- Proven experience managing YouTube channels

- Strong understanding of branding and content strategy

- Intermediate video editing skills (Reels, Shorts)

- Intermediate experience with Meta Ads

- Comfortable working independently with minimal supervision

- Strong communication, organization, and time management skills



WHO THIS ROLE IS FOR

- Someone who thinks strategically

- Someone who understands YouTube as a growth engine

- Someone who cares about branding, consistency, and results

- Someone who takes ownership and doesn’t wait for instructions



- This role is not for beginners

- This role is not for task-only executors



COMPANY OVERVIEW

We are a BC, Canada–based real estate team focused on modern marketing, strong branding, and long-term growth. We value ownership, creativity, and people who think ahead.



HOW TO APPLY

To apply, please:

Send your resume / CV

Include portfolio links:

YouTube channels managed

Don't use "Rockstar VA" in your application. Read carefully again to find the correct term to use.

Thumbnails you’ve created

Reels / Shorts

Ads or campaigns you’ve worked on



We’re not looking for “just an SMM.”

We’re looking for someone who can build a brand and grow an audience.



- IMPORTANT: SKILLS TEST / TRIAL TASK -

We’ve hired many SMMs before, and not everyone performs at the level they claim.

Because of this, we will hire based on performance, not interviews.

Shortlisted applicants will complete a practical test.

The fastest and highest-quality submission will be hired.

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
Customer Service Representative (Sales Rep)



Owyhee Environmental (U.S.-Based Pest Control Company)

Location: Remote

We are hiring a Remote Inside Sales Representative to handle inbound and outbound sales, respond to leads, close deals, and support customer retention. This role is revenue-focused and requires strong phone skills, fast response times, and consistent follow-up.



Key Responsibilities

- Respond to website,
, and social media leads within 15 minutes

- Follow up on unclosed leads using a structured process

- Upsell and cross-sell services to existing customers

- Generate sales by reactivating past customers and following up with door-to-door leads

Requirements

Performance Expectations

How to Apply:

description:

We’re looking for a creative, logic-driven thinker to help build and refine games inside the Loquiz platform. No coding required — just curiosity, creativity, and a willingness to learn.

This is a flexible, remote-friendly opportunity with room to grow into a project-based role as your skills develop.



What You’ll Do

* Edit and improve existing Loquiz games

* Build logic-driven challenges, puzzles, and interactive experiences

* Test game flow and user experience

* Collaborate with our creative team to bring new adventure concepts to life

* Eventually design full games independently



What We’re Looking For

* Creative problem-solver

* Detail-oriented and organized

Compensation & Structure

* Remote position

If you love the idea of blending creativity, logic, and experience design — we’d love to hear from you.

Apply by sending a short note about why this role excites you and any examples of puzzles, games, or creative projects you've worked on.

Let’s build something awesome.

title: ???? Senior Dropshipping Customer Support Specialist (NL/BE Market)
description:
Senior Shopify Dropshipping Customer Support Strategist (NL/BE Market)



Remote | Part-Time | $5/hour Starting Rate + Performance Bonuses + Fast Growth



We are a fast-scaling e-commerce brand operating in the Netherlands/Belgium market.



Within 7 days, we scaled from €0 to €10,000 per day in revenue. Advertising is temporarily paused due to Chinese New Year. From early March, we resume aggressive scaling with high projected volume.



We are not hiring a general VA. We are hiring a high-level dropshipping operator who understands profit protection, refund control, and chargeback prevention at scale.



If you have real $100k+/month experience, this role will feel familiar.



Who This Role Is For



Apply only if you:



Have 5+ years of dropshipping customer support experience



Have worked in stores doing at least $100,000 per month



Are currently involved in one or more stores at that level



Have hands-on experience with China fulfillment and returns to Asia



Understand how refund rate and chargeback rate impact scaling



Can handle 40–80+ tickets per day during scaling periods



This is not entry-level. We are hiring someone who already understands the business model deeply.



What You Must Master



You confidently handle:



7–12 business day shipping times



Delayed tracking activation



“Product not as expected” complaints



Quality issues



Refund pressure



Chargeback threats



Escalating customers



You understand that:



Returns to Asia are rarely profitable



Default refund strategy = 20?shback + customer keeps product



Maximum without approval = 30?shback



Above 30% requires manager approval



If cashback is refused, the customer is responsible for return shipping to our Asia warehouse at their own cost and risk



The objective is always: Customer keeps product + prevent chargeback + minimize refund rate



Chargeback ratio must stay below payment processor thresholds.



We operate strategically, not emotionally.



Strategic Contribution (Mandatory)



This role requires more than ticket handling.



You are expected to actively contribute proven strategies from other $100k+/month dropshipping stores, including:



Refund reduction techniques



Chargeback prevention systems



Communication frameworks



Workflow optimizations



Sharing high-performing strategies is mandatory.



One-time bonus payments will be issued for strategies that measurably improve profitability.



We reward operators who think like owners.



Responsibilities



Handle incoming
s via Google Workspace



Respond to all
s within maximum 12 hours



Apply the 20–30?shback strategy correctly



Reduce refund rate



Prevent chargebacks



Report recurring issues



Suggest system improvements



Performance will be measured and tracked.



Experience Verification (Required)



Your application must include:



Stores you worked for (revenue range required)



Your exact responsibilities



Average number of tickets handled per day



The refund policy used in that store



Your personal KPIs



Your average refund rate



Your strategy for preventing chargebacks



You must be willing to verify your experience via short video call or recorded explanation.



If you cannot prove real $100k+/month involvement, please do not apply.



Compensation and Growth



Starting rate: $5/hour



7-day paid trial period



Hourly rate increase after proven performance



Ongoing performance bonuses based on refund rate reduction, chargeback reduction, profit protection, and efficiency under volume



This role grows with results.



This Role Is Not For You If



You rely on copy-paste empathy responses



You always give full refunds to avoid bad reviews



You are afraid of escalation



You cannot protect margins under pressure



You do not understand how scaling affects payment processor risk



We are looking for strategic operators, not emotional responders.



Application Process



To apply for this position:



1. Start your application with the word SCALING

2. Include all required experience details listed above

3. Send your full application directly to: 

4. At the top of your application, clearly include your preferred contact method (WhatsApp,
, etc.) for interview scheduling



Applications that do not follow these instructions will not be reviewed.



We are building a serious scaling operation. If you are an experienced dropshipping support operator who understands profit protection at scale, we look forward to reviewing your application.

title: Business development manager
description:
Business Development Manager – Managed AI services



About the Role

We’re building a managed AI agent service that helps businesses reduce repetitive admin and run more smoothly.

This role is about selling operational clarity, not software licences or hype. You’ll speak to business owners and managers, understand how their work actually flows, and help them decide whether managed AI agents would remove friction.

This is consultative selling, not high-pressure closing.

What You’ll Be Doing

Reaching out to UK-based businesses (primarily via LinkedIn and
)

Booking and running short discovery calls

Using a simple assessment to identify operational pain points

Explaining our managed AI agent service in plain English

Qualifying opportunities honestly (saying “no” when it’s not a fit)

Closing clients into a clear setup + monthly retainer model

Maintaining relationships and spotting opportunities for add-ons

You’ll sell outcomes (less admin, fewer interruptions), not technical features.

Who You’re Talking To

Owners and directors of small to mid-sized businesses

Professional services, agencies, property, admin-heavy services

Typically 5–30 staff, growing, busy, slightly chaotic

These buyers value trust and clarity over clever sales talk.

What We’re Looking For

You don’t need deep AI knowledge. You do need strong business sense.

You’re likely a good fit if you:

Are comfortable speaking with business owners

Ask good questions and listen properly

Can explain complex ideas simply

Are calm, professional, and organised

Prefer consultative selling to aggressive tactics

Experience

B2B sales experience (services or solutions preferred)

Comfortable with LinkedIn outreach and video/phone calls

Experience selling retainers or managed services is a big plus

What This Role Is Not

Not cold-calling all day

Not transactional SaaS selling

Not “AI evangelism”

Not commission-at-all-costs culture

How We Sell

Short operational assessment first

Clear scope and pricing

Full setup fee upfront

Monthly managed service thereafter

Long-term relationships, not quick churn

Compensation

Base + commission (open to structure)

Commission on setup and ongoing retainer

Remote-friendly

How to Apply

Send:

A short note on why this role suits you

Brief background in B2B sales

One-Line Summary (For Job Boards)

Help businesses remove operational friction using calm, managed AI services.

title: Social Media Marketing Youtube Manager
description:
We are seeking a talented and experienced YouTube specialist to join our team. If you are passionate about video editing, content creation, and growing YouTube channels, this role is perfect for you.



Position Overview:

As the YouTube Specialist, you will be responsible for managing and growing our YouTube channel. You will edit both long-form and short-form videos, ensuring they align with our brand and engage our audience. Your expertise in YouTube growth strategies will be essential to driving our channel's success.



Key Responsibilities:



Video Editing:



Edit long-form videos and short-form videos for our YouTube channel.

Ensure videos are visually appealing, engaging, and aligned with our brand's messaging and style.

YouTube Channel Management:



Oversee all aspects of our YouTube channel, including content planning, publishing, and optimization.

Develop and implement strategies to grow the channel's subscriber base and increase video views.

Content Creation:



Collaborate with the content team to brainstorm and create compelling video content that resonates with our audience.

Stay updated on YouTube trends and best practices to produce trendy and relevant content.

Audience Engagement:



Engage with our YouTube audience by responding to comments and messages.

Foster a sense of community and build strong relationships with viewers.

Analytics and Reporting:



Monitor and analyze YouTube analytics to track the performance of videos and the overall channel.

Provide regular reports and insights to inform content strategy and decision-making.

Qualifications:



Proven experience as a YouTube specialist or similar role, with a strong understanding of the YouTube platform and growth strategies.

Proficiency in video editing software (e.g., Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro).

Ability to produce both long-form and short-form video content.

Strong communication and collaboration skills.

Creative mindset with a passion for storytelling and content creation.

Knowledge of YouTube SEO and best practices for optimizing video content.



How to apply:

To apply for this position, please send your resume and portfolio showcasing your previous work and put it on the subject line "TOOL LINE." Those without any of the following requirements will not be entertained. This is to ensure that you read all the qualifications and are good at following details.

title: E-Commerce Manager – Amazon, Walmart, Wayfair & Shopify and more
description:
About Us



We operate multiple product divisions with established manufacturing, strong margins, and differentiated products.



Plastair – Manufactured hose assemblies and industrial products, primarily B2B and OEM driven



DeeVa – Consumer and therapeutic products, including branded DTC and marketplace sales



PlastairFyre – Outdoor and metal products with growing ecommerce potential



These divisions already have real products, customers, and supply chains in place. What is missing is a unified, disciplined ecommerce engine that can scale profitably across marketplaces and DTC without daily owner involvement.



Role Overview



We are seeking a senior E-Commerce Manager to own and scale our ecommerce business across Amazon, Walmart, Wayfair, and Shopify. This is a management and decision-making role, not a task execution role.



You will be responsible for building and leading the ecommerce function, making commercial decisions, hiring and developing a capable team, and delivering profitable growth. You will operate with a high degree of autonomy and are expected to treat the business as if it were your own.



Core Responsibilities



Team Building and Leadership



Design the ecommerce org structure required to win across marketplaces and DTC



Hire, onboard, and manage internal tea
mbers and external specialists



Set clear roles, expectations, KPIs, and accountability for all ecommerce functions



Coach and develop the team so execution does not depend on any single person



Make hiring, performance, and replacement decisions as needed



Ecommerce Ownership and Execution



Full ownership of ecommerce revenue, profitability, and growth



Define ecommerce strategy across Amazon, Walmart, Wayfair, and Shopify



Build, hire, and manage internal staff and external partners (ads, creative, catalog, operations)



Own marketplace and DTC performance, pricing, promotions, margin, and inventory health



Establish SOPs, KPIs, and reporting for all ecommerce functions



Oversee day-to-day ecommerce operations while staying focused on strategy and outcomes



Make data-driven decisions at the SKU, category, and channel level



Reduce owner involvement by fully owning decisions and execution through your team



What This Role Is



A management and leadership role



Accountable for profit and sustainable growth



Focused on decision-making, prioritization, and accountability



A long-term role with room to grow into full ownership of the ecommerce division



What This Role Is Not



Not a consulting or advisory position



Not a task-only execution role



Not a part-time or side engagement



Required Experience



Proven experience managing ecommerce channels (Amazon required, others preferred)



Demonstrated ownership of revenue outcomes, not just tasks



Experience building and managing teams



Strong understanding of ads, listings, pricing, inventory, and fulfillment



Comfortable making decisions with imperfect information



Experience reporting on and improving metrics such as revenue growth, margin, ACOS, ROAS, conversion, and inventory turns



What We’re Looking For



Someone who is comfortable being accountable



Someone who makes decisions and stands behind them



Someone who thinks like an owner, not an assistant



Someone who values systems, structure, and execution discipline



Someone who wants to build something long-term



How to Apply



To be considered, please submit:



Your resume



Links to ecommerce brands, stores, or marketplaces you directly managed, including specific results



Optional: a short Loom video introducing yourself and one relevant case study

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
About the Role



We're looking for a Full Stack Developer to join our client’s growing engineering team and help drive innovation in their core fintech platform. This is an exciting opportunity to work on impactful, customer-facing features within a modern banking and payments environment.



You’ll be collaborating directly with the Head of Engineering, as well as cross-functional partners in Product and Design, you’ll help build and scale the integration layer and user-facing components that power seamless, reliable financial transactions. From cashback logic and Visa payment processing to reporting systems and batch jobs for debt collection, you’ll work on mission-critical features that directly impact the customer experience. Beyond backend development, you’ll also contribute to refining the financial UX and UI, ensuring customers enjoy an intuitive and effortless digital banking journey. 



If you're eager to work in a fast-paced environment and build elegant, efficient solutions for real-world financial challenges, we’d love to connect with you.



Key Responsibilities



Fintech Systems Development



Design, develop, and maintain core services within the banking and payment integrations layer.

Build and support features including cashback logic, transaction processing (e.g. Visa), and scheduled batch jobs for backend operations like reporting and debt collection.

Ensure robust, performant code and smooth deployment pipelines using modern cloud infrastructure.

Work closely with Product Managers and Designers to translate requirements into high-quality technical solutions.



Customer-Facing Feature Enhancements



Bring intuitive financial experiences to life by transforming UX/UI concepts into polished product features.

Continuously refine flows related to transaction histories, cashback programs, and user balances to enhance usability and clarity.

Contribute to improving customer engagement and satisfaction through thoughtful software development.



Team Collaboration and Growth



Share ideas and propose technical improvements to existing systems and workflows.

Participate in regular planning sessions and code reviews to support team cohesion and knowledge sharing.

Take on additional tasks as needed to support broader product or engineering goals.





Other Responsibilities



Make necessary process suggestions and improvements which can help the team.

Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed. 

Perform other related tasks and duties that may be assigned by the client later on.



About You



2–3 years of experience as a Software Engineer.

Solid background in software development and system design.

Proficiency in Golang, AWS ECS, and Terraform, or equivalent programming languages and cloud infrastructure tools.

Experience working closely with Product and Design teams to bring product roadmaps to life.

Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced fintech environment.

title: Senior Front-End / Mobile Software Engineer (React Native)
description:
About the Role



We’re looking for a Senior Front-End / Mobile Software Engineer (React Native) to join our client’s growing fintech engineering team and help build high-quality, customer-facing digital financial products.



In this role, you will lead the development of mobile applications that power real-world financial experiences, including transaction history views, cashback programs, account balances, and reporting dashboards. You’ll work closely with Engineering, Product, and Design teams to deliver scalable, performant, and intuitive mobile experiences that directly impact customer trust and engagement.





This is a hands-on senior role suited to experienced engineers who enjoy working in fintech, payments, or data-driven products, and who want to influence both technical direction and user experience across iOS and Android platforms.





Tech Stack



Front end: React Native (TypeScript)

Backend: Golang (API-driven services)

Cloud & DevOps: AWS, CI/CD pipelines



Key Responsibilities



Front-End Systems & Product Development



Design, build, and maintain modern mobile applications using React Native, TypeScript, and JavaScript.

Translate complex financial data and backend Golang APIs into clear, responsive, and user-friendly mobile interfaces.

Own client-side architecture decisions including component design, state management, navigation, and performance optimisation.

Ensure high standards of code quality, testing, accessibility, and maintainability across mobile platforms.



Customer-Facing Experience & UX Excellence



Collaborate closely with Product Managers and Designers to turn UX/UI designs into production-ready mobile features.

Build and enhance customer flows related to transactions, cashback rewards, balances, and financial insights.

Optimise mobile performance across iOS and Android devices, accounting for different screen sizes and device capabilities.

Advocate for best-in-class mobile UX while balancing technical and business requirements.



Technical Leadership & Collaboration



Provide technical guidance and mentorship to other engineers.

Participate in code reviews, sprint planning, and architectural discussions.

Proactively identify opportunities to improve front-end tooling, workflows, and development processes.

Take ownership of key client-application initiatives and contribute to broader engineering goals.



Other Responsibilities



Make necessary process suggestions and improvements which can help the team.

Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.

Perform other related tasks and duties that may be assigned by the client later on.



About You



5+ years of professional experience as a Front-End Engineer, Mobile Engineer, or Software Engineer.

Strong expertise in React Native, TypeScript, and JavaScript.

Proven experience building complex, data-driven mobile applications, ideally in fintech, payments, SaaS, or consumer-facing platforms.

Deep understanding of mobile application architecture, performance optimisation, accessibility, and best practices.

Experience collaborating closely with Product and Design teams in an agile environment.

Comfortable working with API-driven backends, ideally built with Golang.

Strong communication skills and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.

Experience with cloud platforms, CI/CD pipelines, or AWS is highly regarded.

Experience shipping and maintaining apps on the Apple App Store and Google Play Store is a plus





Finer Details



Schedule: TBD

Start Date: ASAP

title: LinkedIn Ads Specialist (B2B Lead Generation)
description:
About Us

We are a commercial services company based in the U.S. working with property managers, facility managers, and commercial buildings. We’re looking for a skilled LinkedIn Ads Specialist to help us generate qualified B2B leads (not just clicks or followers).

This is a remote position and we are open to hiring talent from the Philippines.



Your Goal

Set up, manage, and optimize LinkedIn Ads campaigns that generate high-quality B2B leads for our commercial services.



Responsibilities

- Create and manage LinkedIn Ads campaigns (Lead Forms + Landing Pages)

- Research and build B2B audiences (job titles, industries, company size, locations)

- Write or help improve ad copy and offers

- Optimize campaigns for:

  Cost per lead (CPL)

  Lead quality

  Conversion rate

- Monitor and improve performance weekly

- Provide simple performance reports focused on results

- Test new creatives, audiences, and offers



Requirements

- Proven experience with LinkedIn Ads (B2B lead generation)

- Experience targeting:

- Property Managers

- Facility Managers

- Operations / Decision Makers

- Can show examples or case studies of past results

- Understands B2B marketing and lead generation

- Speaks and writes good English

- Organized, reliable, and results-focused



Not a Fit If You…

- Only do organic social media posting

- Focus on likes, followers, or branding only

- Don’t have experience with paid LinkedIn Ads

- Can’t explain how you measure lead quality and ROI



Job Type

- Remote

- Freelance / Part-time to start

- Potential for long-term work if results are good



Pay

Open to:

Hourly rate or monthly retainer

Please include your expected rate in your application.



Bonus (Not Required)

- Experience with U.S. clients

- Experience with B2B services, real estate, facilities, or commercial businesses

- Experience with lead forms, funnels, or CRM integrations



Application Instructions:



1. To be considered, please follow these steps carefully:

Change the subject line of your application to: “I am the right specialist for LinkedIn”



2. At the very top of your message, include a short self-evaluation by rating your proficiency on a scale of 1–10 (1 = low, 10 = high) in each of the following areas:

   - B2B Campaigns

   - LinkedIn Ads Experience

   - Commercial Accounts / B2B Clients

   - Your rate (please specify hourly or monthly and include the amount)

title: Performance Marketing Specialist – Lead Generation & Website Conversions
description:
We are hiring a Paid Ads Expert to join our marketing agency. This role is focused entirely on performance. Your job is to generate qualified leads and website purchases across multiple client accounts.



This is not a brand awareness or engagement role. We are looking for someone who understands funnels, tracking, attribution, and ROI.



Your Mission:

Plan, launch, optimize, and scale paid advertising campaigns that produce measurable business results for multiple clients at the same time.



Responsibilities:



1. Develop full-funnel paid ad strategies for e-commerce and B2B clients.



2. Plan and manage campaigns on Meta Ads 
 and Instagram) and Google Ads. TikTok Ads experience is a plus.



3. Build conversion-focused campaigns optimized for website purchases and lead form submissions.



4. Structure cold, warm, and retargeting campaigns properly.



5. Set up and manage tracking systems including Meta Pixel, Google Tag Manager, GA4, and conversion events.



6. Implement proper attribution using UTMs and event tracking.



7. Conduct A/B testing on creatives, audiences, offers, and landing pages.



8. Monitor and optimize key metrics such as cost per lead, cost per acquisition, ROAS, and conversion rates.



9. Provide weekly performance reports with data insights and action plans.



10. Collaborate with designers, video editors, and account managers to align creatives with campaign objectives.



11. Handle multiple client accounts simultaneously while maintaining performance standards.



Requirements:



1. Proven experience running conversion-focused paid campaigns for e-commerce and B2B lead generation.



2. Ability to show real results with clear metrics such as CPL, CPA, and ROAS.



3. Strong understanding of audience targeting, funnel structure, and retargeting strategies.



4. Hands-on experience setting up tracking and analytics correctly.



5. Data-driven decision making and structured optimization approach.



6. Ability to manage time and performance across multiple active campaigns.



7. Clear communication and reporting skills.



What Success Looks Like:



1. Consistent generation of qualified leads at target CPL.



2. Profitable website purchases at sustainable CPA.



3. Clear performance reporting and proactive optimization.



4. Ability to manage multiple client campaigns without performance decline.



Compensation:

Open to full-time monthly retainer. Please include your rate structure and availability.



To Apply:



1. Send 2 to 3 case studies showing campaign structure and results.



2. Briefly explain how you would structure a paid campaign to generate 50 qualified leads in 14 days.



3. Include the subject line: "Performance Growth Operator"



We are looking for someone who measures success in revenue and leads, not impressions.

title: Inbound Sales Development Representative (Live Transfers – Social Media Leads – Full Time)
description:

You will be responsible for calling inbound leads immediately, qualifying them, and live transferring qualified prospects to our closer.



We use GoHighLevel CRM and structured follow-up systems.



If you are competitive, disciplined, and understand dialing metrics, this role is for you.

• Call new inbound leads within 5 minutes of submission

• Execute structured 5-day follow-up cadence (calls + SMS)

• Qualify prospects using script and criteria

• Live transfer qualified leads to closer

• Log activity properly inside GoHighLevel

• Maintain clean pipeline and dispositions

• Track and report daily metrics



???? Performance Expectations



• Fast speed-to-lead

• Strong qualification rate

• Consistent live transfers



We are looking for someone who understands:



• Dials per day

? Requirements

• Experience using dialers

???? Compensation

Bonus per qualified live transfer



Monthly performance bonuses



Long-term opportunity with growth inside the company.



???? To Apply
